Reviews.Title: “still has it's charm”
Reviews.Author: ArvinLee
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 years ago, and havent had the luck of getting the reservation until last march. so it was my 2nd time at gramont. Hotel: Great location, lots of resto, close to metro. staffs: uber friendly. had nice conversation with them. and when i told them that i bumped my head on the low beam in the hallway, Sandra was really apologetic and gave me a plate of fresh fruits. rooms small yet comfy. i just wish it has more english TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: sashalucky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked to stay at Hotel Gramont for 3 days. We were coming from a stay in London. Unfortunately my husband took ill and we had to change plans and head home. I emailed Hotel Gramont to advise them of our cancellation, well aware that we would have to pay for the first night. Aurelie emailed me back and said that she was very sorry we had to cancel our stay, hoped my husband would be better soon and that she had put the room onto the internet and managed to rent it out. While it wasn't the same rate as we had booked for, I now only had to pay the difference, a savings of 144 Euros. There are not many places today that would have bothered to do this and I am very appreciative of the extra effort this hotel went to. I am only sorry that I was unable to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Bayjb
Reviews.Content: Found the Hotel Gramont through TripAdvisor so I am more than happy to recount my experience there for other readers. Overall, my experience at Hotel Gramont was really positive. First, the location is great, near the Opera house, Louve and two Metro stops. Could not be easier to get to/from the hotel. It's located on a side street in a business area so while it's a little noisy in the morning, it empties out at night and weekends are quiet. I walked down the street and in the area day and night and felt safe as a solo, female traveler. Second, service. I saw it was highly ranked for service and it absolutely lives up to it. Aurelie and staff were very helpful and polite by email and in person. I cannot thank them enough for helping coordinate airport transit, museum tickets and of course, restaurants. I fully credit them with getting me reservations at some amazing places in Paris. THANK YOU! Third, rooms. As a solo traveler, I booked one of the single rooms and was really, pleasantly surprised by it. Yes, it is small, but compared to other single European hotel rooms, I thought it was actually pretty spacious. The room gives space to move around, and the beds are pretty comfortable. The bathroom is modern and you have actual space in the shower. I was very pleased with the room. The only downside to them is that the walls, doors are pretty thin so you hear everything in the hallways, which can be a little noisy at night or very early morning. I also love that the front desk if 24 hours, which made me feel safe coming home at night from dinner, etc. Although I mentioned location is great (which it is), the only downside to it is that being a business area also means there isn't the cute charm of corner local businesses for breakfast and dinner. If you want those things, you have to travel for them. Not the biggest deterrent, but if that's what you want, it's not here. Overall, I would absolutely recommend this place to other US travelers (especially solo ones) and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, would stay there agains”
Reviews.Author: AntonellaP67
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a side street, near Rue di Italians walking distance to metro, 2 stations. Also great places to eat. Rooms was clean and tidy. A touch small but that is Paris. No problem. Free wifi and staff especially Aurelie was fantastic. Spoke English and was most helpful. No problems in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff of Europe, by far.”
Reviews.Author: guilherme_olv
Reviews.Content: Well, the hotel is very good, location is very good, breakfast is very good, rooms are also very good. But the main difference from Gramont to other hotels in all across Europe is the excellent staff. All of them are always with smiles in their faces ready to help you in anything you could possibly want. I 100% recommend Hotel Gramont for all kind of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Smarties888
Reviews.Content: i was sick with tonsilitis and the staff were fab they helped me so much with what to take for my pain and were to go for natural remedies. They were so lovley in this hotel the manager was just adorable. Rooms a little small but thats europe. very clean . take the highest floor and face the side street for a room. dont miss this place its a resonable price and worth the money "). close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilove2travel805
Reviews.Content: If I could keep this hotel a secret, I would. However, I did find out about it from Tripadvisor so I must tell you that this place is special. From the time you inquire about reservations until you check out, the staff treats you with such kindness and helpfulness. The facility is very comfortable, the location is great and the service is above and beyond. We have stayed here twice and plan another trip soon. Sandra and Aurelie are so helpful and nice. This is our home is Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lizpani
Reviews.Content: Sandra, Aurelie and the rest of the staff did it again! They are so helpful and accommodating! We have stayed at Hotel Gramont for three years each March. You will not find a better hotel in Paris. They have rooms that can accommodate three people and rooms that will accommodate four people. This is quite unusual in Paris. There are two metro stops VERY close, one at the end of the block in both directions. Richlieu-Drouot and Quatre Septembre. Plus Opera is two/three blocks if you need more/different metro lines. It is on a quiet street, so street noise is not a problem. The most noise is from other guests slamming doors. They give guests coffee for free, but eating breakfast is pretty expensive. I'm sure it is good, but I've never eaten there. This is terrible to say - just call me an ugly American - but there is this AMAZING Starbucks that looks like a luxurious hotel interior complete with chandeliers and roman columns and painted cherubs on the ceiling. It is right on Blvd Itailiens on your way to Opera. The exterior is black marble. Cheap breakfast, but if you object to eating at Starbucks while in Paris, just go in and see the place. I promise it is worth a few minutes of your time :)

Reviews.Title: “Stunning gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carien D
Reviews.Content: The location of thishotel is great, very close to two metro stations and walking distance from the Louvre. Rooms are very clean and comfortable. This hotel's biggest asset is it's helpful and friendly staff. Sandra and Nicci helpes us plan our trips for each day and after a day of sightseeing, it felt like going home in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: 707ParisBound
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff-warm, knowledgeable, helpful. Felt like home away from home. Rooms were very clean and sweet. Bed linens were exceptionally sanitary. Location perfect-on a quiet street but close to two metros. Also if you just walk a few blocks in either directions, you come upon many restaurants, cafes, wine bars, shopping, and street markets. Welcoming amenities like candy in the room was a nice surprise. Wifi is free. I will come back again for the the wonderful rooms and the STAFF!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet deal”
Reviews.Author: Karim81Dubai
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is really really good, it's one minute away from the metro stations, so the location is ace. On top of that the rooms are clean and nice, the staff is super helpful and most importantly the hotel is a quiet street where you don't sleep on the sound of scooters and sirens. It is a few minutes away from Rue St Anne where all the awesome Japanese restaurants are located and 3 metro stops away from Le Marais. So yes definitely a good hotel, and for the price it's right on the money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ole R
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Gramont - everyone at the hotel was amazing. The hotel is close to everything yet on a quiet side street. We could not have asked for more - highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bon!”
Reviews.Author: bjkost
Reviews.Content: This small and quite charming hotel in the Opera district of Paris is a real gem! The staff is welcoming, friendly, English speaking and always very helpful. The beds are comfortable and the everything from top to bottom is immaculately clean. The location is in a great section of Paris near 2 Metro stops making it so easy to get around. The ratings are quite accurate and I am very glad I stayed here and would certainly again

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place and super staff”
Reviews.Author: Britcrit
Reviews.Content: Arriving 4 hours before check in the very helpful Nikki found me a clean room on the 5th floor. OK after a week on US hotels the rooms are small and the bathroom like a cruise ship..however it was immaculately clean and a everything worked including free Wifi. On the weekend the street is quiet, not so in the week, but it is so well located that is the compromise. The cheerful, pleasant front desk staff made all the difference. Booked restaurants I had chosen in advance of my visit and then taxis and anything else whilst on property. $1,059 fro 3 nights is expensive by US standards but bang for buck in Paris. I will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: iain j
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel superbly located in the theatre district of Paris. What sets it apart from other hotels is the staff. From reception right through to the night porters, all are friendly and very very helpful, polite and down to earth. From a personal point I would love to keep this hotel a little secret to ensure I can get back there! However, the staff deserve better and I will finish by saying I fully recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to feel at home in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Hotel Gramont for reasonable rates at a convenient location with the friendliest & most efficient staff!”
Reviews.Author: nikbet86
Reviews.Content: From the time the hotel confirmed our online reservations, we have been afforded the most professional and personalized service. Our ride which Hotel Gramont arranged for us was waiting upon arrival at the airport and the staff checked us in immediately even though we arrived the hotel 2 hours early. There were fresh croissants, hot coffee and tea, bottled water even candies at the reception room for the guests every day during our stay. I travelled with 3 family members and stayed at the quadruple room which is in fact 2 adjoining rooms on the 5th floor with a full bathroom (toilet & shower) in each room. The size of each room is sufficient for our needs, even found it roomier by European standards, and very clean and comfortable. Hotel is tucked away in a small block with business building offices so it is very quiet at night (great for a good night's rest). Yet Hotel Gramont is only within 2-3 blocks away from 3 metro stations and several bus stops that go into the different arrondisements in the city. It is about 5 blocks away from the les grands magasins (Galeries Lafayette, Printemps), Opera Garnier & the Roissy bus drop off point; about 7-8 blocks away from the designer clothing & food boutiques at Madeleine (Chanel, Gucci, Fauchon, Hediard, etc) and about a mile away from the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay museums. There are lots of brassieres and cafes a block or two from the hotel as well as boulangeries for your daily fresh baked baguette needs :). What is most impressive is how every hotel staff member shows that they really care about the guests. They make it their business to know you by face, if not by name, without being intrusive and always remaining professional with their work. Needless to say, I highly recommend Hotel Gramont as a hotel to stay in Paris for its excellent professional and personalized staff service, reasonable rates, and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: EmilyR4
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were staying in Paris for the weekend and booked last minute at the Hotel Gramont. We arrived pretty early in the am from the Eurostar and wanted to drop our bags off at the hotel before getting breakfast - until we could properly check in. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by two smiling faces. When we said we would check in later but if we could leave our bags, they started apologizing that our room wasn't ready. We told them we completely understood, we were very early for check in anyway, but they had us sit in their reception area and served us coffee, juice, and an assortment of croissants and pain au chocolat. Before we knew it, we were brought upstairs to our room which was small, but very nice and well decorated. We definitely were not expecting breakfast and to check in so early, but it just goes to show how friendly and accommodating the hotel is. I would not hesitate to come back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roldenaar
Reviews.Content: After reading a lot of reviews on Tripadvisor, we decided on this hotel and are glad we did! The Gramont is right in the middle of everything, you can easily walk to the Louvre, the Opera Garnier and Gallery Lafayette. There are lots of nice to very nice restaurants within a 5 minutes' walking distance. It's also one of the few hotels in Paris that has family rooms and our children slept very well on the comfortable sofa-bed. The rooms are nicely decorated and above all very clean, as are the bathrooms which are very small, but also very clean and adequate. My husband had been staying at hotel Concorde Lafayette (4*), while attending a congress before joining us at the Gramont, and he liked the Gramont much better as it was cleaner (chairs in the CF were broken and dirty), cheaper and so much friendlier. That's exactly what I am looking for in a hotel: it has to be clean and the staff have to be friendly. The breakfast, which we had at the hotel was good as well : croissants, pain au chocolat, bread to be toasted, 4 or 5 different jams, 4 to 5 meats,cheeses, fresh fruits, eggs , juices,milk, tea and coffee and more. But, to repeat what other travelers have already mentioned, the staff really are the best. They are super friendly and willing to assist in any way 'avec plaisir' . They made several phone-calls to make reservations in restaurants and had good suggestions about where to eat. So thanks again Aurelie, Nicci, Sandra and the dark-haired girl who checked us in and whose name I did not catch. Thank you for making our trip so much easier as our French is not very good. We will return to Paris and then we'll certainly return to this hotel but we have to make sure we book well in advance, since it is often fully booked on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from the moment we booked to the time we left”
Reviews.Author: TJNDP
Reviews.Content: Having picked this hotel from the Tripadvisor reviews we were not disappointed. We booked direct and from that moment on the customer service was fantastic. We we arriving earlier into Paris and they arrange transport and had a room ready for us. The hotel has a lovely feel, being both traditional and modern. Our room was at the top so we had a balcony and while the view is not breath taking being able to sit out and look at the Paris skyline was worth it. The hotel staff can and do help with everything and there's a great personal feel to a central hotel. The location is good, very central once you get you bearing, the louvre is within walking distance, but several metro stations are close by. I would recommend and would stay here again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “staff very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Dinda30
Reviews.Content: Excelent location,near 3 subway stations. The rooms and bathroom are clean,the bed was comfortable.There was free wireless in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel with best staff in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: PetarStefanovic
Reviews.Content: We're a young couple and we stayed in Hotel Gramont for 4 days, when we visited Paris for the New Year's Eve (31.01.2011-03.01.2012). Hotel has a great location, 10 minute walking distance to the Place de La Concorde, very close to Opera. Rooms are very cute and nice (although a small toilet) with very comfortable bed and pillows. One word of a warning - rooms are small, especially for US standards, but this is nothing unusual for Paris where most of the hotels (except for the very luxurious ones) have tiny rooms. We honestly didn't mind room size, since we came to Paris to see and feel the city, and not to spend most of the time in our room. But the biggest plus of the hotel are the nicest and kindest people working there as staff. Not only that they helped us with everything - from airport shuttle to finding an adequate restaurant for the New Year's Eve, but they also had a surprise for us - left us two ticket for sightseeing river cruise! We were delighted with staying at this hotel and would recommend it to everybody anytime! And yes, I almost forgot - there are also some very nice "touches" such as free croissants, tea, coffee and mineral water in the hotel lobby, free wifi and computer use, up-to-date weather information in the elevator, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: MADLAC21
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, girls at the front dest very accommodating and very friendly with the kids

Reviews.Title: “Mini Honeymoon in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: gtsco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon for four nights. Upon arriving we found the staff left us a bottle of champagne in the room which was lovely of them. The room was very well appointed if a little small and the staff really are the gem of this hotel. They couldn't do enough for us, to the point that they even went out to buy a valentines card for me when I only emailed them on the way there by Eurostar! A fact my new wife will likely never let me forget! The only downfall I can point out is that the cleaner for some reason decided to clean the next room at 8am some mornings which was annoying given we were trying to sleep in and that we left the do not disturb sign on the door. Other than this we had a lovely time at the Gramont Opera Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The place to rest in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rgallodf
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel with very kind attentants. Comfortable room in a quiet street, very close to Opera Station. Perfect place to stay after a long day walking in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Golden_Jammy
Reviews.Content: Not long back from a short but wonderful, whirlwind, whistle stop break to Paris. Hotel situated in quiet sidestreet, close to metro & all the amenities. Hotel itself is done in a typical boutique style. We had a quadruple room, which had two ensuite shower rooms. Not exactly spacious, but served our needs for our short stay. Some nice touches, like the daily fresh croissants in reception! Reception staff extremely courteous, helpful & most amiable. Would recommend a stay here for the location, cleanliness of the rooms & the charming staff. Tip: for a first time short stay, visit to Musee D'orsay & lunch at Laduree is a most! Try having an early breakfast at Galeries Lafayette for a great view of Paris in the terrace cafe/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Leigh F
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Gramont Opera based solely on the reviews I read on Tripadvisor, and I wasn't disappointed. Every positive comment you read in any review I found to be true. From the moment we stepped through the door, the staff could not have been more helpful and generous. We were made to feel very welcome throughout our stay. The rooms were clean and tidy, all the staff including the maids were helpful & polite at all times. The continental breakfast produce was fresh with a broad enough selection for all. Hotel Gramont Opera is the perfect hotel for a perfect city break. I would absolutely stay here again, and would recommend to my family & friends. Great location for sights and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very welcoming in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: viaggio72
Reviews.Content: Couldn't recommend it more! the hotel is in a fantastic location, really central. The Staff are incredibly welcoming...even before I arrived at the hotel Samira was extremely helpful in assisting with the booking transport from the airport. When i arrived at the hotel i felt very welcome and the loved the atmospthere. The single room was clean and cosy and I particularly appreciated the efficiency of the heater as outside it was freezing, in a few minutes the room was warm. I know for a fact that when I return to Paris I will choose this lovely hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise.”
Reviews.Author: hc11238
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay with my 22 year old cousin. We booked the Hotel Gramont after its stellar reviews on TA. We were not disappointed. We took the Metro from the Paris Nord train station. The location was great. There were 3 different Metro stops in the vicinity- the biggest one (OPERA) was a 4 minute walk away. We arrived around 3pm and our room was ready (room 405). We had a room with 2 twin beds. The hotel and room were both very, very clean. Check in was a breeze and the front desk staff were very nice and helpful. Upon our arrival they gave us a Paris map and the code for free WIFI. That was a nice plus. Another nice plus were the fresh croissants (chocolate and regular) in the lobby. The room was small but it had everything we needed (safe, shower cap, shower gel, body lotion and a built in hair dryer (prob good for men but not so much for women). The ONLY reason this hotel did not get a 5 was because of the room noise (something a lot of people mentioned in prior reviews). Even on the 4th floor, you could hear cars go by and I even heard a woman walking with heels at 2am. We also heard the couple next door arguing and water rushing (maybe a toilet flushing). We woke up kind of late on our trip (9am) so there were times where someone was vacuuming outside our room from 8am on. There was also a small elevator which was nice. Regardless of the room noise, I would DEFINITELY come back. Thank you Hotel Gramont Paris for an amazing Paris stay! On another note- we went to a great restaurant called Cafe National on Rue Italiens and MIchelieu- highly recommend it. It was around the corner- maybe a 4 minute walk. They had a menu in English but we were the only non-French in there and they had a fun bar scene.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest people in France”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeMartin
Reviews.Content: My family of 8 adults and 4 youngs kids were there for 2 nights in January 2012. The pre-trip arrangement help assisted by Sandra and Aurelie is fantastic. They basically helped to advise and arrange for transport to and from the hotel without me having to break a sweat and source for it. The arrival and check in was great for us, but I am sure our noisy kids created a nightmare for them and the guests at that time. Everything was arrnaged as what we had asked for. But the baby cot given to us was spoilt and had to be changed, and that was quickly done. Issues happen as we prepare for an early morning check out and that is mainly because the person there was a temporary staff and new, and therefore is rather lost and things started to be a bit messy. That said, nothing can take away the friendliness and hospitality of Sandra and Aurelie, whom are still the nicest people we met in France during our 2 weeks there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Landan H
Reviews.Content: The staff was so friendly! Our room was clean and was actually pretty big considering that it was in Paris. We definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Beto_Rio_de_Janeiro
Reviews.Content: What about coming to France, more precisely Paris and being received with a smile and fresh croissants? Sandra wasn't there but Anne was and was very kind and helpful. What makes this liitle Hotel different from the others? Just the whole staff! Caroll in the "petit dejeneur", Sandra in succeding to arrange transportaion for six people and a lot of luggage at 3:00 AM and chatting with us all the time with "joie de vivre" and calling my mother kindly as "MAMMY". Unfortunately le parisiens are always in a hurry and have no time to be nice. Except in this little Hotel that makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “My Second Stay”
Reviews.Author: fishbone96
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hotel Gramont. Its convenient location makes it a personal favorite. The hotel is located just blocks from the last stop of the Roissy bus from the airport. The major department stores and the Louvre are a just a few blocks away. There is no shortage of eateries in the area, as well as a movie theater that features movies in English with French subtitles. I also appreciate the free WiFi and the exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. In fact, it was because of the amazing staff that I chose to stay at the hotel again, rather than try a different place. I had room 203 which I must say was the smallest single room I've ever stayed in. It was fine for me, but some might find the bathroom a bit claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great location! Great beds and rooms! Best staff!”
Reviews.Author: SR1014
Reviews.Content: Although a little pricey, especially with the poor ERO to Dollar conversion I was a bit reluctant to reserve our room for 3 nights at the Hotel Gramont Opéra, but the excellent Trip Advisor reviews convinced me. After we arrived, even better was the lovely front desk attendant, “Sandra”. From the moment we walked into the hotel she greeted us with kindness, compassion and made our stay absolutely worth every single penny! Although the room and hotel are small (as are most hotels in Europe) it was clean and beautifully decorated, the shower and bathroom were great, the beds comfortable, but even better the staff. Sandra was there for us from dinner and tour recommendations, extra bedding and her overall friendlessness. I would definitely go back and refer it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: BKBA
Reviews.Content: Nice room, great staff, good location, great price... Small cozy friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay at the Gramont!”
Reviews.Author: Milkey1988
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at hotel Gramont Opera, and had such an amazing time! Location is perfect, took the Roissy bus from CDG to Opera, which was a quick 5 minute walk to the hotel. Close to about 4 different metro stations, which means it's supereasy to get anywhere in the city. Hotel staff was so friendly and helpful with getting around, making dinner reservaions, etc. Room was very well appointed, clean, fairly big and newly renovated. All in all a great, romantic stay in Paris. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: greyman47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at th is hotel before and after a trip to Morocco and our experiences were quite different. We arrived at about 9:00 pm and must have found the only unhelpful staff member in the hotel. He was unable to recommend any nearby places to eat and couldn't tell us the best way to get to the airport in the morning. We were put into a rather dour but large room on the ground floor. After that it was all good. The staff in the morning were extremely friendly and helpful. On our return we had a lovely spacious up-stairs room. The location is terrific. Close to the Roissey Bus which provides efficient inexpensive transport to the airport. The hotel is also surrounded by lots of good places to eat. The breakfast was underwhelming and we ate out after the first experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RowlyP
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel in great area of Paris. As everybody has said this hotel is all about the staff. Nowhere else have we ever come across such friendly, helpful staff. We wanted to have a Christmas Eve in the main sitting area with some food and drinks near the Christmas tree. This wasnt a problem, in fact nothing was a problem for the great staff. Rooms arent large and walls are a little thin but this doesnt affect the quality of the experience. Thankyou for a wonderful stay. We had a family room with my wife and two kids, 17 and 16 years old.

Reviews.Title: “A good option for a stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: leeleo727
Reviews.Content: I can only echo the previous comments. The staff were so helpful and after a long flight from KL I was so grateful that they allowed me to check in early. I stayed in their single room and it was more than adequate for my two night stay even with a big bag. I didn't eat there so can't comment on the food. A nice short walk to the Opera House and Ave de Capuchines where there are plenty of places to get food or shop. It was also very handy to catch the Hop on Hop off bus which was so useful in getting to see the main sights of Paris in a limited time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a charming staff”
Reviews.Author: lofa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost like an elegant B&B. The staff is fabulous and my upgraded room 201 was huge with a living and sleeping area and two baths. If you are a tub person that room has two great showers but no tubs. The free laptop downstairs had an excellent connection. In my room the connection worked but not as well. Breakfast was a nice selection of items.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
Reviews.Title: “Great location friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ed R
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location close to the Metro and the Opera district. Staff are polite and friendly and communicate well in English

Reviews.Title: “BEST so far in France”
Reviews.Author: luvagirl69
Reviews.Content: this hotel has the most amazing, friendly staff you will ever encounter in your lifetime. Nothing was too much trouble. From helping with tours, calling a taxi, carrying luggage, speaking English, sending postcards...the list goes on. We booked a last minute family room which was two connecting rooms with 2 bathrooms. Very comfortable and spacious enough in comparison to other hotels in France that we have encountered. The only draw backs are the usual, nowhere to stop the car and unpack our tonnes of luggage, we parked up on the curb leaving a whisker of space for cars to get through. the car park was streets away and a little costly. Breakfast was lovely and varied. It's the first time we have seen an egg for breakfast in weeks!! The foyer lounge was comfy and the wifi and computer/printer very handy. Tea and coffee always available in the foyer and a little pastry appeared sometimes during the day for free as well. We loved it and we would go back there if we returned to Paris. It is close to shopping centers, restaurants etc...and a short walk to the Louvre. Thank you to the fabulous staff who made us feel so welcome. X

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: Persuaded by so many positive reviews I stayed at the Hotel Gramont for 4 days in early January 2012. What a disappointment! Perhaps reviewers discount their opinions because they allow for it being 'Paris'. Well I don't. I think that hotels the world over need to measure up to certain standards or be damned whether it is Paris, London or Manhattan, and I have stayed at better hotels in the latter two than I have ever in Paris. In the case of Hotel Gramont, I do agree that Aurelie and staff are magnificent. Without her the shortcomings of this hotel would not be as tolerable. Although in a reasonable location except for a noisy street, it has tiny rooms, minimal wardrobe space, paper thin walls, a minute safe, minimal ventilation, and in my case a bathroom with a persistent odour of something between the smell of boiled cabbage and a dead rat. On the plus side: a change of room was offered, the wireless internet is free although slow most of the time. Also, the buffet breakfast is delightful and good value at 13 euro, and there are lots of complimentary items such as water, tea, coffee, and croissants offered throughout the day. So the value add is reasonable, but the hotel misses out on its infrastructure. When they renovated the building they should have reduced the number of rooms and added soundproofing. The noise from the street and within the hotel seriously undermines sleep quality. It is really a Pensione not a hotel. It is a bit like staying as a guest in the attic in someone's small house with all the shortcomings that sometimes entails. Yes, you feel welcome but there is simply not enough space although everything is relatively new and the decoration is charming. I have stayed at many different hotels in Paris and not one has yet met a reasonable standard for the money paid in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cshevAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gramont just before Christmas. We had a quad room which had 2 bathrooms - very convenient in getting everyone ready quickly in the mornings. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The only negative as another reviewer has mentioned is the hairdryer, it was an unusual shape, more like a vaccum cleaner hose and not very powerful, so bringing your own travel hairdryer might be a better option. The location was convenient and the staff were very friendly and helpful and english speaking. The buffet breakfast was delicious - cold meats, cheeses (which our daughter loved so much she asked me to write the name of it down so we can see if we can get them in Australia), croissants, french bread, boiled eggs, cereals etc, and musnt forget a delicious apple tart that I'm dreaming about right now. Close to shops and Galleries La Fayette which was decorated beautifully with Christmas lights.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked it.”
Reviews.Author: cm7872
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris numerous times and I knew we would spend little time in our room. I just wanted something central and convenient. This hotel was perfect. The room was small but the price was perfect. We stayed for 7 nights and liked the hotel. The peeps who worked the front desk were just so nice. I would actually stay here again which is something I rarely say about hotels - generally want to try something new. But, this was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Best secret in Paris”
Reviews.Author: FBendall
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful small typical french hotel, that is full of wonderful staff, who are friendly and can't do enough for you. We arrived after leaving Sydney, having toured the Uk, with suitcases and tired. We were welcomed with a lovely typical french room, wonderfully housing 3 of us - myself, my partner and young daughter very comfortable. Our clothes were laundered for us and returned like they belonged in one of the lovely shops on The Avenue des Champs-Élysées. The staff couldn't do enough to make us feel so at home. Clean, very French, very warm, very welcoming and highly recommended. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely staff at a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: emah
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Gramont-Opera after reading all the positive reviews on TripAdvisor and being convinced by its place at number 3 on the list. I booked online and took advantage of the internet deal of 143 euros per night for a single room (instead of 160), not including breakfast. It is definitely the case, as many people here have mentioned, that the staff at reception are fantastic: really friendly, incredibly helpful - genuine “people” people. They made me feel very welcome. There are some nice little extras - the coffee and croissants in the foyer for instance, and the fast free internet - help leave a great impression of this hotel. Having said that, it could only be in Paris that 143 euros a night for a single room would be considered good value for money: throughout Germany I stayed at many swisher places for far less than this (eg in Nurnberg, the Le Meridien = a 4/5 star property, was 103 euros including breakfast, for a room 3 times the size and with a real bathroom). Yes, Paris hotels are expensive, but still... I stayed in a room on the 5th floor, the room was very small and you need to watch your feet - there is an exposed beam which takes up a bit of space and it’s very easy to bang into. If you live out of your case (which you need to because there isn’t really the space to unpack here) you will be very crowded. The bathroom was very small (even the toilet was smaller sized than normal). It was fine for two nights but I would not have enjoyed a longer stay: I didn’t see any of the bigger rooms so its entirely possible that this problem is restricted to the single rooms. The bed (a full single) was comfortable but the mattress was covered in some sort of a plastic cover which makes me really hot and uncomfortable. The second night I ended up sleeping on top of the duvet and covering myself with a towel, to avoid the problem. there is a fair bit of street noise so sleeping with the window open is not really an option unless you are a very heavy sleeper. You can hear noise from the corridor but it was not a big deal to me. The room was serviced well; the whole hotel seems clean and well cared for. The location is great - a 5 minute walk will have you in shopping mecca on Haussman; I caught a number of cabs because the weather was inclement and anywhere I went within the city seemed to be about 7 euros. So, in conclusion: I would recommend this hotel to some of my friends, but not to other. To me this is a very good 2-3 star property - definitely better than some of the grotty hotels I have stayed in in the past in Paris, but I am surprised that it is so high up on the list on TA: it can’t be because its especially good value and it’s by no means a higher-star rating than this so the only conclusion is that the great staff make the difference. Whether they are enough to sway your opinion of the place will depend on what is most important to you.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: olliebaba
Reviews.Content: All of the previous reviews were spot- on. The hotel is great and the people who work there couldn't be nicer. Aurélie was wonderful to us, so a special thanks to her. Our whole trip to Paris was great, in large part to staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Seasider888
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice comfortable hotel. It is a little pricy but you cannot fault the location or the staff who were friendly and helpful - particularly the receptionists. I had a road side room and that was fine except for the night of New Years Eve when it was a little noisy due to the late night revellers. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “My Go-to Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jody M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Gramont for the first time over the Christmas weekend. Having just moved to Germany on business, I was alone for the weekend. The hotel staff was wonderful. They helped me with directions and listened with interest when I came back from my day's travels. They were efficient and FUN! I enjoyed my single room. It is small but the space is very comfortable and well-appointed, and the building has an elevator. Not always the case in a boutique hotel such as the Gramont in Paris. It is also a good value. The hotel is located near at least two different metros so it was easy for me to navigate around the city without a car. With that said, on my first morning, I walked to the Louvre and Orsay. I felt comfortable alone there coming home at night. I will use this hotel each time that I return to Paris. I look forward to seeing the staff again and continuing to build relationships! Thank You Hotel Gramont! P.S. If you have free time you might want to add the Jacquemart-Andre Museum to your list of places to visit. It is much like the Frick in New York in that you can view beautiful works of art in a family home surrounded by period furnishings and family stories. The audio guide was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: PrincessZan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are rather small....and the bathrooms even smaller....but the staff are very helpful and friendly. The beds are okay and quite comfortable. The location is very good. Galeries Lafayette/Printemps are a 7- minute walk away from the hotel. The receptionists are very friendly. One charming receptionist was on the phone for 45 minutes just to get me a good reservation for an Xmas dinner at the Ritz....

Reviews.Title: “Parisan Delight”
Reviews.Author: ClareBear1983
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a such a delightful stay in Paris for many reasons linked to our stay at Hotel Gramont Opera. Firstly, if you are looking for a peaceful, safe and quiet place to stay in Paris, Gramont is located in the business district in a quiet street. It is also centrally located to many attractions, shopping and main areas of Paris and main Metro station. Second, it is beautifully kept, we had a room on the top floor, facing the street with a balcony, though small, the rooms are modern, very clean, high quality beddings and imaculately kept. Last but not least at all, the receptionist, Aurelia really played a large part in ensuring our stay was 'delightful', from check in to departure, she is super sweet, always greeting us with a smile and wanting to ensure our stay was comfortable and pleasant. Due to an unfortunate train strike in Belgium, of which we were notified last minute, my partner and I were at angst to try and find a way home to Holland before Christmas. Upon Aurelia's knowledge of the situation, she quickly researched all options for us, and found a suitable option in no time. We were so pleased and to much of our relief we were home in time. Though my partner and I were stressed about the scenario, Aurelia was very calm and acted with urgency to assist us. Her customer service and care is very much appreciated and certainly was above her call of duty in assisting us. We highly recommend this hotel and have already told many of our family and friends about our wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip advisor recommendation”
Reviews.Author: emelian
Reviews.Content: My travel plans now revolve around picking places by Trip Advisor reviews. This one was another winner. A great position, fabulously helpful staff, reasonable price for what you got. Would highly recommend. Head down a few of the side streets away from the main road and you will find some very pleasant reasonable ( if not actually cheap) restaurants. We tried a couple and had very enjoyable nights. Close to metro and hop on hop off bus stops. we also found it an easy walk even to the Arc de triomph ( 45mins) so alot of other places are very easily accessible without public transport. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully friendly and fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneSam
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel some time prior to heading to Paris mainly because it has such good reviews and we felt it was exactly the sort of hotel that we wanted to stay in. The location is brilliant. It is really close to quite a few metro stations, right next to some of the main shopping areas and also close to plenty of restaurants. You really will be spoilt for choice. We emailed the hotel a few weeks in advance to ask for some advise on restaurants and they couldn't have been more helpful. We had the all booked by the time we arrived which was lovely. The room itself was great and quite large ... Larger than expected. We had just arrived from Australia and even though it was still mid-morning, they made every effort to have our room ready on arrival which was so nice especially after our long trip. We chose to have breakfast in the hotel which was perfectly acceptable ... Plenty of choice and enough to fill you up for the day. The hotel is a prefect gem and as everyone has said previously, to have such wonderfully helpful people greet and help you makes a world of difference and certainly it is not something every hotel can claim to have.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: Marc M
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this place despite us both of us going down with 'la gripe' (a cold -- it was Paris in December after all!!) while we were there. All the staff were unfailingly pleasant, helpful and tolerant of our efforts to speak french! Local knowledge was great, with instructions on how to get to nearby landmarks, launderettes etc precise and accurate. Our room was cleaned spotlessly every day. The continental breakfast had enough options for everyone and despite being fairly late risers we were never left short. Complimentary tea, coffee, water and croissants are available in reception throughout the day. On arriving home there was an email waiting for me informing me that I had left something behind. I had never stayed in Paris before, but I would be surprised if there were many better options than the Hotal Gramont Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay in Paris? Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Benjamingrace
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in our fair share of hotels, but this is the first time we have felt inclined to write a review. We have been incredibly impressed with the quality of the hotel, particularly with the friendly and helpful staff, in particular the sweet lady at reception who has gone the extra mile to make our stay memorable. She has gone out of her way to share little gems of info regarding tourist attractions which has been a time saver on our short stay. You'll have to stay to be privy to this! Take this along with the central location, clean rooms and nearby public transport you have a winner for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Truly more than good location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JeannieFT
Reviews.Content: It was our second stay in the hotel. We had an unexpected need as our 6-year old, who was throwing out throughout the long flight, was very unwell. We also arrived early, before check-in time. Sandra, our most wonderful hotel manager, kindly provided a single room [without charge] for the child to rest in, till our quadruple room was ready. Further, the housekeeping staff take pride in their work - our room was very clean. We also enjoyed the breakfast buffet as the variety of food was excellent. Eggs [scrambled, fried or hard boiled], which were not included last year during our first stay in the hotel, are now part of the breakfast spread -- good start for the day for growing kids.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: aliballi
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a quadruple room (they all have 2 bathrooms) with 3 friends. The trip was a birthday treat. The room was a good size (esp given my usual experience of rooms in Paris). The room was nicely presented, very clean and the beds were great. The location was perfect in terms of being central and having a good variety of places to eat / drink. The staff were really friendly and amenable and that in itself really made for a pleasurable stay. Many thanks. This is by far the best hotel I have stayed in in Paris and I will heartily recommend to others and will definitely be booking for my next trip :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Subrogod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located to metro stations, restaurants and taxis. The staff is dedicated and friendly. You receive a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, stylish and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Paul O
Reviews.Content: The wonderfully friendly and helpful staff (especially Sandra) made our weekend stay a real delight. There is something about the decor and furnishings that makes you feel immediately at home here. The lounge is cosy and relaxing - with free coffee and croissants! Our room was a good size, beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. There is very little road noise for such a central location (we were on the second floor) and we had a good night's sleep in a big, comfortable bed. The location is amazing - Opera and Gallerie Lafayette on your doorstep and only a short work to the Louvre and Champs Elysees. Thoroughly recommended. Thanks to Tripadvisor for putting me onto it!

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay in Paris!!”
Reviews.Author: HelenaMtTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with anoyher couple. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful; the rooms were nice; the breakfast each day was excellent; and the location was great. There are lots of metro stops close by.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: kkjohnson521
Reviews.Content: Our family chose the Hotel Gramont Opera based on the trip advisor reviews. The hotel lived up to the excellent ratings.... First and foremost, Sandra went above and beyond the call of duty!!! From the moment my group of 11 walked in the door, she was happy, entergetic and helpful. Always going out of her way to accomodate our every need from making dinner reservations, calling a cab, arranging transfers, giving directions, etc.... We all knew she was happy to help us! The hotel is quaint and clean. Rooms are small but nicely decorated. Hence, the 3 star rating. I would not hesitate to recommend the Hotel Gramont. The staff alone makes it a great choice---not to mention a central location. We will return next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Dasuat
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying in Hotel Gramont and it couldn't be better. The location is perfect, 5 minutes walk from Galleria Lafayette, lots of bars and restaurants around. We are in a quad room with 2 bathrooms and the room is a decent size by Parisian standards. Lovely decor and spotlessly clean. Plus the friendliest receptionist ever.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find a fault!”
Reviews.Author: acegt1
Reviews.Content: The other reviews say it all, but it bears repeating... Value for the money is excellent. Hotel is very small and has excellent Parisian charm. Our room and bathroom were small, even by European standards, but it's a boutique hotel and we expected it based on the reviews. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. Upon arrival at the hotel we were offered complimentary (and delicious) pain au chocolat, butter croissants, tea and coffee. Tons of guide books in the lobby, free wireless Internet in the lobby and in the rooms, and a 3-minute walk to the nearest Metro station. In addition to the hotel's strengths, it's biggest asset is Sandra at the front desk. I can't say enough about Sandra, because she stole the show. I travel internationally for business regularly (11 countries in 28 days in this case, with Paris at the end), and I can't remember a member of any hotel staff in my 10 years of international business travel that was as genuinely amazing as Sandra. In addition to being incredibly helpful in recommending a restaurant for our Thanksgiving dinner and making a reservation for us there, she also took care of the airport shuttle service, made excellent tourist recommendations, and was just a lot of fun to have a conversation with. I even had a personalized email in my Inbox upon my return to the US from Sandra asking me how we enjoyed our flight back. She is nothing short of amazing and is the textbook definition of "service with a smile" that so many other service industries lack. Only two negatives that I can think of. A/C was disabled for cooling because the cold season had hit Paris, but we were a little warm in the room. Opening the window for 5 minutes fixed that problem. Not much of a complaint because it seems all of the boutique hotels do this. There was a bit of outdoor noise in our room (304) even with the window closed, so if you're a light sleeper this might cause a problem. With all the walking we did in Paris we slept through it with no problem, but worth mentioning. Book the room and enjoy Paris, you'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gbaxter123
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 night break in Paris and this hotel was perfect. Great central location and an immaculate and spotless room. Nice comfy bed and big shower were fantastic. The staff were very helpful with restaurant bookings, taxis etc. Will go back next time in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: TravelRevue
Reviews.Content: What else can I add to the countless reviews already posted of the Hotel Gramont?!?!? There is a reason this hotel is so highly reviewed on TripAdvisor. It’s a true gem and a wonderful headquarters for a Parisian holiday. My girlfriend and I spent a week at the Hotel Gramont in September 2011. The location of the property is ideal. We walked everywhere. On those occasions when we found ourselves far from home at the end of a long day of exploring, there were several subway lines/stations within easy walking distance of the property. In addition, the Roissy bus from/to CDG is just a short walk away and is an excellent value (€10/pp with plenty of space for passengers and luggage). The rooms were well done and comfortable. We were assigned a top floor Double with balcony our first night (a guest failed to depart on time due to illness so our Double+ room was not available), before moving to the Double+ room (#305) we had reserved for the remainder of our trip. No issue for us as hotel explained the situation at check-in, offered a free breakfast for our trouble and moved all of our stuff to our new room as well. Room #305 was spacious for two people, the beds were great and everything was spotlessly clean. The room had a decent sized closet area, with a number of shelves for storing clothes and bags, a small flat-screen TV with decent selection of channels and a mini-fridge with reasonably priced items. The only downside to the room was the bathroom set-up. The room had a water closet (separate from the shower and sink, which were fine) that was about an inch wider than the toilet. It’s nearly impossible to use the toilet in the room unless you’re a contortionist. Overall though, Room #305 was very comfortable and spacious, especially for a couple. Our initial room on the 6th Floor was similarly comfortable and nicely done. It was up a set of stairs from the 5th floor elevator. Though smaller than #305, it did offer a nice sized balcony to catch some fresh air and a glimpse of the skyline. (I think the Hotel Gramont could take better advantage by making the balconies a bit more functional, perhaps adding furniture and plant life, to better market these assets). Closet was pretty limited and would likely require you to work out of a suitcase as there wasn’t much storage space. Bathroom didn’t present the issues of #305. Despite being a little smaller, we would have been perfectly comfortable in the Double room for the week (although anything longer than a week and the more limited space might have become an issue). The staff is unmatched. Every single person was friendly and helpful. Special recognition has to be extended to Sandra, who was the highlight of our stay. Ever trip through the lobby was met with a giant smile and a friendly conversation. She truly is a great ambassador for the hotel. The breakfast offered by the hotel is very good. There are plenty of tasty pastries, meats, cheeses, breads, coffee, juices, etc. served in a nice little breakfast room. And there was always an empty table. A great start to the day. Also, we very much enjoyed the cozy lobby set-up. There are several comfortable chairs and sofas next to a small bar. There were almost always complimentary croissants laid out, along with bottled still and sparkling water and coffee service. In addition, there were a selection of Paris tour guides, daily newspapers and enjoyable French music in the background. Free WiFi, available in lobby and guest rooms, was fine for web browsing. We truly enjoyed our week in Paris and a stay at this hotel was a big part of that experience. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Gramont our next time in Paris. In fact, the only significant downside to the Hotel Gramont is that a stay there makes leaving Paris that much more difficult…

Reviews.Title: “Worthy of the highest praise.”
Reviews.Author: FlyByTheSeatOMyPants
Reviews.Content: This adorable gem of a hotel deserves its very high rank. The public areas are lovely and quaint and the neighborhood is lively with lots of restaurants, cafes, bars and shops nearby. It is also just a half-block from a metro stop putting all of Paris within easy reach. Our room was a decent size for Paris standards and was spotlessly clean, updated, fully functional and nicely decorated. But what truly sets this place apart is Sandra. She is the epitome of true professionalism where service is concerned. You can rely on Sandra and staff to greet you warmly, see to it that all your questions are answered (with a delightful smile) and just generally make you feel like a treasured guest--but in a most genuine way. I recommend Hotel Gramont Opera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “third time lucky”
Reviews.Author: Ann W
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long awaited trip to Paris with my two sons. As I was travelling alone with my sons and my French is minimal I needed somewhere central and safe with staff who spoke English. I chose this hotel on the basis of the great reviews the staff got on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed! We had a wonderful time there and the staff were exceptionally friendly, welcoming and helpful. Sandra is a great organiser and we followed her directions hither and tither armed with phone numbers in case of "emergencies". We had great fun giving her our daily "report" and managed not to get lost once. The hotel was clean and comfortable and in a very safe area. The breakfast buffet was appetizing and satisfied even our hungry appetites. We used the restaurant on the corner Le Gramont for late night snacks and it was an added bonus in that it was a few minutes away from our hotel. We would definitely stay in this hotel again and have no hesitation in recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: stovedaddy
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I stayed at the Hotel Gramont for four nights in the duplex and we were quite pleased. We narrowed our hotel choices to three properties and we selected Gramont because of their customer service reputation and the hotels central location and we were not disappointed. The room and bathroom were clean, comfortable, and fairly recently renovated. This was our first trip to Paris and it was comforting to know that Sandra and her staff would always have great suggestions for us for restaurants and site seeing options. Paris was wonderful and we hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracykc
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in Paris. You could not ask for better staff. Sandra was very helpful answering all of our questions. Everyone was always quick to greet us and ask if there was anything we needed. Location was close to metro stops. Clean and beautifully decorated rooms. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “angels”
Reviews.Author: bundy-born
Reviews.Content: We could not have wished for better accomodation and support on our stay in Paris. Aurelie has been our guardian angel since my serious traffic accident on the second day of our stay. The staff looked after my husband and helped him in every way they could, and Aurelie especially went out of her way to visit us on her time off, even after the insurance company shifted us to accomodation closer to the hospital. You will find this lovely hotel comfortable,close to lots of attractions and restaurants,and of course very welcoming and friendly. Do yourself a favour and book with these lovely people

Reviews.Title: “Paris é mais acolhedora no Gramont”
Reviews.Author: vlechenique
Reviews.Content: Passei ótimos e agradáveis dias em Paris e a estada no Hotel Gramont Opera colaborou para isso com seu acolhimento.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - EXCELLENT staff!!”
Reviews.Author: TX-from-MS
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Gramont last month for 2 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed it. It is in a very good location and so close to the metro, restaurants, and shopping. Within walking distance to many sights. But the best thing about this hotel is the staff. Aurelie was one of the best hotel employees we have every seen in all our travels. She went out of her way to make sure our stay was perfect. When we first checked in, the room they originally assigned us to was too small for us and our luggage (we had just finished a 10 day cruise) so she quickly moved us to a larger room which was perfect. She provided directions to any sight, restaurant or shopping place we needed, and even brought us toiletries from her home when we realized we didn't have what we needed. She is a jewel, and as my wife calls her, "An Angel". Thank you Aurelie and Hotel Gramont for making our first trip to Paris even more special than we thought it could be!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: marioambrose
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at the Gramont and although I enjoyed my stay, I must say that in my opinion the hotel is not quite deserving of its high rank on Tripadvisor. It is clean and well-managed, but it is a budget hotel. If you are traveling on a limited budget, then you will not do better. However, if amenities such as a room with a reasonable amount of space, room service, a lobby lounge where you can have a drink, or a newspaper in the morning, are important to you, then you will have to look elsewhere (and spend more money). The staff I encountered were all courteous and helpful. The young lady at the front desk (seemingly 24/7) was especially helpful and spoke fluent English. The Gramont is centrally located and I am sure these are among the reasons the hotel gets such high marks. In summary, the Gramont is good value, but if you want a few more creature comforts you should probably look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: shopsuey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October 2011, this was our 3rd trip to Paris and be far the best hotel we have stayed in. It is a beautiful, spotless and friendly small hotel. The staff were very helpful and welcoming and also very approachable. Although the rooms are small, they are beautifully decorated and we had plenty of room for the storage of our luggage. The wardrobe was huge. We stayed in a double room with a balcony of the 6th floor. The ony disadvantage with this room is getting your luggage up the narrow stairs that lead to the room from floor 5 (accessible by lift) however having said that the staff helped us with this so in the end it wasn't a drama. We were always welcomed when we returned to the hotel with a bright and cheery ''Bonjour". We paid additional to have breakfast which was delicious. If I had to single out anything with this hotel, my only thing would be the lack of an english speaking tv station, it would be handy even if just to get the news but the positive is that you get to switch off from the real world. We can't believe this hotel is not rated 5 star, it truly is a hidden jewel

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel.”
Reviews.Author: fernyAyrshire
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the Gramont Opera for our daughters 16th birthday in September. It was as expected a small, friendly, spotlessly clean, charming hotel. We were on the 2nd floor in a quad room. Very nicely laid out, essentially two rooms at either end with 2 bathrooms in the middle and 2 TVs. Lovely and quiet for sleep after a busy day sightseeing. Our 16 year old LOVED everything about Paris including this lovely wee hotel, and the birthday cake the hotel organised was delicious. We actually considered the breakfast excellent value. We managed to eat huge amounts relaxing together before a day of sightseeing. Paris was charming and we all had a lovely time at the Gramont Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Colin006
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked as a result of referring to Trip Advisor and what a choice. Central to all sights if you want to walk (Montmartre perhaps just a bit too far away but Louvre/Notre Dame about 15/20 minutes!) and just around the corner from the Metro. Friendly staff and the breakfast is certainly worth having when you consider the price of a coffee in cafes. There are also some very good restaurants in the vicinity worthy of consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: OddAmanda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights for our honeymoon. Having previously stayed at Hotel Britannique, we were a little disappointed with this hotel. When we arrived we were greeted by a lovely and extremely friendly lady and were offered a croissant (yum!) There was no lift to floor, so we had to get off two floors below and walk up a small awkward staircase. I understand that this is how it is in Paris, so it didn't bother me. The rooms were a little small, bland and not very homely. The bathroom was average. As it was our honeymoon, we were offered a bottle of champagne, which was a very nice gesture. The staff are more than helpful and friendly and the location was great. I was just not very impressed with the rooms and found it a bit overpriced compared to the other three star hotels in Paris that we stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff are Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: mhquay
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. Central to restaurants and sights of Paris. The room though not large was clean and comfortable and the breakfast more than adequate. Walk to many of the sights or catch the metro, which is only a short walk away. That brings me to the staff who really seem to care that you enjoy your stay. They remember who you are and are ever ready to please. I called into the hotel with my daughter six weeks after my first visit in late August, to show her where we had stayed earlier. The staff met us with a smile, as always, and even remembered our room number from the previous stay. Location, location, location with genuine friendly, helpful service. Would I stay there again? Most certainly!!

Reviews.Title: “CARING STAFF, GREAT ROOM, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: BrianL15
Reviews.Content: We picked the hotel because of reviews here, location and price. We were two parents and our 16 year old daughter. Honestly, I was expecting a small room in Paris. What we got instead was a room with two comfortable beds and two bathrooms--not small. The location is great. Lots of Metro stations near by. If you are into walking (and you should be if you go to Paris) much of Paris is within walking distance. We walked to the Siene, Louvre, the two Islands (Cite and St Louis), the Jewish Quarter and back without a problem. When we asked for restaurant suggestions, all but one was excellent (the other one was just good). The staff was attentive and always was great. Next trip to Paris, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anath Q
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gramont in August 2011. We decided to stay at this Hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed!!!! The Gramont is a lovely, small hotel which has been recently updated. There were four members of our family traveling together (2 adults and 2 children) and they had a great room to accomodate us with two baths. We were so glad to find a hotel where all four of us could stay in the same room! I emailed to make our reservations and received a response quickly from Sandra. The arrangements were complete in no time. We had never been to Paris and weren't sure which location would be the best. We were very happy to see we could walk everywhere but the hotel isn't in the noisy part of the city. We had great sushi with a short walk from the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We found a small self serve restaurant a short walk away for coffee and croissants which were superb (go right out of the hotel, right at the next main street and it is on the right about one block down) and inexpensive for Paris standards! We would definitely stay there again and feel lucky we found this hotel with all the choices in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: sabrinavel
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit and use tripadvisor for advice. I went to Hotel Gramont June 2010 and found absolutely everything fabulous! From the quick booking on the phone and then our emailing back and forth was within minutes whenever I had questions. Everybody there was amazing, especially Sandra, the manager. The front desk always had pamphlets,numbers etc. when it came to booking a show or something, they were very helpful with our questions. The room was very clean with such a friendly housekeeping staff. They also offered complimentary croissants in the morning. One thing that really stood out from the rest of the hotels was the managers generosity - on our last day there they called us a taxi and when we got there the taxi driving was screaming at us for having too many suitcases and told us he would make us late for our flight to Africa. Well as you know alot of words were exchanged, we got out which now made us very late to catch our flight. The manager then called another taxi told him to get there ASAP and when he got there she expressed the need to rush, felt bad for us and gave us 20 Euros which was such a very nice gesture on her part. If I ever go back, I would definetly stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: avelautham
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews. It has great proximity to many of the big ticket sites in Paris without the big ticket price. We seamlessly checked in and went for a 10 mile walk afterwards! Staff here are amazing, a smile for everything - you will feel at home here. I would say however that it surprises me that it is rated number 2 quite simply because alot of the rooms face the front of the hotel, therefore the lower floors have a direct view of an office opposite so you have to keep the curtains closed if you are dressing etc. The hairdryer was a basic 1970's design with a hose from the dryer which was connected to the wall [you know the ones I mean]. Products are what you expect from a cheaper hotel - we just brought our own. Back to the upside, it is unlikely that you will find a hotel with such good value in the area. The rooms appear to have been recently refurbished and the beds very comfortable. There is free wifi and a laptop and printer in reception for guests to use which is very handy. Overall it was perfect for a night, I would rate Hotel Le Petit Paris higher if you can get a comparable rate just based on a previous stay since it gives the perfect boutique hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!”
Reviews.Author: michellew501
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading about it on your website as we have previously been very happy with your recommendations. We were extremely happy with our room, the service and value for money. Sandra at reception was helpful, friendly and went out of her way to make reservations and recommendations for us. She is amazing! The downstairs lounge area is very cosy with newspapers, magazines to read and free coffee, water and croissants. The rooms were clean and the bed and bedding very comfortable. The hotel is very central and I will definitely stay there again, it was better than the 5 star hotel we stayed in on our previous visit at half the price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel In Paris”
Reviews.Author: JuniorTraveller14
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely MAGNIFICENT!!!!! Sandra, the receptionist was extremely helpful with all possible options for your stay in Paris. She is very welcoming and friendly at all times. The Hotel is in a very convenient position, within walking distance to Galleries Lafayette, the opera area, many museums and loads of restaurants and shops. Rooms are cosy, clean and comfortable. Internet Access is provided in the hotel lobby, Complementary snacks including croissants are provided on a daily basis.No wonder this hotel is ranked No.1 in Paris- AMAZING HOTEL. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is new to Paris. We definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: esther l
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel is a hidden gem. For those on a budget, the room was suitable and very clean. Sandra, the receptionist always went over and beyond to make your stay comfortable. She speaks four languages too. The snacks at the front desk were a real treat after a long day of walking and the breakfast was scumptious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is new to Paris. We arrived from Germany, Italy and Switzerland so if you have several pieces of large luggage I would recommend a larger room than the double/twin room we stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “No wonder this place is rated so highly on TA...”
Reviews.Author: Neesybella
Reviews.Content: This place has it all - great location, friendly staff, beautiful rooms, nice breakfast. The location is so central to everything we wanted - Opera metro, Galeries Lafayette for shopping, hop on hop off tour bus, walk to the Louvre and the Ritz for High tea, and loads of nice restaurants. Rooms are cosy and immaculately clean, and it was pretty quiet at night considering it was in the middle of everything. We were given easy instructions to make our own way to Versaille which saved us a fortune. We loved staying at the Hotel Gramont and look forward to staying there again next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful if you have physical limitations”
Reviews.Author: whitebearblanche
Reviews.Content: Lovely, helpful staff. But my husband has physical limitations and they put us in a deluxe room that not only had to be accessed by climbing steep stairs, but was two levels itself. The in- room stairs were also steep and you'd hit your head descending. Fine for agile guests, but they need to warn prospective guests- not appropriate for my husband.

Reviews.Title: “high expecations were meet all the way....”
Reviews.Author: cats10
Reviews.Content: Well we headed off to Paris for our 10th Wedding Anniversary. We picked our accomadtion from advise we got on tripadvisor.... So high expections we had. We arrived at 11 am and our room was ready to check in by Sandra. She is sooooo helpful ( this is mention in other reviews and she is lovely and helpful) the hotel is in a good location. Near the Opera metro station. Lots of resturants and shops near. the room was great. I have been in lots of french hotels and this was one of the best regarding funishings. Room was ok size, perfect as we were out visting the sites of Paris. If we ever go back to Paris we will be heading to the Hotel Graumont and will be telling family and friends too.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights in Paris”
Reviews.Author: georginahs
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to endorse all the other positive reviews - a really lovely hotel with such friendly, helpful staff, and in a great location for seeing all the sights - many which were walkable or easy to get to on the efficient metro system. I stayed here with my husband and our two daughters in a room for four - which was more like a suite with two separate sleeping areas with a large double bed and a sofa bed, and two shower rooms which were very useful. Room was immaculate with comfortable beds, and we all slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Big Smiles”
Reviews.Author: shoemouse
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel located in the center of the city, in the Opera District, within walking distance of many major sites. There are two metro stops and many bus lines that are nearby. The hotel itself has very small, well furnished,rooms with excellent bedding. Bathrooms are microscopic but one learns to adjust to the contortions that can be required to get around. It is quiet here except for the housekeeping staff that begins to open doors and collect their days' needs well before 9AM. One morning we were awakened at 8:15. Small has its downsides as the closing doors and conversation among the staff sound as if they are in the room. We would open our door to find piles of laundry in the hall-a minor but unnecessary eyesore. The upside, and the real driver of this hotel's charm, is the reception staff. Sandra's smile and greeting makes you forget the minor issues and keeps you focused on enjoying Paris. The rest of the staff were also engaging and helpful. Perhaps that is all one needs in Paris or anywhere else. We liked feeling welcome here. We liked the small touches such as the croissants, coffee, and water that are available in the lobby. And feeling welcome while away is what hospitality is all about.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB HOTEL WITH EXCELLENT STAFF AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: MaguireEssex
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hotel Gramont as part of my Father's 70th Birthday surprise. The staff there Sandra and Auriele advised and helped me plan the surprise. They were fantastic. I cannot fault this truly lovely hotel. It's spotlessly clean. All the rooms we had were a good size especially for Paris. The beds are one of the most comfortable I have slept in whilst being abroad. We had the quad/family room and were really happy with it. It had two shower rooms. My parents stayed in the Duplex room, which they were thrilled to bits with, especially as it has its own terrace. My Nephew had a very pleasant single room and my Brother a double whilst fairly small had everything he needed and had very nice decor again spotless. The hotel has a real homely feel to it and is extremely comfortable. Breakfast is a very good spread, excellent. In fact one day we decided to eat breakfast out on our way to visit the sights and were so disappointed in comparison to the great selection we had at the hotel. So thoroughly recommend you have the breakfast at the Gramont! I have been to Paris a few times and this is the best hotel I have stayed in there. Its location is perfect for all the sights; you can walk to everything. I will definitely stay here again and soon I hope. Finally what makes the Hotel Gramont so special is the staff. Sandra thank you so much you are an extraordinary lady, you really looked after us and always a smile on your face. Unfortunately did not get to meet Auriele as she was away during our stay, however she was very helpful with all the emails going back and fourth. Thank you Hotel Gramont, a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with terrific staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: leasler
Reviews.Content: From the time of check-in to leaving the hotel several days later, the service at this hotel was fantastic. The room was clean, nicely furnished, and cozy (roomy enough - it's Paris!).
