The front desk staff was terrific in suggesting restaurants, giving directions, reserving cabs, and making sure that we felt welcome in every way. I do not speak French, and it was no problem at all. The hotel is conveniently located to a lot of interesting sights, good restaurants, and access to public transport. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: CFLDI
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent staff, which coupled with its very central location, makes it an ideal place to stay. Rooms and bathrooms are very small, but I expect that's typical of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: Why is it the best? The hotel manager (Sandra) is far and beyond the best office manager of any hotel my wife and I have frequented, including many 5 star hotels. There's nothing she will not do to make your stay more pleasant. She will make reservations for you, she will give you pointers on travel and local sights and destinations, she will offer you afternoon coffee or tea and croissants. She is truly interested in the guest in every way. The room was a little bigger than most by Paris standards, but very, very comfortable. The bed was the most comfortable one we encountered in our stay in France. The AC works fine, something that is not true of many of the Paris hotels. The Wifi could have been a little stronger at times but was still adequate for me to do some work at the office while overseas for two weeks. We didn't try the breakfast, but it looked well prepared and with sufficient variety for the breakfast eaters. Don't miss this hotel. It's in a business district but very close to at least 3 Metro stations. We zipped all over Paris, and Sandra even arranged for us to see Versailles, even though we had not put it on our "to do" list for Paris. What a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John and Yoko W
Reviews.Content: Visited Paris with family in August and stayed in two rooms in Hotel Gramont. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and the location was superb. However our greatest compliment has to go to the exceptional reception staff who were very friendly and always willing to help. I wish all hotels were like this one. Really enjoyed the breakfasts in a lovely dining area in the basement. Merci beacoup.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bucky52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Gramont for our 10th anniversary trip. The hotel was spacious by Paris standards and nicely appointed. We had a 2nd story room with double French door open windows and geraniums in the window boxes. Very comfortable bed and linens. We ate breakfast in the small breakfast room and enjoyed delicious croissants, pastries, cheese, fruit and coffee. There was much more on the breakfast buffet. Terrific staff, especially the manager Sandra and all the concierge services provided (eg restaurant suggestions and reservations, site seeing& tips)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay great people!”
Reviews.Author: Pickettman
Reviews.Content: Great location for Hop on Hop off bus. Shopping close. Staff was great will directions and big tip on Louvre. Will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, and service”
Reviews.Author: 7n1dwarf
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews on this hotel are well-deserved. We stayed in a quadruple room on the 5th floor. We thought it would just be a "big" room with a bed and a sofa bed but were pleasantly surprised to find 2 adjoining rooms with a bathroom each. Very nice! Having 2 bathrooms instead of just one helped us get things moving faster in the mornings. The hotel is very easy to locate. Since we came from Gare du Nord via Eurostar from London, we just took the metro and transferred to the 3 line, getting off Quatre Septembre. Not only is the hotel easy to locate, it's also in a great location. It's in a quiet street but within walking distance to the Louvre, the Opera area, etc. There are tons of restaurants in the area and the hotel staff can recommend some really good ones too. For the location and service alone, one would think the price would be exorbitant but the rates are very reasonable indeed. This hotel is truly a great find in the great city of Paris. I will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and will be back”
Reviews.Author: ajcJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be well situated, tube a block away, nice restaurants close proximity. We were two families and could not fault it. Had a room for four, was a tightsqueeze but we were travelling for a month and had a lot of luggage. I'm 6ft 2 and found showers a bit small but the rest of the family was fine. Can't comment on breakfast as we were never there. Staff were extremely pleasant and help full and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Well run great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rodrigo707
Reviews.Content: Absolutely enjoyed this hotel! great hotel and very personalized service - always felt like a star during my stay. Very nice rooms and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: brideagain2011
Reviews.Content: Wow! This was my 1st trip to Paris, and I was concerned about making a good choice of hotel. What a fantastic surprise! (Seriosly, you had me at hot fresh, chocolate croissant!) The staff was lovely, and did everything possible to make our brief stay extra special. The hotel, and room were exactly as pictured; compact, but spotless. At first glance, we thought the breakfast room must have been a bomb shelter, but after we got avtaste of the food, we forgot all about that. For a very small up charge, we added the daily break-feast.....pastries, cereal, yogurt, meat/cheese tray, fruit....and eggs cooked to order. An outstanding value, and so fresh & yummy. Fresh, warm croissants are almost always stocked in the lobby too. The location is very convenient, centered between 3 metro stops, with dozens of cares and restaurants within a 3 minute walk, as well as multiple small markets so you can stock the fridge in your room. It's an easy walk to the Lourve-I strongly recommend the Museum Pass (available at the front desk) if you are planning to go to more than 1-2 museums. It can be a bargain if you want to go to a lot of attractions, but the true value is in bypassing the ticket lines! We sailed past a huge line at the Lourve, saving at least a 45 minute wait. Since we were there in summer, the strong air-conditioning was very much appreciated. Besides being spotlessly clean, our room was also charming, with fresh, subtle decor. Still, it's Paris, and the room was quite......compact. There was an open shelf area, rather than a true closet. Storing large suitcases was a bit of a challenge. Through our stay, the staff continued to provide service over and above, getting a reservation at a lovely restaurant (Dorant), helping with directions, booking a car to the airport, and even offering us a bottle champagne as it was part of our honeymoon. The only con I can think of is that the neighborhood borders on a working class business district and was quiet over our weekend stay, yet slightly less than charming. Our window looked into an office building, and I imagine it could get noisy during business hours. Even so, the proximity to the sights far outweighs this slight drawback. I thought the hotels photos were quite accurate, no need to add my own. I will certainly return whenever I can.

Reviews.Title: “Completely adequate.”
Reviews.Author: fussygirlnz
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable; quiet; friendly staff. Easy to find from the airport (take the bus to Opera from CDG for 10 euros). I highly recommend the nearby Les Bistronomes for lunch/dinner -- charming staff, excellent food. Easy walk to the Louvre and Au Printemps. Downside? Breakfast pretty ordinary, in the basement, but this is standard for hotels in this class in Paris. Oh, and the reception staff "recommended" a chain boulangerie to me (I'm a tourist, I guess) when I would like to know GOOD food options. A reliable option but did I love it? No. Am I a bit hard to please? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “just lush”
Reviews.Author: peterr1982
Reviews.Content: had a great time staff were fab and friendly room was just lush would deffo stay again

Reviews.Title: “If all 3 star hotels were this good you would not need to pay for 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Tinkmuff
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent 3 star hotel. I booked a double room with an extra bed and the room was a good size and immaculately clean. The shower/bath was separate from the toilet which was useful, with some complimentary toiletries. All furnishings throughout the hotel were of good quality and felt contemporary. The breakfast room was small but pleasant with a small but nice selection of food. The hotel staff spoke perfect English, were always smiling and helpful. Excellent hotel for the Louvre (10 mins walk) and shopping Galleries Layfatte (5 mins).

Reviews.Title: “lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: kiwitripper64
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Paris. Gramont is a lovely hotel in a fantastic location. ALL rooms in Paris are small or super pricey. We asked for a room with double bed and foldaway. With just 2 of us and the foldaway folded up it was great. We didnt try the breakfast, but the staff, room and location were fantastic 2 min walk to local metro ( Quatre Septembre), 5 to Opera and 15 to Louvre. A good day trip is up early buy pastrie and coffee on way to Louvre by 8.30 and watch the queue grow. In and straight to Mona Lisa while the crowds are small, then spend reat of morning sampling at your leisure. Tip, have coffee at Cafe Richelou on floor 2 of Richelieu. Not too expensive, quiet and what a view. Then on to Musee D'Orsai. Then over Sienne to Tuileries gardens and on to Champs Elysees and up to Arc DTriumph and finish with a meal on the champs. Lots aof walking but acheivable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Wtravler2866
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel. I stayed there for 2 nights on business. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Very comfortable and quite. Would love to come back for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel ideally located to many Paris landmarks”
Reviews.Author: chrisandkit
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Paris with our 16-year old daughter and stayed here. The front desk staff was so warm and welcoming from the minute we arrived to the minute we left. They were helpful with directions and advice. The hotel is in the opera district and only about a 10-minute jog to the Louvre and the Seine River. We left the hotel each morning to go for a run and were able to get to some of the most beautiful scenery in Paris within minutes. But the best part is coming back and eating (slightly more guilt-free after the run) the wonderful breakfast that the hotel offers. They have an excellent selection in a cute basement room of the hotel. We stayed in a room for 3 - queen bed and a twin bed. The room was huge based on European standards - spacious shower/sink area and with a separate toilet area - all contained privately in our room. It also had a large entry area which allowed space to organize luggage, packages, etc. as the week went on. Wireless internet access was easy as well. The room was clean and service was great. Also, Rue Gramont is one block off of the main street which allows for a quiet, peaceful sleep at night. I recommend you bring your own U.S. adapters however. The hotel has a box of adapters for all different countries to loan you, however, it would be time consuming to go through them all to find if a U.S. one is actually in there. :-) We loved this hotel and would not hesitate to visit again when back in Paris. What a magical city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philip C
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel for central Paris. The staff were excellent and very helpful and the rooms were very comfortable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: doggerCA
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! After a week in a large hotel in London, this place was a nice change. Very personal service...the front desk staff were all extremely nice and helpful and spoke English (which was helpful for us since our French was minimal!). Triple room was fine for the two of us and our son, with one large bed and one twin. The room also had a small entry area for luggage and a divided bathroom. Plus free internet. Walking distance to the Louvre and many shops and restaurants. We were sorry we only had two nights here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: BlueHarvest
Reviews.Content: The first stop on a month long tour. Had just endured a 34 hour trip and was looking forward to a hot shower. We landed at CDG early in the morning and was expecting to drop the luggage at reception and walk around Paris with Jet lag until 2pm. To my great suppris, when i arrived at the hotel at 930am, the room was ready! Arthur quickly cheked us in hassle free and within 30 mins we were showered canged an ready to tackle Paris. Our room was on the ground floor which was a god send (not hving to cart luggage) was extremely clean and very spacious. The staff were very helpful and Orily (one of the reception managers) booked us a table at THE best Brasserie I have ever eaten in. 10 out of 10 for Hotel Gramont

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL WITH LOVELY HELPFUL STAFF IN QUIET LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: europhile_11
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent gem in Paris and great value. As family of three we took a large room which comprised two rooms and two bathrooms and although compact was exceptionally clean and lovely. Sandra and Aurelie cannot do enough for you in terms of recommendation and travel tips/bookings and I love the quiet neighborhood which is so close to all major sites in comfortable walking distance. The free wireless access if great and - even in five star hotels in which we frequently stay - is not a usual requirement. This is a lovely great value for money hotel in which we really enjoyed our stay and has been better than some 5 star places in Paris twice the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: johndhenry
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, very large for Paris, excellent service, large rooms, new bathrooms (our room suite had two), great location, very good beds (restful night's sleep), AC worked beautifully, plenty of space for 2 adults and two tweens, windows open for fresh air, blinds work well at making room dark, hotel/external noise minimal, great/knowledgeable concierge. Great value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique...what a wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Foti_40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Gramont for 5 nights, our room was a family room with 2 bathrooms, this was excellent for 4 adults as not many family rooms have 2 bathrooms anywhere in Europe. Room was a good size for 4 by Paris standards and had everything you needed free wifi as well, and very central. The thing that makes this place very special are the staff they are amazing, always wanting to help, it's as if we were staying with family. We had a fantastic and unforgettable time in Paris but you do not get the total experience unless you stay at Hotel Gramont, we were very fortunate. We wouldn't stay anywhere else In Paris. Thank you Sandra, Amelie and others.  The Beratis Family

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler00004
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Opera district of Paris. It is centrally located between many sites of interest to tourists. The Louvre and the Toulleries are and easy walk, as is the metro which can take you anywhere you want in the city and beyond. We were travelling with our 2 children (ages 11 & 13). The room was very comfortable (we used their family room which holds 4). We had access to it through 2 doors but it was all one suite. It had a double bed and pull out couch which slept 2. There were 2 bathrooms which was nice for getting ready each day. The room was beautiful, comfortable and clean. Breakfast at the hotel was a treat -- best breakfast anywhere during our 2 weeks of travel in UK and Paris! The vault is an interesting room. They offer pastries, meats, cheeses, fruit, yogurt, poached eggs, juice, coffee, tea, cereal. The service at the hotel was great. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful with everything. Our family is in full agreement that we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JB6878
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights recently , and it is a lovely small Hotel. We asked for a room with a balcony and it was ready for us when we arrived at about 11.30am. It was a small room, but clean with a comfortable bed. The toiletries in the bathroom are nice but the hairdryer in the bathroom isn't the best so maybe bring your own. We chose this Hotel due to the location and the good reviews, and the location was a major plus point for us. We did not need to go on the metro as we walked to the sights and it was surrounded by good brasseries and cafes. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, we did not have breakfast in the hotel so cannot comment on this. Our room had a shower , no bath which was what we requested and there was no noise in the evening to disturb our sleep. Overall this is not a cheap hotel but the location is fantastic and I would definitely recommend it .

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, comfy room, good location”
Reviews.Author: MartinCC
Reviews.Content: Very friendly helpful Staff. Comfortable room with clean spacious shower. Good location close to 3 metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel with absolutely great service”
Reviews.Author: Magajo
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Gramont due to the excellent Tripadvisor's reviews and we were not disappointed at all. Our triple room was quite large and simple, almost spartan, but functional; the bathroom was also large although again simple; the room was located at the street level so we could log on to the free wifi from the lobby area; and still it was not noisy at all since the Gramont street is very quiet. The lobby area is small being a boutique hotel and they offer free refreshments and coffee, and sometimes even pastries; there is a tiny bar in there that may offer some wine and beer options in the evening, but we really never tried since we were gone all day touring the city and dining outside. Breakfast is the typical small European buffet style with basically everything you need to start the day, in the basement area which closes for the rest of the day. The hotel is very well located closed to subway and the turistic bus, and only a few minutes away from major attractions. There is a delicious authentic italian restaurant a half block away were we dined the last night in Paris and we were greatly surprised. What really made our stay a Gramont Hote an absolute perfect experience was the service we received from the front desk, from the day we arrived until the day we left...superb, always with a big radiant smile...our big THANKS to Sandra and the rest of the staff...next time in Paris we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: Almac71
Reviews.Content: So glad I booked this hotel after reading the comments on trip advisor. Everything was perfect...I was travelling on my own so my single room was just the ideal size for 1. The staff was amazing...all 3 whom I dealt with...Arthur I saw the most. I cannot recommend this place highly enough...from location to size, to cleanness...again tho, the staff are what make this place so special. Thank you so much for such a great stay & thanks trip advisor...that's 2 out of 2 winners!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and outstanding staff!”
Reviews.Author: theorphanarium
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Gramont Opera. The location was perfect, just a short walk from the Metro. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff were exceptional and made our stay really wonderful. They were extremely helpful, always willing to go the extra mile to ensure we had what we needed or knew where we were going. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: KalMel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gramont Opera in June on our holiday in Paris. We are so very impressed with this hotel. The room is very nice, comfortable and modern. The location is great. It is very close to many many restautants and shopping, within a short walking distance. Most importantly, the staff are very friendly and helpful. Their English is excellent. We really enjoyed our stay here, and will certainly stay here again next time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in service”
Reviews.Author: ImpairedVisions
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived on a Sunday afternoon, and after discovering that we were sharing a queen bed, the beds were separated and new linens provided without hesitation. I found our room to be very adequate, and the hotel location suited us very well. We were able to walk to the Louvre in just fifteen minutes. There are good restaurants and shopping very close by, and we found the neighborhood to be quiet and clean. Our room was one level above street level, and faced the street, and we slept soundly.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Annelig
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in Paris and is easily accessible from the bus station at the Opera. We had a disabled room on the ground floor behind reception. We were not satisfied with this and asked to switch but they said we couldn't. (Very strange as I booked a doubleroom several months ahead) The room was however spacious and clean, but because you could look straight in from the sidewalk, we chose to have the curtains drawn the entire stay. This made the room very dark. We found the staff very helpful. (except that they gave us this disabled noisy room)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Great Personnel”
Reviews.Author: Roberto10
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room (me, my wife and my daughter ) for 9 nigths on july. The size of the room was very good (large for european standard) and all looked like new and clean. Our room was on 1st floor and, at first, I thought we would have problems with noise from the street, but that was not a problem ( not even at the afternoon when we used to get back to the hotel to take a nap). There are 3 metro stations next to the hotel. We used 2 of them (Opera and Richelieu Drouot) and from them we could reach to all attractions we wanted to visit. Places you can go easily on foot from the hotel : Opera Garnier , Madeleine Church, Galleries Laffayete, Louvre Museum. In Fact, only Eiffel Tower is a bit far to go on foot (But we did it once without problems and my 12 year daugther doesn't like walking too much !!! ). We decided to eat breakfast at the hotel almost every day and, in spite of the place reserved for breakfast being small, we always found table available for us to seat. There isn't a huge variety of food, but it was very good for us to start the day. And, finally, as many other reviews stated, one of the greatest ( or the great ) highlight of the hotel is its personnel, mainly Sandra ( the manager ) who is always smiling and ready to help with anything you may need. In fact, I can say that Sandra became a friend of our family. In our next visit to Paris ( unfortunately I don't know when ) we'll definitely stay on Hotel Gramont again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing retreat after sightseeing in the city”
Reviews.Author: dramamama359
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a family vacation in France, with four days in Paris (my husband and I and two twentysomething daughters). I agree with the reviews here that this hotel is wonderful. Wonderfully placed, wonderful staff, wonderful rooms. Cities can be hot, crowded and sometimes a little too exciting! The staff at the Gramont goes above and beyond to make sure you are comfortable when you arrive, and after a long day of seeing the many treasures of Paris. Sandra and crew are always pleasant, helpful and kind. The rooms were pristinely clean, cool and cozy. There was plenty of room for us to stretch out and relax when we needed to and it was quiet at night. Everyone is more than willing to help you plan your day, find your way or get what you need. Breakfast is more than sufficient, fresh and convenient. I loved that we could buy our museum passes (good for two days) right at the desk also...avoided long ticket buying lines at the sites! The location was excellent with two metro stops very close by. And when I said 'shopping' Sandra's face lit up in appreciation and she pointed us in exactly the right directly for a little French fashion! All in all, we felt like family at this hotel and we certainly will stay again when we return to Paris! Thanks Sandra and crew! M & M Hatem

Reviews.Title: “Pokey and over priced”
Reviews.Author: VEP
Reviews.Content: I've used the info on Tripadvisor many times and found it generally accurate so I cannot understand what's going on here - The Hotel Gramond is vastly over-rated and far too highly ranked. Are they posting their own notices? I stayed here with my adult daughter for 2 nights in July and we were very disappointed....... Firstly the twin room I thought I'd booked turned out to have a double bed and and extra camp bed (intended for a child I think?). The mattress on the camp bed was so thin that you could feel the metal frame through it. The double bed was hard and also uncomfortable. On investigation it turned out that it was actually a bed that pulled down from a wall cupboard!!!! There were no bedside tables or lamps just tiny alcoves in the wall and spot lights above. The second major inconvenience was the window - the room was on the ground floor with a window that opened directly onto the pavement of Rue Gamont. This meant that we couldn't open it at night or even safely during the day. We also couldn't open the curtains as passers by had a clear view into the room. We were in a perpetual twilight zone. After the first night I reported to the Receptionist that the room was so hot that we hadn't been able to sleep - she apologised and said there had been an over-sight and the centrally operated air-conditioning has not been activated - great! The basement breakfast room was reached down steep stairs and along a corridor cluttered with cleaning materials and boxes. The room was windowless, cramped and uninviting and the breakfast at 13€ looked decidedly lack-lustre. We gave it a miss and enjoyed a great breakfast in the sunshine at a near-by cafe for 7€. A good nights sleep and a decent breakfast is surely the least to expect from any hotel and definitely from a hotel claiming 3 stars and charging 181€ per night. The manager's PR which follows each complaint can't explain away our poor experience.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: kmac45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gramont Opera in Paris which we chose for its location and reviews which confirmed its very Parisien feel and the hotel didn't disappoint on any aspect. Our room, which was small by North American standards was perfect, complete with a tiny balcony overlooking the roof tops of Paris. It was a very comfortable room with excellent linens and a very modern bathroom. The location cannot be beat. On a quiet side street but with many shops and restaurants within a very short walk it was perfect. We were able to walk to both Mont Matre and the Eiffel Tower from this location, something we did in the same day! There are also some amazing little restaurants within a very short distance. The comments about the staff could not be more true, and we found everyone, without exception to be incredibly friendly and helpful. My only suggeston would be to bring your own hairdryer as the one provided in the bathroom is a funny little nozzle type thing which was a bit tough to use!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would book with them again.”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBunky
Reviews.Content: We had to book an extra night in Paris, I found this one on trip advisor, we were not disappointed. We were greeted by a very friendly lady at the front. The room was quite large for Europe standards. We had a double bed and two full bathrooms, very clean. Breakfast was 11 euros on top of the price, but was very much worth it. We had eggs, toast, cereal, pastries, fruit, yogurt and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel I will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: suzellantwit
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally situated in the Opera House region. It was in a a small side street and looked quite traditional from the outside. Inside was beautifully decorated and the room we had was traditional but had every modern convenience. The large window overlooking the street opened to reveal a window box well stocked with bright red geraniums. The huge bed was comfortable and the bathroom modern and very clean. We travelled to Paris by Eurostar and the journey from the Gare de Nord by Taxi cost 10 Euros. The staff in the hotel were particularly friendly, helpful and efficient. In fact I don't think I have ever come across anyone as helpful as Sandra the cheerful receptionist. It gave the hotel a family feel often missing in hotels in large cities. There was a small lounge bar area where mineral water were available free of charge and coffee pots were placed mid morning, sometimes with some croissants/pain au chocolat which had been left over after breakfast. There was a lap top and printer in this area for the use of the guests and wifi was free. All in all a brilliant hotel, not cheap but worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: HappyAussies72
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel, staffed by people that are patient, polite, warm, friendly and extremely knowledgeable re transport to the famous tourist attractions and the best restaurants in Paris to visit that are not too expensive! Upon arrival a friendly smile, a map of Paris and a room that was spotlessly clean, comfortable and in a quiet location, which we found was very relaxing after a busy day of sightseeing in crowds. Breakfast was lovely, all the croissants you could manage, once again adequate for our needs, generous, and good coffee! This hotel is excellent value for three star, the staff we would rate 5 star, well done Aurelie, Sandra and Max. Select this quaint 3 star hotel for everything you need to feel comfortable, clean and safe, and for the excellent customer service that is worth it's wait in gold!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordably priced”
Reviews.Author: buckiz1980
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great neighborhood on a quiet street within fairly short walking distance of two metro stops, which makes it very convenient to site seeing in Paris, and a bunch of cafes and restaurants. We only had one night in Paris, and the hotel was ideal for being able to check back in on all of the major tourist sites. Last time we stayed on Ile Ste Louis, and we were pleased with this neighborhood as we were there. It is also a five minute cab ride to Gare du Nord (the north train station), and when the receptionist called a cab, it was there within five minutes. The room was what you would expect of a place in Paris rated this highly on TripAdvisor - small, but clean and comfortable and with a nice bathroom. I emailed the hotel to make dinner reservations in advance of our trip, and they were happy to take care of everything for us and confirmed it right away. All in all, I would definitely stay here again - I'm sure we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bijoux Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Inhggfd
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this real gem of a hotel in a perfect location, within a stones throw of the Opera house. The decor in the hotel is beautiful, the bathroom was newly re-furbished and the bed was really comfortable. The staff were very good, and spoke perfect English. I had forgotten my adaptor plug and they kindly let me borrow one. In fact I had better service in this hotel than some 5 star hotels I have stayed in. The breakfast buffet had loads of choice, and I had scrambled eggs made upon my request. I would defiantly recommend this hotel for a short stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Staff are Great”
Reviews.Author: PaulnDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed and found the staff to be EXCELLENT. Helped with directions, recommended restaurants, even mailed my sport coat left in the lobby back to my house in the USA. Will go back and can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ranses1
Reviews.Content: traducción del español al inglés Well summarizing some staying at the hotel, we only have good reviews, very good area, dealing with customers excellent, clean and good habitibilidad of the rooms, which are not large but are distributed, so they are very welcoming. Thanks for everything Jose Emilio Ramirez España-andalucia-cadiz oboelizo@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service, we'll be back :)”
Reviews.Author: biancacasha
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gramont Opera is in a great location, close to the metro and bus stops, one of the safest districts in Paris, and nicest!! You can walk it to Champs Elysees and the Arc de Triumph, as well as the Louvre Museum. The hotel has nice, clean rooms and the service is amazing, all the staff are welcoming, friendly and very helpful :) ... I recommend this hotel to everyone, and next time i visit Paris I will surely be back =)

Reviews.Title: “The benchmark for hotels”
Reviews.Author: Winebuff1951
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 of our friends spent 3 days at this hotel and experienced a standard of accommodation and service we have never previously experienced in our travels. The attention to detail in every aspect of the accommodation was without peer. Although the rooms are compact the bed, mattress, linen, towels and furnishings are all of good quality and the rooms are impeccably clean. The range, quality and quantity of food and drinks at breakfast should satisfy even the most finicky guest . The standard of personal care, attention and assistance offered by Sandra and all the other staff exceeds that of the best large 4 and 5 star hotels. Every guest receives friendly and caring attention at all times. In the future we will use Hotel Gramont Paris as the benchmark to measure the standard of hotels we use in out travels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Alison1285
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two daugthers last weekend & we had a wonderful time. Our room was lovely with comfortable beds & pillows. Sandra greeted us & could not have been more helpful and friendly. We walked everywhere from the hotel, including to the Eiffel Tower one day. It is a great place to stay, a big well done to Sandra & all her team

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Parisian hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sakamafra
Reviews.Content: Great family room. Clean and, for Paris, roomy. Fab shower roomand nice decor. Close to metro and shops. Staff helpful and friendly. Really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value, good location, awesome mattresses.”
Reviews.Author: EugW
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gramont is a little gem of a hotel conveniently located within close walking distance of several popular Paris tourist attractions, and close to a metro station as well. The hotel staff for our stay was very pleasant, polite, and helpful. Not surprisingly for Paris in this price range, our regular 2-person room was quite small, which meant there wasn't much space for our two large suitcases, and the bathroom was similarly small. However, the room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable with an excellent Posturepedic mattress, and good quality linens. In fact, the bed was as comfortable as the best 4 and 5 star hotels I've stayed in. The air conditioning worked well too, and was very quiet which, along with the great mattress, helped us get a good night's sleep after our long flight. In our fifth floor room the (complimentary) WiFi was weak but usable, and it was very strong in the lobby of course. Overall I think Hotel Gramont is an excellent value and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Mac030203
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights last week after finding it on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We stayed in a Quadruple room on the 5th floor, which really consisted of two double bedrooms with two bathrooms connected by a door. The rooms were spotless, the beds were great and the bathrooms were so clean too. Rooms werent huge but we didnt expect lots of space in Paris. We had breakfast one of the mornings (away too early the second) and it was great - no hot food as such but lots of choice otherwise. Great location too, only 10 to 15 mins to the Louvre and less than 5 mins from nearest metro station. Lastly, but most importantly, the staff here are amazing. Sandra was so welcoming and friendly every time we entered reception, went out of her way to help us with our safe, recommended and booked a restaurant for us and was very helpful with directions. As for Arthur, well he saved us from our mother having a mini meltdown when we discovered that all taxis and shuttles were striking on the morning we had to go to the airport. We hadnt travelled on the metro during our trip so were a bit wary, but Arthur gave us step by step instructions of what lines to go on, how long for and all about the Orly bus. In the end thanks to his directions it was so easy, so thank you Arthur. All in all, the staff of this hotel and the hotel itself made our stay in Paris wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “All around excellence!”
Reviews.Author: TKARCAROLA
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. 1-The manager Sandra went above and beyond what we expected to make sure our exerience was a great one. She recommended restaurants and called to make the reservations for us. Sandra figured out how to get us reservations to a concert at St. Chapelle and got us first row seats. 2-The hotel room was immaculate. We had room 405, a double with a shower. There was a huge closet for clothes and lots of space for suitcases.The bed was comfortable and the bathroom always clean.High quality towels & bed linens added to the positive experience. 3-Location,location,location- We took the Roissy bus to get there and a shuttle to go home. The metro is very close and easy to use. Many restaurants are with in walking distance. We walked to the Louvre area in 10-15 minutes. 4-The wi-fi worked great in the room. 5-The room had a thermostat to control the air conditioning 6-Water temp and pressure was great. We were very happy with our hotel experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emmy1778
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed in a boutique hotel before I wasn't sure what to expect. I loved it! You couldn't ask for friendlier, more knowledgeable staff. Having never been to Paris before their help & patience were crucial! Thank You Sandra!!! I was expecting a much smaller room, than what we actually got. We had a basic double room, which I thought was rather large by European standards. Plenty of storage and room to spread out luggage. Loved the bathroom & shower. Plenty of hot water & good water pressure. The room was spotlessly clean, the cleanest place we stayed during our entire 2 week trip. The beds were very comfortable with great, high quality linens. After getting the lay of the city, I came to realize the location of the hotel couldn't have been better. Several Metro stations close by. Don't worry, the Metro is actually very easy. As an added bonus, the room had a small Juliette balcony with doors that opened onto a delightful side street. However, this street could be noisy at night. Breakfast selection was poor, especially for American selections. I'd skip it. Even though you're in Paris, be sure to eat at the Italian restaurant right next door to the hotel! Food was excellent! There's also a Monoprix just at the end of the block to get cheap snacks & bottled drinks. The hotel has free Wi Fi & it worked great on our smart phones. On a side note, took a night tour with Paris Authentic cars and it was fabulous, highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect manager, well located”
Reviews.Author: Alexandre92100
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night only but it was really a very good stay. The manager, Sandra, is really adorable. Always in a good mood, always with a smile...That's so uncommon in Paris (I know what I'm talking about, I've lived there for 30 years)!! All the people of the hotel, including the maids, are really nice. The room was the n°51. Good size for the Paris standard, bathroom size ok, but you'd better be fit ;-) plenty of storage. The breakfast was really good with a wide range of products. The location is fine, even if the neighbourhood is really quiet at night. You'll have to walk a little or take the métro to find some busy places. I would really recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay while in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: FalcoG
Reviews.Content: Thank you Sandra for welcoming me at your fine hotel! It was always a pleasure to arrive at the hotel and find you always smiling and cheerful. It really helps when you find the perfect hotel and very nice people working there and helping you and making you feel good. The room was great, second floor, fantastic bed and pillows, very clean, great shower. The breakfast was delicious and loved to see the nice girl attending always with a smile. The location was perfect, I walked everywhere and felt very safe Again Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff at a great hotel. Hope to go back soon!”
Reviews.Author: jlchristensen
Reviews.Content: Sandra (hotel manager) and the staff we interacted with (Aurelie and Anne-Sophie) were friendly, helpful, professional and kind. They gave restaurant and sightseeing suggestions and offered assistance for anything we might need. I left my cell phone charger in the room and Sandra is sending it to me without making me feel like it is an inconvenience. Our room was a nice size with comfortable beds and pillows. It was also quiet and dark which was wonderful for sleep. The lobby was clean and nicely decorated with a laptop for guest use. The hotel is also located fairly close to the Roissybus stop which runs to and from the airport frequently. This was very convenient. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: SwedishMagnus
Reviews.Content: I was met by the very friendly and helpful staff and they sent me to the elevator which took me to my room. They did not follow me into the elevator because there was only room for one. The room was a single room and it was small. If you need more space, book a double. There was no AC so I had to open the window to the noisy street. Against all odds I liked the hotel anyway. The staff, the free WiFi and the breakfast buffet helped a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: blondiefoxy
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel after researching on the internet for some time! The selection of hotels in Paris is huge but we were more than impressed with our choice. (Thank's to trip advisor!) From the moment we arrived until checking out, the hotel staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. Our room was spotless, well decorated and really comfortable. The position of the hotel was perfect for all the major attractions, all within walking distance! Can't wait to return. You won't make a better choice in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The high ranking is thoroughly deserved”
Reviews.Author: pwlfcfan
Reviews.Content: This hotel met two of my top criteria for a city hotel: 1) The place was spotless, my bedroom was one of the cleanest I have stayed in and I have stayed in many hotels over the years. 2) The front desk staff were welcoming and very helpful. I felt they would have been only too willing to sort out any issues arising. I slept in a single room on the first floor. The hotel is situated on a side road off the lively Boulevard Capucine. Despite being only on the 1st floor it was surprisingly quiet, probably due to the good design of the windows. The location is excellent, cafe life on the Boulevard is only a hundred yads or so away and Boulevard Hauseman with its many shops is only a 10 minute walk. I chose the buffet breakfast for 13 euro at the hotel which is served in what appears to have been a wine cellar and enjoyed orange juice/multivitamin juice, cereals, dried fruit, yoghurt, french bread, toast and jam, coffee. Also available within the buffet was a choice of eggs, cooked meats etc, apple tart, pancake. There was a choice of four gourmet/speciality jams that were all delicious. My only criticism would be that a better choice of cereal would be appreciated (only corn flakes or a chocolate cereal on display) but the French are not so into cereals as the Brits. The wi fi worked well so I was able to keep up to date. There is also a computer available in the reception/lounge. I slept in a single room but the bed was queen size and quite comfortable. The shower was excellent. The room was a little on the small side but more than adequate for my needs. It would be unusual to find large rooms in smaller hotels in central Paris. On departure I checked out a double room that room service was cleaning with a view to staying again in the future with my wife. It was much larger. Checkout time was mid day so I did not feel rushed. I recommend this hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find!”
Reviews.Author: IntlFamily
Reviews.Content: Small, clean, quiet and extremely Well kept. This is a little gem not to be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Staff - Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MissMeredith
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Europe my husband and I stayed at the Gramont hotel in Paris. It was our first stop in Europe and we weren't sure what to expect. We were thrilled with the choice we made for this hotel. The location is great; very easy walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, San Chappelle and The Opera House. The staff was very friendly and helpful - Arthur was exceptional. Our buffet breakfast was more than we expected. Fresh meats, cheeses, french bread, croissants, etc... The room was small but very clean and up to date. I loved the large window you could open to let in fresh air. Great hotel - we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel in Paris - so helpful!”
Reviews.Author: TerryKnoxville
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gramont Opera was a wonderful place for our first visit to Paris. We are a family of 4 adults, so we stayed in the large family room, which worked out really well. The airlines lost both my husband's and my son's luggage. The hotel staff were so helpful in tracking our luggage - my husband's arrived the next day, and my son's arrived after 4 days. Sandra and her staff were always friendly and helpful, and provided good suggestions for transportation, attractions, etc. There is access to the internet in the lobby, which was very convenient. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Louvre, and the hotel was very convenient to numerous restaurants, movie cinemas, many shops, huge department stores, and of course the Opera Garnier. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelseyhubar
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and big enough for a couple and a child. Nice bathroom. The staff was friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value and service for a hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Storres1970
Reviews.Content: We chose this boutique hotel based on the great Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. We were greeted by Sandra, who was incredibly friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The location was only minutes from the Opera and Louvre and most of the other key sites. We normally stay at the high-end hotels, but we really enjoyed our stay here and would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful location, staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sretsam
Reviews.Content: Before I left I emailed the hotel for Metro directions, which was promptly answered with clear instructions so I arived easily. The Hotel staf were welcoming, friendly and knowledgable. They offered sound advice on a number of issues, including a lovely restaurant down the road. The sinlge room I stayed in was a good size as was the bathrom, and both were spotless. I have stayed in 'boxes' in cenrtal Paris before so this was a pleasant suprise. The rrom had airconditioning which was quiet and I didn't get bothered by any street noise at night. The location means lots of atractions are in walking distance, and the totally stunning Opera is just around the corner. I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel,and I will certainly stay there next time I'm in Paris. Thanks to the staff for making my 3 nights so easy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Trip of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: MicheleNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I visited Paris to celebrate a "milestone" birthday. We selected the Hotel Gramont based purely on the Trip Advisor reviews. Our hotel stay was wonderful! Sandra and Aurelie were so helpful, the rooms were clean and well appointed and the breakfast each morning was delicious. The most important feature of this hotel is the location----we walked everywhere! It is so centrally located--close to the Louvre, Notre Dame, shopping and many great bistros and restaurants. The metro is near, but we never needed to take it--we took a taxi to the Eiffel Tower, but otherwise walked all around. We highly recommend--and want to come back soon! Thanks to the great staff for wonderful memories.

Reviews.Title: “Superb small hotel: don't forget to grab a croissant!”
Reviews.Author: SAR90403
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but superlative comments for everything about our stay at this small hotel near Opera. The hotel helped us establish an inexpensive shuttle service back-and-forth to CDG. The hotel manager, Sandra, is "c'est magnifique" as is the rest of the hotel staff by accommodating to our every need in English language and by their actions. The room was a good size, for Paris, and very comfortable. The location allows excellent access to the Metro and is a short distance from Opera. The price is an excellent value. Don't forget to grab a superb croissant from the basket of freebies on your way up to (or down from) your room!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel choice, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: barusso
Reviews.Content: I am remiss at not writing a review upon our return last June (2010), but feel so strongly and positively about the experience and value that we feel compelled to do so now. I have stayed at many hotels, some more expensive, in Paris and really enjoyed this one above the others. The rooms were very clean and modern, beds very comfortable, the location is super (and on a quiet street) and the staff was unfailingly friendly and helpful to all. we actually had 2 rooms, as my husband left a couple days earlier than I. The first was a "split level" room with a Queen (or King?) upstairs and a single and alcove downstairs, with a great balcony - great for families. The second room was just one regular Queen, but fairly spacious for Europe (I had a smaller room at the Crillon once). The WiFi was strong and and appreciated. We had been booked at the Paris Marriott Rive Gauche for the second leg of our trip but I canceled it and stayed at the Gramont. Sandra and the rest of the staff were unfailingly cheerful and respectful. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is such a great place and a wonderful value for a person who is picky but on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: jtorvi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April and looooooved it. This place was impeccably clean and cozy. I stayed in a double room for a few days with my boyfriend and then moved to a single room for the remainder of my stay, which totaled 2.5 weeks. Both rooms were great, but I loved the value of my tiny little single room. It was very small, but perfect for me. The bed was very comfortable and offers the white duvet cover that is washed in between each aptron, which is a feature I always seek out. The bathroom was modern and spotless. The staff was very competent and caring. Aurelie was great, and Sandra was phenomenal, really (truly) going out of her way to help make my Paris visit special. I will return to this new "home away from home" any time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Opera district”
Reviews.Author: axiomatic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located, close to Metro stops and many restaurants, in a quiet street so no problems with noise. The rooms are beautifully appointed but small as usual in Paris. Service from the manager Sandra is outstanding, although some of the restaurant recommendations and advice from other staff were not so great. The breakfast is not good value for the money, we found an excellent place (Exki) 5 minutes walk away. just turn right out of the hotel, turn right again on Boulevard des Italiens, it is a block up. A huge range of fresh bakery items, fruit etc, great coffee and cheaper than the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok....”
Reviews.Author: Rolleri
Reviews.Content: Perfect situation, good access to all sightseeings. Very nice staff with no "parisian" attitude. Rooms clean but small, thou it did not matter, we only slept in the hotel. Value for money? You find similar hotels in the same street some cheaper. But a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara1426
Reviews.Content: We found the Hotel Gramont Opera on Tripadvisor. I liked the location but was most impressed by the reviews of the hotel. I was not disappointed. Sandra and all the staff were so friendly and helpful, and they helped make our stay so pleasant. The hotel was small and very comfortable. Coming back to this lovely place and delightful people was a welcome respite at the end of every long day of touring. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay with Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: hodderspring
Reviews.Content: This hotel is VERY well suited for location - close to all metro stations, resturants and only a short trip to main sight seeing attractions. The staff are Amazing and go out of there way to make sure your stay is unforgetable. They happily book resturants, advise on directions and even fix minor computor problems- Thankyou Sandra. We could not recommend this hotel any higher. The size of the rooms are not hugh but this is typical of european hotels - but our room was still very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_G1
Reviews.Content: The warm welcome by the multi-lingual staff was just the beginning. Located in a great location in Paris, and only a one minute walk to the Metro station, this hotel was brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Hotel Gramont”
Reviews.Author: roamer044
Reviews.Content: I had searched for hours and looked at countless hotels for our weekend away in Paris. It needed to be just right since it would be a bit of a romantic getaway without the kids. We were extremely happy with our choice of Hotel Gramont. It is located in the Opera district and is within walking distance to all the major sights. Also easily accessible to about 3 metro stations. We had a double room which was tastefully decorated. It wasn't huge but was certainly large enough for the two of us on a weekend stay. The bathroom was also not huge, but it was well set up. Spotlessly clean, great water pressure and shower cubicle big enough for my very tall husband. Nothing to fault. The service was excellent and one of the staff there, Sandra, always greeted us with a friendly smile, a chat, and was ready to help with anything during our stay. We would recommend this hotel very highly and we'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great service & location”
Reviews.Author: bronniemac
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay due mainly to location and helpfulness of front desk staff. Very friendly and could not do enough for us. Rooms a little small making it difficult with luggage but comfortable and all amenities at hand. Some sewerage smell in air con which we did not notice after a while. We were on 6th floor (top) so lift to Level 5 then narrow steps making it difficult with large suitcases. However staff on front desk and location made up for any shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice--Pleasant and Pleasing”
Reviews.Author: dlyerly
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending a wonderful four days in Paris at the Gramont Opera Hotel. We thought the location was excellent and hotel in every aspect was just what we needed. [Located it on Trip Advisor.] Chamber maids were efficient and upon our return always found the room to be tidy and neat. The staff downstairs at the desk was just superb. Both Aurelie and Sandra were always courteous and able to answer questions re Paris and tourist sights. Their information and recommendations were "spot on" for cafes, bistros, shopping, transportation, etc. They never seemed impatient or tired of serving their custormers. We had a wonderful stay because the location allowed us to walk all over and take in "out of the way" side streets and shops. This is a return "must"!

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Minnie17
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid I was rather disappointed by this hotel. To be fair, the staff were certainly nice and the basic quality of everything from the rooms to communal areas are all generally good. The location is also decent, within easy reach of the Louvre and Metro stations. And most importantly, I felt the hotel was very clean. But I am a bit perplexed by the number of 5 star review this hotel attracts. The breakfast I felt was very bad value - we might have gone on a off-day, but the coffee was bad and there was hardly any choice of food, just stale scraps really. In addition our room was very small, especially considering the price we paid (a "special" internet rate of 225 euros a night well out of season for a double superior room - not so special in my opinion). Our bathroom was tiny. As our room was not reached by the lift, we had to drag up our heavy bags a couple of flights of stairs, with no warning or offer of help. We were also directed by staff to 2 separate restaurants, one of which was closed permanently and the other closed temporarily. That kind of reflects out whole experience at Gramont - good enough, but not great. The Gramont is a basically a good hotel, but nothing more than that. In my opinion it is significantly overpriced. I would stay there again but only if better choices were unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: barcelona_garlem
Reviews.Content: Good hotel that gives all opportunities to see the city, central location and helpful staff make it so much easier. If only the rates had been a little less... I´d stay jhere every time when in Paris. Terrific breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller2000
Reviews.Content: We found the Gramont Opera on Tripadvisor. From the moment we were greeted on the street to our departure six days later the service was impeccable. As first time visitors to France, Sandra and Aurelie made us feel at home and attended to our every need. In particular, we required some assistance with our onward journey to Venice, and they were able to organise our booking arrangements for us. The room was clean, stylish and as shown on their website. We required a quadruple room and the beds were comfortable - not always the case when there are four of you. There are several excellent street cafes within 2-3 minutes walk and these provide alternatives to the breakfast offered by the hotel, which is an add-on. Attractions such as the Louvre are within easy walking distance, we even went on to Notre Dame before catching the Metro back to the hotel. Rue da Gramont is relatively quiet, running between the busier Boulevard Haussmann and Rue du 4 Septembre. Above all, I think the very high number of good reviews comes down to the personal service provided by the staff. We had high expectations after staying here, but few of the hotels we stayed in came close with regard to attention and professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Made Perfect”
Reviews.Author: japierpont
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel because we like smaller places and Gramont Opera gets great reviews here. We were so pleased with the hotel. We needed a place to sleep and bath and the rooms were pleasantly decorated and bathrooms clean and well supplied. I want to talk about the staff... Maxime and Arthur and Aureila (Sp?) were the absolute best! They were responsive, helpful, and professional. They made reservations, they poured coffee, they arranged for cakes and on and on. I can only say that we were sad to leave these good people behind.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Parisian hotel with an incredibly kind, helpful, and fun staff!”
Reviews.Author: BOC17
Reviews.Content: We spent April vacation in Paris and had a wonderful experience at Hotel Gramont. The staff made all the difference! Sandra and Aurelie were so warm and welcoming, and helpful beyond belief! We had many, many questions about restaurants, transportation, money exchange, directions, etc. They always answered informatively and with great humor! We really connected with them, so it was nice to return to the hotel after a day of sightseeing and see our new friends! In addition, the hotel is extremely clean; the rooms are very comfortable, and the breakfast every morning had just what we needed to start our day off on the right foot. We loved Paris, thanks in great part to the warm hospitality we received from the entire staff at Hotel Gramont.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel & Staff That Does Not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: The3Amigos123
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked-in to the hotel we felt as though we were special guests. Sandra and Aurelie were delightful. They assisted us with everything from restauants to river-cruise tickets. We reserved 3 rooms; a quad and two doubles (for eight total guests). The rooms were immaculate. Some of our group even witnessed the housekeeping staff down on their hands and knees scrubbing the floors and wiping down the baseboards. The breakfast was very conveinient and met our needs as well as our teenagers. Not only did they provide the European-style breakfast items, but also offered cooked-to-order eggs. The hotel itself is located between two Metro lines, literally just a two minute walk from the hotel entrance. If ever we return to Paris, I have no doubts that this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: bethkass
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on a business trip. The hotel is conveniently located near the Opera Garnier, in a great area. There are 3 metro stops within a 5-minute walk, and lots of restaurants are nearby. The CDG-Roissy bus that runs directly from the airport leaves from the Opera Garnier, which is very convenient. It is nice that the hotel is on a side street, though, because it is close to everything while still being quiet. The staff here was really the bright spot of this trip – they went out of their way to help us. For example, they made restaurant reservations for us before we arrived and then confirmed them the day of. The woman at the desk when I checked in helped me take our bags up to our room. Two guests checking out had one day left on their museum pass, and the woman at the front desk offered them to us. It saved us at least $40 on sight-seeing! Finally, I was pick-pocketed one morning on the metro platform. Thankfully, all that was taken was my hotel room key. I went back to the hotel to alert the staff, and they were so kind. They were very understanding about the key and showed more concern for me and my safety. We had a room on the top floor, which had a nice balcony. In warmer weather, it would have been great to sit out there and relax. The room itself was normal-sized for a Paris hotel room, but the décor was wonderful. Everything was clean and very nice. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the bathroom was quite roomy for a European bathroom. We have already recommended this hotel to coworkers and would highly recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service from a 3 Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DBGreaterManchester
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Paris for our honeymoon and decided to choose Hotel Gramont on the basis of the very positive reviews it had received on Trip Advisor. I must say that we were extremely pleased with our choice and had a truly memorable stay. For us there are three key reasons why this is great hotel: 1) Very central location – Not just for Paris’ many cultural attractions but also for a wide variety of restaurants which are within a short walk. 2) Beautiful accommodation – Fantastic job of refurbishing the 19th Century building, décor and finish of our room was outstanding, cleaned daily. 3) Excellent service from staff – Special thanks to the reception staff (particularly Sanda and Aurélie) who really went out of their way to make this a special holiday for us, even arranging free champagne to toast our marriage! Very generous. Overall, we would thoroughly recommend Hotel Gramont and will certainly be returning again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely run, but ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: Witshub
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to understand this hotel's high ranking in Tripadvisor. The charming staff are first class, but all their charm and helpfulness can not compensate for the tiny rooms and the fact that they all front on to a noisy street. A hotel is mainly for sleeping in but when you have to shut the windows to reduce the traffic noise, it soon becomes too stuffy and you have to open them again. The rooms are simply furnished and decorated, but very clean. The bathroom is small, but everything works. Free wi-fi is a strong and steady signal. Breakfast, in the windowless, whitewashed celler is OK, with a never-changing cold buffet and an egg boiler. There are good restaurants within easy walking distance and the printed list of recommendations is useful and led to no disappointments. You can walk from the hotel to many of the leading destinations. The Roissy Bus to/from CDG airport has its terminus at the back of Opera Garnier, five minutes walk. There's nothing much the staff could do to make their hotel any better,, but this is simply not a top choice hotel, particularly in its price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: TKW123
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights in Hotel Gramont (6th, 7th Apr) and was truly impressed with Sandra, Maxime and this other gentleman whom I'm sorry I did not get his name. Truly sincere and helpful and ever patient with our enquiries for directions, recommendations (food), bookings (moulin rouge, restaurants). Location of hotel was great too, I did not find it far to walk to Lafayette, Lourve, Seine River (about 10 - 15 mins on average) etc. I will definitely stay at Gramont again if I am back in paris for leisure =) well done to the Gramont team! PS: I got the double room on the 4th floor so while there was no view, the room was clean (& shower works) and sleep quality was good.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Hotel in 50 years of traveling”
Reviews.Author: Mara9999
Reviews.Content: We knew this was special hotel when we received a warm and gracious welcome from the hotel manager Sandra. As usual, after transatlantic flight we were exhausted. Sandra offered chocolate croissants that were restorative! Later in our stay we met Sandra''s assistant Aurelie who was similarly gracious and helpful. Their suggestions as to neighborhood restaurants were perfect. The Gramont's shuttle service made the trip to and from Charles de Gaulle airport easy. The Gramont is a small low key hotel. The hotel has recently been renovated. Room and bathroom were comfortable and spotlessly clean. The bed was so comfortable we missed a planned trip to Versailles because we couldn't get up on time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLatini
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gramont has a number of characteristics I am starting to recognize in tripadvisor favorites: it is really clean, has excellent service, and offers good value for your money. Location isn't necessarily all that important in Paris given the quality of public transport, but Hotel Gramont is in a very good location. It is on a quiet street but lots of shopping & cafes are five minutes' walk north and the Louvre/Tuileries are ten minutes south. I stayed in the "Duplex" room, which has lots of light and a roof deck with a table and chairs. Big, comfortable bed. Neat room. Slept very well. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel offers free Wi-fi, which I LOVE to see in a European hotel. Thanks! I got the room at a discount but feel that even at full price it is good value for Paris. I would definitely stay at Hotel Gramont Opera again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robert19_12
Reviews.Content: I have never completed a review on a hotel before and I felt that this hotel was 5 stars all the way. Hotel Gramont is a superb hotel that is really well placed for the Opera, the Louvre (10 mins walk) and nearby shopping in Boulevard Haussmann. The room we had was lovely and the breakfast was great value. However what makes the difference here is the staff - they are absoloutely first class. My wife and I were made feel very welcome right from our arrival by Sandra who could not be more helpful. She and Aurelie were extremely friendly made our stay so enjoyable. Merci beaucoup! We will return to Paris and stay in this hotel.!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris, and so friendly it's refreshing...”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrishWA
Reviews.Content: The Gramont is tucked away on a quiet side street nr The Opera in Paris so next to Galleries Lafayette and just fabulous. Room was a good size by Paris standards, very clean, the staff were brilliant, so friendly, helpful, and the little extras like tea, coffee, and complimentary croissants daily a welcome treat... Location location and small boutique lovely hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the centre of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ritacampospires
Reviews.Content: It is an excelent hotel, right in the centre of Paris, near almost everything you may want to visit. I stayed in a room for 3 to 4 guests. It was a very pleasant and clean room, and had two bathrooms (which was very handy!). Also, the staff was very nice and helpfull. When I visit Paris again, this hotel will be one of my first choices.

Reviews.Title: “Not a value for the money - you can do better elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Patrick313
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for - but, sometimes you don’t. I’ve relied on Trip Advisor to find hotel values in many large cities. Every time, the reviews have been accurate and I’ve been happy with the hotel I’ve selected. This time, the Trip Advisor reviews failed me. The Hotel Gramont Opera isn’t bad, it’s just not that good - and it’s certainly not the fine “boutique hotel” that the reviews would have you believe. Instead, it’s an overpriced three star hotel that, while clean and recently remodeled, has minuscule rooms and only an average location within Paris. I wish I would have used my critical thinking skills to ask how a 25 room hotel in a city of over 2 million people could rank so high. First the good. It has been mentioned many, many times in these reviews that the staff is accommodating and friendly. This is absolutely true. I interacted with several different people and all of them went above and beyond to make sure I was happy. As for the location, it’s safe and close to the several restaurants and supermarkets as well as one of the main shopping areas in Paris. There are also several Metro stops nearby, making it convenient to any part of the city. Finally, the rooms are clean and have newer fixtures and decor. However, the beds are horrible - our “Triple” included two single beds that had been pushed together to form a double bed and a cot that had been labeled as a twin bed in the advertising. Now the bad. After staying at this hotel for several nights, I can’t understand how it has secured so many overwhelmingly positive reviews. The rooms are so small that there is only room for the beds, which essentially fill the space from one wall to the other, leaving only two feet of clear space to walk. The bathrooms are clean, with new fixtures; but they are about the size of two telephone booths set side by side, making it difficult to maneuver and very stuffy after a hot shower. The only other furniture that can fit in the room is a small writing desk shoved into the recessed corner with a hard backed, four legged chair. Thankfully, there was ample storage space in a closet to fit our luggage, as there was no space for it in the room itself. The reviews here laughingly say “it’s Paris and rooms are small.” But, for $250 to $350 per night, this hotel provides no value. Like many other places in Paris, they’re over reaching at these prices. I’d rather pay more for a nicer hotel. At least I’d feel like I got some value for my money. In addition to the tiny rooms, there is no individual climate control other than the electric heat. Paris is humid during any season, making hotel rooms stuffy and hot. And, while I think that the hotel has climate controlled ventilation, it’s controlled at the front desk and not in the rooms where the only temperature control is for heat. While I was there in March and April the cooling was turned off and it was stuffy and hot in the room. I’d hate to stay here in the summer and have not access to individual climate control. Fortunately, the windows open allowing you to vent the “fresh” Paris air into your room. Unfortunately, Rue Gramont is quite noisy for all but four hours a night. Leaving the windows open, while a very a very satisfying way to cool the room in March and April, makes sleeping in the room only a step above sleeping on the street with respect to noise. Combined with the uncomfortable beds, this makes sleeping difficult. In short, the room size, uncomfortable beds, lack of ventilation in the rooms, and noise make staying in this hotel sort of like camping in a tent - satisfying if the price is right, but not very satisfying for $300 a night. Yes, the staff is nice and speaks English. Yes, the rooms are clean. And, yes the location is a 4 out of 5. But, the Hotel Gramont Opera is only average - not horrible, but not worthy of it’s high rating on Trip Advisor. Did I hate this hotel? No. It was perfectly acceptable and I liked it more than I disliked it. Was it good enough to make me uncomfortable taking a risk on different hotel next time I’m in Paris? No. I think I’ll skip this place next time and look for something else. And, anyone who’s reading these reviews should do the same. You can do better than this hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: TNH33
Reviews.Content: Everything is satisfactory: very clean room, comfortable bed, friendly staff. Central location, but in an area mostly turned over to offices. There is nothing outstanding, however, about this 3* hotel. Due to their incredible success on tripadvisor, this place is seriously overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chocola
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gramont is located within walking distance of the opera, Louvre, the major shops, and many good restaurants. The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming. They seemed very pleased to accommodate requests. We arrived very early (hours before check-in), and they kept our luggage for us. When we returned to the hotel after walking around for a short time, our room was already prepared. Our room was clean, nice, and huge! Even though we were on the ground floor, we did not hear any noise from the outside. This is a welcoming hotel for children. We arrived one afternoon to find a chocolate bunny on my daughter's pillow. It's those little extra things that separate a good hotel from a great one. We really thought of the Hotel Gramont as our "home away from home," and we will be happy to stay there again when we are able to return to Paris. Thank you for a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lizpani
Reviews.Content: You need look no further for a terrific boutique hotel in Paris. Hotel Gramont is run by lovely people, Sandra, Aurelie and the rest of the staff are all wonderful, helpful, cute and efficient! They are kind to us Americans who speak no French. Metro entrances at either end of the block and Opera two blocks away. You can get anywhere fast! Tons of restaurants in close walking distance. A Monoprix is only a block away and you need to stop there before buying things anywhere else. It is where normal people shop; it is small department store that also has food. The hotel is on a side street, it is very quiet. Very nice. Its high rating is well deserved. One thing to pay attention to - they will arrange a shuttle from the airport if you request it - first, know that it is a shuttle that will stop other places and it may take a while to get to your hotel - it is not a taxi. The instructions that the shuttle service gives you did not work properly in the terminal where United flights come in. They give you a phone number, but it does not work properly on the three phones that I tried. HOWEVER, the driver found me wandering around anyway after I called the hotel and they contacted the shuttle service! My son tells me that taking public transportation is very easy. It might be worth it. Taxis will cost you around 80usd.

Reviews.Title: “A conveniently located hotel with friendly staff and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Lee923
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a week by myself. The hotel, though small, is conveniently located and cozy and there are a number of japanese restaurants along the streets at reasonable prices. The room is clean and it has a soft and comfortable bed. It is about 10 min walk to The Louve and 8 min to Galeries Lafayette. There are 3 metro stations near the hotel. The staff are very friendly and provide advice readily on the tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff - would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: delvo
Reviews.Content: Sandra and her staff couldn't have been more helpful - they booked restaurants and tickets for us in advance, and gave us a great room at a really reasonable rate. The room was really comfortable and a good size. The hotel is located about 2 mins from the Metro - it's in the middle of the lively Opera district which is pretty buzzy in itself, but being so close to a Metro, it was close enough to everything else as well. I'd definitely recommend a stay here if you're looking for a hotel in Paris, fits the bill if you want a comfortable room in a good location, with fantastic staff who can't do enough for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot to have most for the money”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Denise
