Reviews.Content: We were on a short 3-Day trip to Paris. The staff in this Hotel was always there with a helping hand to help us make the most out of our trip. Sandra at the reception gave her best to explaine us what to visit and how to get there. Location is great, just 10 min to reach the Louvre. I would recommend this hotel to every person I know. It is probably one of the best hotels in paris to get the most for your money in a great area in paris. Sincerely, Kevin

Reviews.Title: “superb place”
Reviews.Author: christiedigital
Reviews.Content: we were delighted with this little hotel. we stayed in the quadruple room which was spacious and perfect. the rooms were impeccably clean. Very flexible at the front desk. Both Sandra and Aurelie were beyond helpful, very dedicated to our needs and provided wonderful advice. I commend their service as exemplary. Would go back. Ideally situated on a side street (qauiet) and near the Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay here but wish I did”
Reviews.Author: lisette36
Reviews.Content: I can't say how wonderful Hotel Gramont Opera Paris is because I didn't stay here. Only one of the rooms ( a triple)had a bathtub which I require for my sore feet but I had to write to tell everyone what wonderful people are taking care of you here. I got quick replies and caring advice from Maxime and Sandra the manager who even invited me to come in and say hello whatever hotel I stayed in. I feel this hotel cares for its guests and if I ever have three people I will stay in their hotel. Also they are honest and told me that the triple room might not be the quietest in the hotel. I envy all who try this hotel and one day wills stay here

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect”
Reviews.Author: beccabas
Reviews.Content: Sublime service and spotless rooms. Americans unused to European hotels will find the rooms small, but standard double room is probably about average, and importantly they are spotless and the beds are very comfortable. The staff is really the best I've encountered in the US and Western Europe. While the breakfast is not included, it's a good value for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Beats the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Dragonlady15
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in two different rooms. Both rooms were good- the second was more spacious and the bed was heavenly. The location was unbeatable- you can walk to the louvre, and all the major shopping area in 10 minutes. But perhaps most importantly- the service was unbelievable. I mainly dealt with one hotel staff member, and it almost felt like she was family. I think she was the nicest hotel staff member I have ever encountered, and anything you could ever need, she would anticipate and take care of before you could even ask. There is no swimming pool/restaurant, etc. This is why it is listed at 3 stars. But don't let that phase you. There are a million places to eat nearby, and you shouldn't be swimming while visiting Paris- you should be out experiencing Paris! The decor is charming, and the facilities are clean and pleasant. I wish I could stay at this hotel all over the world when I travel- but alas, this is the only one. Save your wallet and choose this hotel over the first several trip advisor choices, all of which cost a minor fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay ANYWHERE else but here!!”
Reviews.Author: cgemme
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on TripAdvisor and I immediately started asking Sandy a million questions, which she was extremely helpful and so nice to talk to that when my son and I met her, it was like we were old friends. Sandy and staff have to be the nicest, most courteous, helpful and funny people we have ever met. The hotel is charming. Our room had 2 twin beds and an extra bed and a balcony and a nice bathroom with a shower. It is very, very clean and really nice. You walk out the door (after having a croissant!) and you are right around the corner from the Opera! The staff suggested great restaurants and they held up to their suggestions! It was safe to walk around at night as there were plenty of people walking the city. There are so many great restaurants near this hotel. And the prices? This hotel, for what it looks like, the great staff and where it is located is a steal at the price it is. We had breakfast here a few mornings - plenty of croissants! Honestly, if my son could have stayed and worked for Sandy, he would have. It just made our stay in Paris so, so much nicer staying here. Miss you, Sandy! Chris & Rick Gemme

Reviews.Title: “We've already recommended Hotel Gramont to friends.”
Reviews.Author: TyTex
Reviews.Content: Relying on Trip Advisor reviews, we booked five nights at Hotel Gramont and could not have been more pleased with our stay. The staff was fantastic! Every request we made was met immediately and with a smile. Our room was very comfortable, updated, and spotless. Yes, the room was on the small side, but this is Paris after all. You can probably find larger rooms at 3X-4X what we paid for our room, but I thought what we had was a terrific value. The location was everything we had hoped for. We walked most places we went, and when we needed the Metro, the Opera Metro nexus was close by. We would not hesitate to stay here again and have already recommended the hotel to friends planning a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RINUM
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on review on Trip Advisor. I had communicated with Sandra- the receptionist few times before we arrived there. She was very very pleasant and helpful. Room was of good size, bathroom and shower were clean. I think for the price of the room ( 225 Euros per night), the breakfast should have been included. Also, for what was included in the breakfast, 15 Euros per person was little too expensive. Overall, we enjoyed our stay because of friendly and always ready to help staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: grthompson81
Reviews.Content: Great rooms (free upgrade to room with a balcony was a bonus!), good location and really friendly and helpful staff. Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly, lovely, clean, quiet, central. Perfect little hotel. A must!”
Reviews.Author: JeremyL10036
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is magnificent - the incredible staff, the location, the decor, the cleanliness - makes this one of the most pleasant experiences one can have. Sandra and her staff are so helpful, friendly and courteous and will do anything to make your stay a pleasant one. If Paris is the city of lights (and oh, it is!) then this is one of its most brightest lights. Merci for such a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Harvey10Uk
Reviews.Content: This is one very well run hotel. Very conveniently located close to the Opera Garnier. We stayed for 3 days and found the staff so warm and helpful- particularly Aurelie- who was a real star. The room was small - I would guess that most of them are- but they were very clean- and beautifully decorated. The street is also quiet which is important if you want to sleep well- It is also close to alot of great restaurants- and some nice cafes. If you want to combine great shopping with sight seeing - I think this location is perfect. We walked and walked ( occasionally using the metro) and most of the central attractions are relatively close by. Breakfast( which is not included in our price) was good but the ambiance of the room is not so good- so we went out to local cafes and ate there. We were that impressed that we plan to come back next time with our son and will not look anywhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYSinger1
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed in the duplex room, with balcony on the top floor of the hotel. For Paris standards, this room was huge. Having the lower floor to spread out on, was a huge bonus. Even though the weather wasn't perfect, we still found time to sit on the balcony, and enjoy the Parisian atmosphere. I can only imagine what a value the balcony is in the spring and summer. Great hotel if you are going to Paris...alone, with friends, with a partner, with a family. What made the hotel so amazing was the staff. The staff at the hotel were the most knowledgeable, accommodating, and competent crew I have seen in a hotel in a very long time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location,perfect service.”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc40
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gramont is perfect for a short trip to Paris.We travelled as a family and stayed in a quad room for five nights,bed and breakfast.The room was comfortable and clean.Though it sleeps four, it would probably feel cramped if you had suitcases as part of a longer trip.We were three, and travelled with hand luggage,and the room felt about right.I understand that rooms in Paris tend to be on the small side anyway,so this did not affect the enjoyment of our stay.The staff had arranged a birthday cake for my daughter's birthday during our stay,and it was perfect! Breakfast is a buffet affair-mainly pastries,cereals and fruit,aswell as tea,coffee and fruit juices.The hot section was disappointing,with a few sausages and synthetic scrambled eggs but the pastries were delicious! I think that an improvement would be to offer guests a choice of boiled and poached eggs aswell-not too difficult to do.None the less,breakfast was more than adequate and good value at 13 euros p/person.A safe in the room allows you to secure your passports and money for the duration of your stay,and the maid service was exemplary.The hotel recommends various local restaurants,and we tried three.The Vaudeville,a short distance from the hotel on foot is to be recommended,as is Le Grand Cafe Capucines in the opposite direction but only 2-3 minutes away.Don't expect though to have much change out of 140 Euros for a meal for 3 including wine and a tip-yes,Paris is expensive! We were less happy with the Italian restaurant directly next door to the hotel-the Cafe Concerto,which we visited on our last night.lacking in atmosphere and with a rather surly owner-come-maitre-d,we had a disappointing meal there and would not recommend it to visitors,even though it is 3 steps from the hotel and so extreemly convenient! One must-do is the restaurant known as Les Deux Magots(no need to give you directions,as everyone in Paris knows of it!).Once a haunt of Jean-paul Sartre,the food was superb,not over-priced,and the atmosphere was very welcoming.The Hotel Gramont Opera is to be recommended,-the staff,including Sandra(the manager) who is Swiss,and Aurelie who was extreemly helpful during our stay,aswell as the two young men who were on nights during our stay but whose names unfortunately we did not write down,could not have been more courteous or helpful,and made our stay there all the more enjoyable.Free use of the laptop in the foyer to check in on line made for a seamless departure(the hotel also organised our shuttle to and from the airport).The hotel is a perfect base for a short trip to Paris,very central to many must-sees,but down a quiet street for a peaceful night's sleep.It is expensive ,but then quality has it's price!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Boutique Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: VicHongKong
Reviews.Content: We took the bus directly from CDG and got off at Opera Station. It took us about 15 mins to find the direction towards Gramont St. We had the Double Bed room up in level 5 which is not bad at all. Although the room was a bit smaller than I expected but it was clean and well maintained. Sandra the manager, gave us tips around Paris which made it much easier for us to get around and find want we needed. It was overall a very relax 4 days stay for my wife & I. I would definitely stay again in Hotel Gramont for future visits. Keep up the good work Hotel Gramont!!!! Sincerely Victor

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Geraldinefeb2011
Reviews.Content: We are just home from a weekend in the beautiful Paris. The hotel is in an ideal location. Central to great restaurants, bistros and the sites. Metro is around the corner. The staff in the hotel couldn't have been nicer. So friendly and had great advice on restaurants and the metro. I have to say Aurelie was fantastic. She was always warm and friendly and nothing we asked of her was too much. She even organized for chocolates and flowers in our room on arrival. It was my cousins birthday. The room was lovely , clean and comfortable.We ate breakfast in the hotel each morning. The scrambled eggs are yummy. Our stay in The Gramont Opera was the icing on the cake. I would highly recommend this hotel. We look forward to our next visit. Geraldine , Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Emanuel_S_NYC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from a one-week stay at the Gramont Opera. The hotel has a wonderful, central location, within walking distance of many sights and restaurants, and only a couple of minutes away from two Metro line stations. Our room was small (although not so by European standards), but comfortable and very nicely appointed. The bathroom was rather tiny, but modern and absolutely sparkling. The entire hotel is immaculate and "classy," from top to bottom. But what sets this hotel apart--as has been reported by countless others in these reviews--is the incredible service. The entire hotel staff was unfailingly warm, gracious and helpful in every instance and in every possible way. They made our stay really special. We would happily choose the Gramont Opera again (and would equally happily return to Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great location and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: bcmitaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at a single room which was a bit small but very comfortable bed with modern decoration and updated bathroom. My room was on the first floor with a bit of traffic noise but mostly during the day as it is small street. Breakfast was not cheap but there was a lot of food in a buffet style. Cereals, breads, eggs, juices, jam, cheese and ham at your choice. The front desk was extremely helpful at all times. They even gave me a metro ticket for free because the station close tot eh hotel has no vending machines. Louvre is 15 min walk or 2-3 stops by metro. 5 min walk to the Opera.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: MB1313
Reviews.Content: A really perfect hotel, not only for business (the trip was extended over the week-end as short vacation). Great location, very nice rooms and extremely lovely staff (always nice to chat at the reception). Really my first choice for Paris in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Had a small misunderstanding - Go out of their way to help and solve the problem”
Reviews.Author: CloudShanghai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my parents during a 2 weeks trip to Europe. Started off at a Starwood hotel using my frequent traveller points, but decided to try out this hotel based on the review from Tripadvisor. The room was really nicely decorated but slightly small for 3 people (w/ extra bed), however, the best of the hotel is the service. I left my eye-glasses in the room and email the hotel after I left for another nearby european country. Although there were some misunderstanding on the postal cost, it works out at the end and I have received my eye-glasses before heading back home. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone! What's more? Great location near all the big department stores (Lafeye) and Opera in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly helpful staff and very clean, tidy and comfy room”
Reviews.Author: bodely
Reviews.Content: Came for my Partners birthday and Sandra from Reception helped to organise a birthday surprise at a local restaurant which I was very grateful for. Also returned from our fist foray into Paris to find a Happy Birthday note and a box of chocolates on the bed - Nice touch! The room itself was fairly compact but very tidy, modern and comfortable. The location is great, easy walking distance to the Louvre and metro links to everywhere in the city very close by. The walk to the Sacre Coeur is a recommendation from the Hotel as the surrounding area and the view is amazing. Also the restaurant just around the corner offering Raclette's and Fondues was amazing..

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: pozio
Reviews.Content: It was excellent for us, very clean, comfortable, cozy, good location and the staff was great. Also great the "free" croissants in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here - it is everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: marshmallow44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two children, aged 8 and 14 and couldn't have been made to feel more welcome. We had a double room with a single bed for my youngest and the room was large with a large bathroom - all very clean and really nicely furnished. The facilities are excellent and I can't recommend this highly enough. Being a traveller on my own with two children I felt very safe (both in the area and hotel) and the staff were always on hand for assistance. The location is perfect - one end of the road is the busy, thriving opera district near to the Opera Garnier which is also very near the gorgeous Gallerie Lafayette and the other a short walk to the Louvre. Check out the nearby pedestrianised Rue Montorgueil for a bustling market street with chocolate shops and patisseries. We even walked to the Eiffel Tower from here - a really pleasant walk through the Place Vendome and Jardin des Tuilleries. The hotel is in a quiet side street and I would recommend this to anyone staying in Paris. If you want a well-priced, value for money hotel in a great location in Paris - stay here! Thank you to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt the most friendly and nicest hotel in Paris....”
Reviews.Author: MorganAsia
Reviews.Content: The hotel is without doubt the most friendliest cleanest service orientated I ever have experienced in Paris... am I in Paris I thought.... every guest was welcomed with real warmth and genuine interest to their needs. My room was perfect, so clean and had such charm. Anything I needed was promptly dealt with. Recommendations for restaurants were perfectly described and totally accurate. I am in the media business so trust me this is one great find in Paris.... Congratulations to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Grogmon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently, great location with very nice comfy rooms - most importantly staff very helpful and went out of there way to help us with any request. Well deserving rating on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further; this is the place to stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: CCaps67
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely ten days in Paris, which were made even lovelier by the staff of the Gramont Opéra, who were, quite simply, spectacular. They were always helpful, never bothered, and always up for a chat, especially Sandra :-) The location is unbeatable -- the Louvre and the Comédie Française are all of 15 minutes away on foot, the Roissybus (that goes straight to CDG) and the Opéra subway station are even closer, and there are restaurants aplenty on the nearby Boulevard des Italiens. The room itself was just right, and came complete with its own small but functional bathroom, a definite luxury at that price. Also useful was free access to the Internet, for everything from checking the weather to printing maps to making restaurant reservations. And the breakfast buffet was fabulous: I was able to get a great meal to start the day and be on my way that much quicker to explore this wonderful city. So, like I said, look no further; you'll be sorry if you do. Chantal C. Ottawa

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for Paris city centre”
Reviews.Author: pamife
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation for two nights (and paid for it) on another hotel. I chose the other hotel simply because it was closer to exhibition venue I was visiting. But after a terrible/horrible/ dreadful/frightful/ghastly/hideous/atrocious/gruesome/awful... night I decided I had to find another hotel. ...and so it was that, after a brief search in Tripadvisor, I've found this eden in the centre of Paris. Really incredible staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, excellent service, spotlessly clean!”
Reviews.Author: ninasch1976
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our three days Paris stay to the max. The advantage of this hotel is its"software, meaning Sandra, the receptionist giving you the tips you need concerning restaurants, shopping etc.Those places you would never know if you hadnt heard it from locals. And for all those talking about he room sizes: The duplex room is a tad more expensive but you have more space, plus a small roof top terasse which would be very nice in spring/summer. We had a great time in that hotel and i would go back any minute. The reviews are true! And i should not forget to mention the croissants/pain de chocolat that the hotel puts into the lobby for free for their guests: Delicios and a nice gesture i think! Thanks Sandra and your team! ps. one more thing wireless internet is working great an wihtout any costs, which you can rarely find in other hotels. Many of them rip you off!

Reviews.Title: “A rare find in a big city”
Reviews.Author: Ttirrem
Reviews.Content: Hotel Gramont was a good experience from start to finish. Sandra and Aurelie treat you as if you are the most important guests they ever had. The Hotel is very quiet, nicely decorated,clean and in an excellent location. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: thirtysevenone
Reviews.Content: Room, closet, and bathroom size were good. Sandra, at the desk, is very, very nice and helpful. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that there's no kitchen or room service. Quiet neighborhood, within walking distance of many museums, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter5478
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mother last March on our second trip to Paris. We just arrived that morning, and my mother was feeling a bit ill. I was very happy with the hotel from the moment we walked in. Seeing that my mother was not feeling well, the women at the reception were very helpful in getting us to our room (a nice, cool room on the ground floor level) and getting us settled in. Later on that evening, they graciously brought us some hot tea. In the morning, we had a delicious breakfast downstairs (a lot of variety), and the women at reception helped us get a cab to Gare du Nord. My short stay here (one night) was great. Everyone was so nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel , great spot!”
Reviews.Author: Dianne92
Reviews.Content: Was in Paris with our youngest daughter for shopping trip. Hotel is top. Great value for money and excellent spot. Walking distance of shops and nice restaurants and absolute super friendly receptionist who offers help and gives a lot of great tips. Will go back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but small room”
Reviews.Author: Travel0h0lic
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend end Nov10. The positives first: The reception staff was very helpful (when there, unfortunately, we had to wait for them to turn up on several occasions). The hotel is very well situated, close to two metro stations and the big department stores and theatre district. Lots of good restaurants closeby. The rue Gramont is a side street to the very busy Bld des Capucines but yet extremely quiet. Now for the less good things: The room was the smallest we have ever stayed in, like 4x4 meters including the bathroom. There was not enough cupboard space for 2 or even for 1 person I'd think - and we only stayed two nights with very little luggage. The safe didn't work although this was fixed pretty quickly when alerting reception. The breakfast was served in the basement and there were not enough tables (I would say about 10 seats!) for the guests who came to have breakfast. We asked for expresso or capuccino coffee and the waitress told us we could get this on the main boulevard in a coffee. The hotel only provided brewed coffee which smelt burnt and was really not nice. I decided to go for a cup of tea instead. They ran out of bread and did not refuel, same for the cheese and ham... Not impressed at all. Now the worst: Our very small room (I believe it was No 504) was close to the elevator and the maid's closet. We were promtly woken up at 7h30 on both Sat and Sun morning by the maid starting to make a terrible noise in her cupboard. We literally heard this as if she were inside our room. It was awful. The maid also had the bad habit of leaving dirty laundry and huge garbage bags in the corridor just outside our room and even in front of our door one - we actually had to move the stuff in order to get in. We travel a lot around the world and generally go by TA reviews and so far have very rarely been disappointed. However, in this case, I really fail to understand what all the positive TA are all about??? We paid 170 EUR per night. This is not cheap but standard for a decent hotel in Paris. Hotel Gramont Opera no 3 in Paris!!!! NO WAY. Despite all this we had a wonderful weekend in Paris but next time, we'll go to our usual hotel (which was full this time) more expensive but at least we know what we have.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at Hotel Gramont”
Reviews.Author: Julie029
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights at the Hotel Gramont Opera, and found the hotel to be pleasant, with friendly staff. The rooms were clean, and the triple room is actually quite a good size for a Parisian hotel. Overall, I couldn't really fault the hotel, however the facilities and decor make this an average hotel. I have stayed in other hotels in Paris in the same price range, and found them to be more chic, with better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “The Gramont is a special place; we will return”
Reviews.Author: millieme52024
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Our family stayed for over a week and booked a double room. The room was lovely, the service was great and the staff was so friendly and helpful. This was our first trip to Paris and we felt right at home here. Lots of shopping and fine restaurants nearby. Many attractions within walking distance. A metro station is right around the corner. This hotel in wonderfu.

Reviews.Title: “What a reception!”
Reviews.Author: Devonish31
Reviews.Content: We were met at the door by the receptionist and were in our room within two minutes - no paperwork, no passports, just a friendly smile and efficient service that continued throughout our stay. Restaurant recommendations and bookings were provided immediately and both receptionists put us to shame with their knowledge of our language. The room was small but clean and comfortable. In a quiet street we would not have known we were in a busy city overnight. Free internet and printing facilities were available and worked well. Three metro stations are within a short walk. If you don't need a host of facilities or staff fussing around this is an ideal hotel for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Sisyfos
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family for the weekend. The location is great, the staff is very friendly and the rooms clean. We travelled with an infant and the hotel provided us with a baby cot free of charge and gave us one of the larger rooms (some of the rooms might be a bit small but I believe it is standard for Paris); great service. All together we had a lovely stay at Hotel Gramont.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: morgan20
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth time in Paris and we have finally found the perfect place to stay. The Hotel is well located and recently refurbished. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Thanks Sandra and Aurielle (?), we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel in Paris with great service”
Reviews.Author: Essexrosabel
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with excellent service and very convenient location for sightseeing in Paris. The hotel staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. As we were travelling back to the UK during the French strikes we were worried about our train but the receptionist checked several times to ensure our train was running. The room was a little crowded as we needed an extra single bed for our teenage daughter but the bed provided was a full size proper bed (and not a fold out) and there was enough space. The bathroom was very clean and breakfast was good value. The Gramont is on a very quiet side street so although it is close to the tourist area it is very quiet at night. It was lovely to stay in such a welcoming and friendly hotel particularly in view of some of our previous experiences in Parisian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is pleasant ,comfortable and friendly. C'est bon!!!”
Reviews.Author: dohagrammie
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Paris . This hotel is ideally located for popular attractions and local eating establishments . Also for shopping . The hotel is clean, staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was a good size and comfortable for the price compared to the previous Paris hotel we stayed in. We did not eat a lot at the hotel as we chose to explore the nearby cafes and restaurants but appreciated the delicious complimentary coffee and croissants available in the hotel lobby .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: d_dub_d
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on a sunday afternoon before Christmas and were shown to a duplex room on the top floor. It was a very impressive split-level room with a balcony. Everything was clean and the bed was very comfortable. We decided not to take breakfast in the hotel in order to explore the cafes in the area so I can't comment on the food except to say the menu sounded tasty. Both mornings we found nice cafes nearby. The hotel is a perfect base to get around all the usual sites in Paris and it is also great for just wandering around. There are loads of restaurants in the area in the evenings at reasonable prices if you steer clear of the immediate Opera square. The staff in Gramont were very pleasant and helpful. I would definitely recommend here to anyone wanting a base in Paris for a few days. I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to tour Paris”
Reviews.Author: 3hands
Reviews.Content: Family of 3 that stayed in a quad room. The bonus was that the quad was actually two smaller rooms turned into one but it kept the two bathrooms. This was a handy feature for us and our teenage daughter. The room was comfortable and on a quiet street. The staff were very helpful and all spoke impeccable english as our french was rough at best. The hotel is nicely located to allow easy walks south to the Louvre and Notre Dame or north to Sacre Coeur. Many good restaurants nearby, just avoid the ones on Boulevard des Italians (junky chain type). Would recommend this hotel for first time visitors and those that frequent the city.

Reviews.Title: “an absolute gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Pennie H
Reviews.Content: Just about everything about this hotel is charming, and that includes the incredibly warm and helpful staff. We stayed in a beautiful duplex room with our 5 -year-old granddaughter, and it was a delight. The location is very central and convenient, the decor and cleanliness were excellent. As other reviewers have noted, the personal service is a stand-out, from the well considered restaurant recommendations, to directions to places of interest and advice on shopping requirements. We were able to buy museum passes at the hotel, which saved us heaps of time. In fact, only one thing marred our stay, which was when what appeared to be a fire alarm went off while we were in the breakfast room. We weren't sure what was happening, and expected the staff member on duty there to advise us, but she ignored it . Along with the other patrons we were confused about what was happening and decided to leave, although the staff member continued to clear tables. It was indeed a fire alarm (caused by a guest smoking in their room). I believe all staff have a duty to act in the guests' best interests by informing them, and ushering them off the premises in such a situation - in this one respect, Hotel Gramont Opera needs to improve its performance. That aside, the place is wonderful and we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff I've Ever Encountered in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: dalkey22
Reviews.Content: This was my fifith trip to Paris, but first stay at the Hotel Gramont. I came across the hotel on this site, and read all the positive reviews, and I have to say, I agree 100%! The staff was amazing, and made our trip that much nicer! From a welcome fruit plate to assistance on restaurants and boulangeries. The room was a little tight for 3 people, but we made it work, and had a blast! It is in a great neighborhood....close to everything yet a quiet side street. Slept very well the entire trip. I have found my hotel for all of my future stays in Paris, and I have already begun spreading the word. This is such a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ilove2travel805
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Hotel Gramont for 7 days during the winter holiday time and we had a fantastic time. We stayed in one double and one triple. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The hotel is intimate without feeling too small and the front desk is extremely helpful. They helped arrange dining reservations, car rentals, directions, luggage holds and airport shuttles with a smile and the free computer and printer in the lobby was great. My only small suggestion would be to have fresh fruit and some type of egg for the breakfast but there were many options for breakfasts in the area. We would definitely return and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: marumaruni
Reviews.Content: This hotel gave good impression even before I arrived. To book their room Aurélie helped me find an available room for a couple of weeks. I was unfortunate that I didn't get to meet her as she left for an vacation the day I arrieved. Instead Sandra, a very friendly, thoughtful hardworking manager gave me a wark and kind accmodation. The deluxe room I stayed was very clean and nice and quiet too. The breakfast buffet is also good. I have no complaints what so ever. It's just not me, all the guests were saying to Sandra that they will come back for another stay. I am reccominding this place to all of my friends and I hope that they also have a wonderful stay like I did. Sandra and Aurélie, thank you for your service!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff & Hotel!! (review from an ex-Parisian)”
Reviews.Author: Lexicon127
Reviews.Content: I just have to say that the staff at the hotel were the most incredible & wonderful... I happened to have booked a night stay during the week that Europe, especially London & Paris, were shut down due to extreme weather. I was unable to get to Paris (from London) and had to reschedule etc. The staff was amazing and helpful and kind during the entire nightmare I went through trying to get to Paris (and consequently back out to my final destination). I also became ill, and the front desk was wonderful in helping me organise a physician appointment etc during the one day I had in Paris. I could not have had a better experience. The hotel was impeccable, beautiful, and had an excellent breakfast. The location was fantastic as well. The inclusion of wifi also was invaluable to me during my travels. I will always stay at this hotel when I come through Paris. Thank you all! I have already recommended this hotel to other travellers along the way, handing out the hotel cards! Thank you, and the woman at the front desk should get a raise for her incredible attitude and kindness to all her hotel guests. Fantastique, vraiment!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, felt like home!”
Reviews.Author: FefaDrescher
Reviews.Content: The staff is just great. Besides being very efficient, they are very, very nice people. We feel like home at the Gramont. I've travelled with my Mon and Aunt, this was their first time in Europe, as they were just enchanted with the treatment they received. The single rooms are a great idea!! Breakfast is delicious and to have it available until 11 / 11:30am is perfect. There is no doubt that Gramont will be always my choice in Paris from now on!!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Alors
Reviews.Content: Let me start by explaining that I travel a lot. Each year, I typically spend 3 - 4 months in hotels (mainly business). I've been to Paris, and other parts of France, many times. This trip was strictly business and began with 3 nights in Paris at Hotel Gramont Opera Paris. My room was a very basic European hotel room, slightly larger than average. Wi-Fi speed was excellent. There were a few English-language TV channels available. What really sets this hotel apart and makes it special is the front desk staff. They are outstanding! (And their English is excellent.) Because the hotel is so small, you are able to interact with individuals personally. My sense was that they really care about their guests. They went out of their way to be accommodating. For example, when asked for restaurant recommendations, we weren't just hand a list and wish "Bon chance". Instead a specific restaurant was chosen to meet our requirements. Twice we asked for guidance and twice we were directed to excellent restaurants. I don’t tend to be excessively generous in my reviews, but the staff at this hotel make it truly exceptional. I plan to stay there on my next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KarlMorris
Reviews.Content: Didn't want to pay top dollar nor did we want cheap accommodation. This is the place to stay in the middle price range. Sandra on reception was exceptional and genuinely contributed to our holiday and she could never do enough to assist with our tourist needs. Can not reccomend this place enough. Great location, great value. Will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Best I stayed at in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shawnrog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 5 or 6 different locations in Paris over the years and Hotel Gramont outshines them all. Its small and quiet, near the Opera Area, a short walk to the Metro Station, has a nice breakfast option. The rooms are cozy I stayed in 104 it has queen bed, nice desk work area and a small bathroom with a shower stall instead of batch tub. They provide FREE internet access so factor that in when comparing other locations. The neighborhood is full of excellent restaurants all a close walk away. My favorite part is the young lady who works the front desk, she is happy to speak English, provide directions and has a very pleasant personality.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and comfortable - excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Garfbambvan
Reviews.Content: We got the special needs room on the ground floor, at the back of the reception without having asked for it. Due to the special nature of the room, it was oviously quite large as weel as the bathroom. I would say that it was 30-40% bigger than the other room on the 2nd floor booked by our friends and which was for sure more representative of the general size of the rooms (quite small!). The rooms are impeccably clean and nicely decorated. The bed is comfortable. The rooms located on the street side are indeed a bit noisy, even if the Rue de Gramont is definitely not one of the busiest streets in Paris. I cannot comment on the breakfast since we didn't take any. At the time (january 2010) we had a good rate, about 160-170 Euros per night but upon checking the website of the hotel now this rate seems to have gone up quite a bit so I guess that the hotel is maybe a little bit expensive now. I would nevertheless recommend it to anyone staying in Paris, be it for leisure or business.

Reviews.Title: “I would love to come back soon!”
Reviews.Author: Eric8989
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Gramont for several days this spring during the volcano "ash" event. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Sandra helped with everything from finding a wine tasting event to checking train and flight reservations. The hotel itself was very nice, fairly large and comfortable rooms with large windows. The location is also good. You can walk to the Louvre in 10 minutes and you can see Sacre Cour from a few blocks away. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Leslied2
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights at this hotel over Thanksgiving of this year. It’s very elegant for a three-star hotel, which plush beds, spotless rooms, and tasteful furnishings. Also, the service is truly out of this world. I’ve seen Sandra run up and down stairs to accommodate all of her guests’ wishes. The free croissants in the lobby are a welcome snack when you return from a day of walking throughout Paris. The blackout curtains in the rooms and the super comfortable beds make adjusting to the time zone easier. It’s quiet, but both my friend who stayed in another room and I needed ear plugs. The hotel is small, so if someone climbs the stairs past or takes the elevator to your floor, you will hear them easily from your room. You can also hear voices easily, and the house keepers start work around 8 a.m. every morning, so bring ear plugs. You can control the temperature in your own room, which is always nice. The windows open so you can get fresh air. I had a single room and there was just enough space to pull my suitcase inside the door and around the bed to the storage space next to the bed. There is an aisle on two sides of the bed and that’s the room, along with a clean, attractive, compact bathroom. The shower water is hot, but sometimes it fades cold and hot, not sure why. My friend was in Room 103 and the water leaked from her shower down to the lobby for some reason. I’m sure they have that fixed by now. I was in Room 503 and could not get wireless reception from my room on a laptop provided by the hotel or a Droid. I was able to use the laptop available to guests in the lobby, but it had a French keyboard and it was not as convenient as having email at my fingertips from my room. I could get wireless in my friend’s room on the first floor, so I think there is some reason the wireless could not reach my room. One of the reasons I chose the hotel was for the wireless, so that didn’t work out as well as I’d hoped. Also, the Opera subway station is about 4-5 blocks away. You’ll pass a very elegant Starbucks on the way, so it’s convenient to stop and get coffee before you start the day if you’d like. However, note that the subway station is a 5-10 minute walk. There are other stations closer by, but you can’t buy tickets there and there are fewer lines running through those. The Italian restaurant next door has delicious food. I love Italian food and recommend it. The lighting isn’t great, but I noticed the lines outside at lunch on work days, so I know I’m not the only one who likes the food. The hotel offers breakfast. I enjoyed it on 2 days. It’s in the basement and they’ve decorated it in a pleasing manner. I hope the level of detail in this description is helpful to those considering the hotel. Again, for the price I don’t think you can do better than Gramont and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm and Inviting Refuge from the Bustling Streets of Paris”
Reviews.Author: CyberElf60
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Gramont. The staff was superb not only at accommodating requests but extremely knowledgeable about Paris attractions (whether it be restaurants, museums, shopping, or anything else). A special thanks to Sandra and Aurelie, who were both especially warm, gracious, and helpful to us. We stayed six nights at the hotel and would definitely stay there again. The hotel is centrally located and convenient to any part of Paris. I would also recommend the breakfast option; a variety of good food at a reasonable price. The staff at breakfast was also very friendly and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Maria147320
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, had nice size room. Bathroom in some rooms might be small but it is so clean and well maintained that size becomes trivial. Service staff was just superb. Sandra was so helpful and friendly that it seemed she was a longtime friend of the family. Location is excellent. We stayed 4 nights and were extremely satisfied. By the way breakfast was good and price was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Make You Feel Welcomed”
Reviews.Author: CJTravelerTexas
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gramont Opera is a small boutique hotel located a short walk from a number of great restaurants, the Opera Granier, and Galeries Lafayette, the impressive department store which rivals KaDeWe in Berlin. Too, the hotel is a 15 minute walk to the Louvre and is well situated to a couple of metro stops. What makes this hotel so special is the staff, who are committed to friendly, pleasing service. They aim to please, and they do a good job of it. My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a week and by the time we left we had developed friendships with two members of the staff. While small, the rooms are clean, provide the necessary amenities, and have free wireless capabilities. We would certainly return to this French hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Short, But very very sweet!!”
Reviews.Author: forestfever
Reviews.Content: First time I've decided to write a review on here. I have just come back from staying at the Hotel Gramont Opera Paris for a 1 night stay with my Girlfriend. I booked this one based on the reviews here on Trip Advisor and believe me they're all spot on. Often with such great reviews you can often expect too much. Bear in mind the price you're paying, for the location, this is fantastic value & standard. Sandra was very welcoming and helpful, especially with my dodgy French language skills!! Rooms were great quality, I'm 6"3 and I didn't find them small (unlike some of the other reviews I've seen). There was just enough space for two people (we stayed in the double room). Location was spot on. We had a short walk back from le Louvre. The biggest mistake we made was purchasing a day pass for the Metro. Reason I did this was based on another review that indicated that the 10 ticket system wasn't enough. We purchased the day ticket and literally travelled from Garde de Nord to the hotel then from Opera to the Eiffel tower. this hotel is very central and you don't need a day pass! Just use your legs!! All in all fantastic hotel, very friendly and fantastic location!! Stop looking just book this one! you won't find a better one for the same price/location.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home - service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: SuseK
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Paris with friends every year for ten years and this is by far the best hotel of this rating we have stayed in. The rooms are 'compact and bijou' but well laid out, obviously recently redecorated, clean and comfortable. The stand out feature is the friendliness and efficiency of Sandra and her staff; engaged, helpful, friendly and everything done with great humour. Wonderful touches like pastries on arrival, sweets, and the availability of very reasonably priced drinks - wonderful to have a glass of champagne 'at home' after a hard day's shopping and sightseeing. Great location, a most memorable stay. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with a terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: sprouts87
Reviews.Content: With so many choices it was difficult to decide but based on other reviews I was delighted to have picked the right one for a one week stay. In comparison to other hotels the Gramont was quite reasonable but they stand out in their care for their guests. The room was impeccable, very comfortable, well sound-proofed, simply delightful. The staff speaks English and will do anything to help or take care of you, they are great people. Makes one feel a special guest. The hotel is located in the heart of the grand boulevards area but on a quiet side street with metro stations within a couple of minutes walking. The breakfast is a real treat and certainly very, very reasonable by Paris standards. Wouldn't think of staying anywhere else if or when I can visit Paris again. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful and friend staff, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: WhiteFamily144
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were travelling with elderley mother. We booked a dulex room, one single (fold out bed) downstairs and a double bed upstairs a glass sliding door opening to a small patio overlooking the roof tops of Paris. The downstairs room has a bed, fridge and wardrobe and is on the small size but adequate. Upstairs the double room area is larger. The stair case is open and there is no wall seperating downstairs and upstairs. This was of no concern to us but it maybe to others who would like more privacy. We love this hotel for the location, the friendly helpful staff, the breakfast delicious. I would recommend this hotel to all and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A tight space in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: Amazonian
Reviews.Content: There’s one thing you won’t get in Paris without paying a seriously hefty premium, and that’s space. So our room at the Hotel Gramont, in spite of costing £185 a night, was miniscule. There was just enough room for one person to move around the bed at a time, and when my husband opened the bathroom door, he bashed me in the kidneys. That said, we were only in Paris for 24 hours and it is very hard to give an in depth opinion over such a short space of time, especially as you hardly go to Paris to spend time in the hotel. Still, the Gramont is in an excellent location, overlooking a quiet street, and the rooms are pristine and tasteful. The bed was very comfortable and there was free wifi – large hotels take note – in the rooms. The teeny shower-room required manoevering to get around the wash basin, but it was also immaculate and seemed pretty new. Any longer and I think the room would have been just too small, but I believe there are bigger ones in the hotel. We left early, so did not sample breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: wilfyong
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were having our honeymoon in France. For Paris, we decided to stay in the Hotel Gramont Opera. We were very happy with our decision. The staff, Sandra and Aurelie are the best hosts you will ever find in Paris. They are extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating. We stayed in the duplex, which is very charming indeed with a small balcony for us to enjoy our breakfast. We would definitely recommend Gramont Opera to anyone going to Paris and looking for a good place to stay. Thank you Sandra and Aurelie. From Wilfred and Audrey, Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Ideal central location”
Reviews.Author: emmamaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights end of October with my daughter and son-in-law and 2yr old grandson. This is a very welcoming hotel, warm throughout, comfortable beds, friendly staff, Ideal central location. Rooms were very clean, the ones we had were a good size, shower but not bath, fridge and safe. We took the breakfast at 12 euros which was good value and plenty of choice, cereals, croissants, bread, jams, yoghurt, fruit, scrambled egg and sausages, choice of cheese. Buffet style so could help yourself as often as you like. Easy walking distance to Louvre and the Seine, Opera Garnier, Notre Dame, a little further to Eiffel Tower and Arc de Triomphe, Montmartre but walkable or take metro. However busy traffic. Will definitely stay here again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely stay here again! So Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: nalybuites
Reviews.Content: The staff is very knowledgeable about the area and is extremely helpful and polite. They are fluent in several languages, including French (obviously), English and Dutch. The front desk is staffed 24/7 with somebody who is always willing to help. The hotel is in a prime location: right off Blvd. de Italiens (where there are tons of cafes and shops on the way to the Opera House and Galleries Lafayette) and a 10 minute walk from the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming, comfortable and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: janeskinner29
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in a great location and was very comfortable. it had very welcoming and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Smiling service in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: skwirl
Reviews.Content: Based on TA reviews, booked for eight nights. As a former resident of Paris, I knew the area well and chose this hotel in part due to its central location. Entire hotel was quite clean and everyone smiling and friendly. Beds quite comfortable. Had one of the 'quad' rooms which is a conversion of two small rooms into an executive suite with a sofabed -- as a bonus, there are two full bathrooms. A huge bonus for those of us who can't survive without an internet connection, this hotel is fantastic: not only is the wireless service fast, it's FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: GreenGloves09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is closest to the Quatre Septembre metro station (not even 5 minutes walk) but you will find that this means a couple of changes if you are coming from Gare du Nord. The location is very good. It is near to the shops on Boulevard Haussmann, 5-10 minute walk to the Opera & a 15 minute stroll down to the Louvre. It is on a side-street in a residential area, but we still did experience traffic noise every night, presumably from people speeding up the street as a short-cut. Room & shower-room were both as efficient on space as they could be! This is of course to be expected in such a city location, but I personally found this to be too confining after a couple of nights. We did not have the breakfast & fortunately did not wish to use the guest computer in the lobby as it always seemed to be in use no matter what time of day or night we walked past! Overall a good stay. Not cheap, but then Paris isn’t!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located for a Paris visit!”
Reviews.Author: pmdizine
Reviews.Content: One thing I very much appreciated about staying at the Hotel Gramont was their excellent communication prior to our trip. I don't speak French but they had people on their staff who spoke English and would promptly respond to my questions as our time got closer for our trip. They arranged a shuttle for us to pick us up and when we arrived were warmly greeted by the staff. We arrived considerably earlier than check-in time and they tried to get the room ready but it was going to be longer than we could wait. So they checked our luggage for us so that we could go out and spend the day in Paris without care. The room was great! Nicely appointed with free wifi, large, comfortable queen-sized bed, lots of room. I wish we had had more than one night there. The morning we left we had arranged for a taxi to take us to the train station but the taxi didn't show...so the hotel staff gave us a bus ticket free and showed us exactly where to go to pick it up and how to get there, when to get off, etc. and we made it to the train station on time for the rest of our trip. Very helpful. We will definitely stay here again! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CarmiLu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at Gramont Opera on October 15th and 16th 2010. We unfortunately had to cut our trip short to avoid coming back on Tuesday, strike day in Paris. We picked the Gramont after reading all the reviews and also because of the hotel's location. We were not disappointed, it took us 7-8 minutes to walk to the Louvres and walk the most beautiful walk in Paris: from the Louvres, walk through the Jardins de la Tuilerie and keep a lookout for the Tour Eiffel, then cross the Place de la Condorde, stroll down the lively Champs-Élysées and end at the Arc de Triomphe. You'll be saying Ah, Paris too! The hotel, with its welcoming blue entrance, is located on rue Gramont, a few steps from the Opéra de Paris. There are five floors and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Of course they are not big, but that's the norm for European rooms. I believe an obese person will not be able to reach the toilet seat in my room, as there was only a narrow gap between the sink and the wall to access the toilet. If you are obese, make sure you inquire about that all important detail. The room was very clean and cozy. My husband had a hard time sleeping on the first night, as his side of the bed was caving in a bit. My side was fine. This is the only criticism hotel Gramont will get from us. The best part of the Hotel was Sandra, our gracious and lovely innkeeper. She was always available to answer our zillion questions, always in a courteous and lovely manner. She answered every telephone call in the same way. She speaks German, English and French fluently and always welcomes all the guests with a warm and welcoming smile. She made our stay enjoyable, as we felt like family. In my book, she deserves a raise!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: katec62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a friend for several days of shopping and sightseeing. Location is excellent - convenient to the Metro (2 lines) and the Roissy Bus to CDG. Easy walking to a myriad of shops and restaurants, the Louvre, department stores etc, etc.The room was spotlessly clean, the beds AND pillows the best we experienced in our 3 weeks travelling. Well designed bathroom was a huge plus! And as if this wasn't enough the staff, particularly the lovely Sandra, were extremely friendly and helpful at all times. Will definitely stay here again!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoekJill
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris to see Jimmy Buffett in concert at the Olympia Music Hall, and chose Hotel Gramont for its proximity to the concert venue, and also as a result of the rave reviews we had read on TripAdviser. We were delighted with our choice, and are happy to say that the hotel - and its wonderful staff - lived up to its reputation. Sandra, the hotel manager, is the hotel's finest asset. From our first email contact when making our booking, to the checkout after our stay, Sandra was efficient, friendly, and went out of her way to make sure our stay in Paris was memorable. Great restaurant recommendations as well! The hotel facilities are excellent, and catered for all our needs. The rooms are a little small, but are typical of other European hotels in which we have stayed. The continental breakfasts offered a wide choice of fresh fruit, croissants and cheese, and we went back every day for more. We found it worth the price tag of 12 Euros. Hotel Gramont is centrally situated, a few blocks from the Opera and close to the metro station. It is within walking distance of the Louvre. There are lots of good restaurants in the vicinity. We will definitely be back to Hotel Gramont on our return to Paris. Thank you to the staff for a wonderful stay. Joek and Jill Cape Town

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and more!”
Reviews.Author: AddictedtoCruising
Reviews.Content: From reviews of this site my group of 6 women chose Hotel Gramont. Lets just say it was more than we expected from the reviews.This charming Opera district hotel rates at the top. Service is off the scale! Sandra and her staff go above and beyond, you name it and they will make it happen if its possilbe. This is a very old small hotel but you would never know it...rooms are up to date with a modern decor. Yep they are small by US standards but adequate for Europe. They are spotless and in great condition (we had 3 rooms) I was lucky to be on the 6th floor with a balcony. Elevator is small and only goes to floor 5 so you have to carry luggage if on 6th floor and you will do so in a very small winding staircase that adds to the charm. Location is fantastic with 3 metro stops. Opera being the main one that is just about 4-5 blocks on the main road. Hotel offers breakfast and will bring leftover breads to the lobby for anyone to enjoy later in the day. Small bar in lobby offers wine...cheapest we found anywhere! there are hairdryers, irons and umbrellas for your usage if needed. Beds very comfortable and rooms have AC if needed. We stayed over a weekend and Fri/Sat nights can get a bit loud on the street so you may want to close the window and us the AC. This of course can not be controlled by the hotel. Computer in the lobby for patron use, however you willhave to figure out how to use a French keyboard. We cant wait to go back and suggest you give Hotel Gramont a try...you wont be disappointed. We already miss Sandra and her wonderful smile!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful parisian hotel with outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: PeteSA_AUST
Reviews.Content: We could not fault the Gramont Hotel, it's proximity to the metro and important sites was excellent. We had an amazing time in Paris and are very grateful for the wonderful help we were given by the staff, particularly Sandra. Thanks, Pete & Michele (S.A Australia)

Reviews.Title: “Don't think of staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: PhilipWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small and friendly. Set in a historic building, it has been completely refurbished to a very high standard, and done very tastefully. Everything works. The room was small but not unusually so; we have stayed in smaller rooms in capital city hotels. It is air-conditioned and double-glazed, and the bed was very comfortable. A peaceful night's sleep was easy. The staff are very helpful and speak English, but were happy to let me try to use my schoolboy French too. When we sought advice on how to get to the Moulin Rouge, we were advised to take a taxi; this was sound advice and worked perfectly. The hotel is situated within two minutes walk of two Metro stations, making travelling round Paris very straightforward, even for novices. As the centre is relatively compact, then it's worth taking the Metro in one direction, and walking back to the hotel. Don't worry about getting lost because Paris is very well-signposted and the hotel is situated close to the Paris Opera Garnier. The area abounds with superb shops too. The Louvre, Orangerie and Musee d'Orsay are all conveniently situated within a short walk. The Tuileries gardens are superb, and take on a completely different aspect when the sun shines. Be prepared for the traffic. It never, ever stops! Take care when crossing the roads, (as you would anywhere else). Whilst it is possible to hire a taxi or shuttle from CDG airport, we chose to use the RoissyBus which worked perfectly for us, and as it goes directly to the Opera, it delivers you very close to the hotel. (Just make sure you have directions to the hotel from the Opera for this first journey if it's your first time in this area).

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and charming”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel42
Reviews.Content: This small hotel could not be more charming and as an added bonus, the staff was exemplary in their friendliness and willingness to accommodate. me and make sure I had everything I needed even though I was just staying one night. The hotel is in a wonderful central location, beautifully appointed, and has shopping and restaurants in the block. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful memories of our stay at the Gramont”
Reviews.Author: tommy23000
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel Gramont. Sandra and all the staff were most helpful. They all spoke English and gave us great directions, advice and were very attentive to any needs we had. Our room was small (typical) but very clean and updated. Our queen bed was wonderful! After long days of walking, we really appreciated the comfortable bed. The Metro is nearby and very convenient. We would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff makes this hotel stand out”
Reviews.Author: Criftee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the week at the end of September. My husband was in town on business, and I came along just to enjoy the sights and sounds of Paris in the fall. The location couldn't have been any better. Cafes, restaurants, two big department stores, and sites like the Louvre and even Montmartre are all within walking distance. In addition, no matter what time we returned to the hotel, we were always greeted with a smile and a friendly greeting. Everyone at the reception desk was a pleasure to deal with, but Sandra's warm and sunny disposition stood out in particular. She is unfailingly friendly, helpful and caring: a real gem. She is quick to say that it is because she loves what she does, but in all my years of traveling (and I've done a fair bit), I have never encountered anyone so consistently kind and accommodating. One really feels like one is staying with family here, and that is priceless when abroad. The hotel is well situated and comfortable. The staff know the area well and are quick to give recommendations of where to go and eat. The Italian restaurant next to the hotel turned out to be one of our favourite meals in the city! Also, the laptop and free wifi in the lobby, along with the complimentary croissants, were all very much appreciated. Before arriving in Paris, I had made reservations at 2 different hotels because I wanted us to experience two distinct neighbourhoods in Paris. This meant, however, that we had to check out of the Hotel Gramont a few days before flying home. The 2nd hotel was in a good location, but that is about it. The contrast was jarring.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Recommendation for this hotel and staff !”
Reviews.Author: ARTYANGEL99
Reviews.Content: My husband , son and I stayed here for 14 nights during the last 2 weeks of September , 2010. Our stay was a very happy and comfortable one ( yes comfortable beds). The staff are all very helpful and friendly . The Reception staff speak excellent English . The atmosphere at the hotel is very pleasant and harmonious . We will always remember Sandra, the Manager, for her great friendliness, cheerful nature , help and outgoing personality . She is a great asset to the hotel. Thanks also to Antoine , again always friendly and helpful .Aurelia is another bright personality who added her friendliness to our stay . The breakfast buffet is very good with variety and good value at 12 euros , the breakfast staff also are very nice and helpful. Our room was large enough for us to have a comfortable stay in it and the decor is very attractive and tasteful. The hotel is very well situated in the Opera district which is a safe area to stay in and well placed in relation to the Louvre and also the majot department stores . There is a view of Sacre Coeur in the distance from the rue Gramont . There are many nearby places to choose to eat from and a Monoprix very close to the hotel also. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to all and we would love to stay there again . Our overall stay in Paris was greatly enhanced because of our stay at The Hotel Gramont Opera . Thank You to all of the wonderful staff and I give a 5 STAR recommendation ! Au Revoir :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: DOug57_10
Reviews.Content: Good location between Sacre Cour and the Louvre with short walk to many restaurants and transport. Staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful with all your needs and speak English well. Rooms are modern & clean but relatively small (common for Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cat-black
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on 28th and 29th September, and as we came on eurostar we arrived at he hotel by 11. I expected that we would leave our bags and have a wander, but as soon as we arrived we were greated like friends rather than guests. The lady on the desk, Sandra, is so welcoming and friendly. she gave us our key cards, took our details and asked if we would need they key code for the wi fi. She also was invaluable with tips, advise and help. It was as if nothing was too much trouble. I can not recommend this place enough. A hidden gem of Paris. Many thanks for all your help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: crawfordpcv
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I recently stayed at the Hotel Gramont for 12 nights (Aug 30th-Sept 11th) and couldn’t have been more pleased. We went with the Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. I think the main draw of this hotel is the great location and the staff. Sandra., Aurelie and the two gentlemen who worked nights were all fantastic! We were always so happy to come back knowing we’d get a friendly hello and any help we needed. Two amenities we particularly enjoyed were the location and the free internet. The location is superb! Walk 10 minutes south and you’re at the Louvre. Walk 15-20 minutes north, and you’re in Montmartre. The Opera Garnier is only 5 minutes away and there are SO many cafés and places to eat all around the hotel. The free internet was our lifeline home. We emailed and uploaded our photos during our downtime. It was something we really wanted and it worked fantastically. We also stayed in two different rooms. We spent half our time in the Duplex room and half our time in a quadruple room. If you’re trying to judge space, the quad and duplex are the most similar to an American size hotel room. The Duplex room also comes with breakfast included, a definite plus, and has a cute rooftop terrace. We were able to enjoy a bottle of wine outside most nights and thought it was a definite plus to our experience. The quad rooms also come with two bathrooms. We didn’t need them both, but I could see how they would be handy for more than two guests in a room. In closing, this was an amazing experience. We enjoyed ourselves very much at the Hotel Gramont. If you’re looking for something fancy with lots of amenities, then I’d look elsewhere. If you’re looking for a simple, affordable and clean place to stay with amazing customer service, then this is your place. A big thanks to Sandra, Aurelie, and the two gentlemen for our wonderful stay. You really do a splendid job and we had an amazing time visiting your beautiful city. Thanks again for everything! p.s. The pillows were dreamy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: docveiga
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel! Great location, a walking distance to metro, Opera, restaurants, Galerie Lafayette. The room is comfortable and clean. The staff makes the difference. All of them was helpful and friendly. Special thanks to Sandra, the manager, for all her kindness! I'll recommend Gramont Opera to everyone and i hope stay here again. Merci beaucoup!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: pragbov
Reviews.Content: Based on trip advisor reports we booked this hotel. Superb location, easy to walk to places or get a metro. Immaculate rooms, wifi that worked and comfy beds. Staff were all helpful and friendly. Can't fault it and would stay there again. THX to all those before who recomended it.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Great Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: SamuelChoiOnTripAdv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled with her parents and our two boys, aged 10 and 7. The hotel was small but very cozy! It's conveniently located. Places are within walking distance, and if you need to go somewhere far away, a metro station is just down the road. You have choices of eating at small restaurants around the corners who serve a wide variety of cuisines, or going down to the main street to enjoy the atmosphere while dining at bigger ones. Staff and services? We will definitely not say "Good!" as it is not enough to describe them. They are all knowledgeable, kind, and helpful. They tried everything they could to accommodate your needs. Staying here has made our trip even more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay at Gramont Opera”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSly
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for 2 weeks at the Gramont Opera this summer. We rented the apt and a double. Hotel has a wonderful location, walking distance to Opera, many restaurants, Metro stations, etc. Rooms are kept immaculately clean, beds are comfortable and we all felt very much at home for those 2 weeks. Staff is OUTSTANDING!!!! Can not do enough for you, they took care of all our reservations, etc. They are extremely professional and very friendly. We will be back to the Gramont Opera next time we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel, ideal for young families”
Reviews.Author: bmtrivedi
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a brief trip to Paris and had an excellent 2 nights at the Hotel Gramont Opera. I travelled with my parents, wife and 2 year old son and we all comfortably fitted in a Quadruple room. We were pleasantly surprised to find 2 bathrooms in our room plus it was extremely quiet given the hotel's prime location. All staff were outstanding and special mention must be given to Sandra who was a real superstar catering for our every request. I wholeheartedly recommend the hotel and will definitely look to stay there again in our future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: kerry_bulman
Reviews.Content: Hotel very close to all attractions and metro line. An abundance of bars, restaurants and entertainment within 5 mins walking. Very friendly staff - rooms were very clean and comfortable - if not just a little small. Breakfast was great and not to be missed. If coming back to Paris would definitely use this hotel again it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A beatiful hotel with superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: EAM18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights at the end of August. I had chosen this hotel purely based on reading Tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. I knew we would have a good stay when the lady at reception greeted us like friends. She was very happy to speak English with us which made our stay so much easier and she also helped direct us to places we wanted to visit. The hotel is located within 5 minuteswalk of two Metro stations and about 15 minutes walk to the Louvre. (Definitely follow the advice to enter the Louvre via the Carousel shopping centre as the queues for security are much shorter here.) The hotel was gorgeous and looked as though it had recently been redecorated. There were comfortable sofas in the lobby/bar area. Our room was on the 6th floor and was spotless and the shower room was of a good size although it was tricky to keep the shower at the right temperature. The bed was very comfortable as were the pillows. We decided to eat breakfast at the hotel each morning. It wasn't cheap at 12 Euros but I thought there was a good choice for a Continental breakfast. The staff at breakfast were very cheerful but unobtrusive. We were told there was free wi-fi in all rooms but we didn't use it. There was also a computer available in the lobby if we had needed it. Overall a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Je t'aime Hotel Gramont Opera!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy2323
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Paris with my sister and I want to personally thank everyone at Hotel Gramont Opera (especially Sandra and Aurelie) for making our stay in Paris such a wonderful experience! The room was exceptionally clean and cozy – in fact, we'd refer to it as "home" at the end of our days. The location was extremely convenient – you could walk outside the hotel and be at one of many Paris cafes, restaurant and the grand department stores within a few minutes. And whatever we needed – whether it was directions, extra towels in the room or information about the Louvre – Sandra and Aurelie were there to answer our questions at any time and provide the ultimate service. I have never stayed at a hotel where the staff was so charming and accommodating as at Hotel Gramont Opera. I have already told many friends about this unique hotel and hope to visit again some day. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a quieter side street”
Reviews.Author: barb623
Reviews.Content: The Gramont Hotel is a great location on a quieter side street, close to many sites. A 5-10 minute walk to the Opera Metro station which has access to many lines. The room size is not large but very clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and spoke excellent English. We purchased our Paris Museum pass right there and they were very helpful giving us directions of where to go and which metro line to use. There is a lap top in the lobby that we used a lot as our Blackberry didn't work once we arrived. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I would want to stay when in Paris again”
Reviews.Author: AudreyAndy
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reports I wondered if they could all be true and they were. I have been to Paris several times stayed in some of the 'best' 5 start hotels ( work paid !!) but i would only recomend this hotel. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Nothing was a problem. There were three of us and we expected a twin with a fold down bed but we had amazing ajoining rooms facilities very clean beds great and wanted to steal the pillows ( we didn't honest). Everything you could want to see in Paris is within easy access of the Hotel. The two day bus pass was well worth the money and bus stop at the top of the street. However, you could actually walk to all the sights. Thanks to Sandra and co you made our trip a wonderful experience and look forward to seeing you all again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeckyKnoxville
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at the Hotel Gramont for 2 nights. We chose the suite that sleeps 4 and has 2 full baths. Lovely entry and interesting breakfast area. The breakfast buffet was very good. Rooms were very nice and staff is excellent. Everyone was very helpful and helped us with bus tickets and special tips. I chose the hotel based on other recommendations on Trip Advisor. We really like the location, lots of restaurants, close to the Louvre and Opera House. I've already recommended this hotel to my travel agent. You won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic staff, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Bridget70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in August with my 13 year old daughter. We were warmly welcomed by Aurelie on reception. Our room was quiet and very clean with excellent decor and the bathroom and shower were spotless. The hotel was well situated for sight-seeing around Paris and I would have no hesitation in visiting this hotel again. I would also highly recommend the buffet breakfast at 12 euros each. Great selection of foods (breads, cakes, croissants, pain-au-chocolat, toast, cereals, citrus/dried/fresh fruits, cheeses, hams etc). We didn't see any cafes charging less than 10 euros just for a coffee and croissant so the hotel was definitely value for money! I must take this opportunity to say thank you to Aurelie and Sandra on reception for all their help and advice.
