I would strongly urge all visitors to take the time to ask them about directions, recommended restaurants and shops etc. They were lovely and I hope the hotel owners realise what an asset these two ladies are. Two final points: Ask the hotel to arrange a taxi to and from CDG airport. So much easier than trains and metros which were a nightmare after a flight!! Also, August is holiday time in Paris so lots of places (restaurants/shops etc) are closed. Not the best time of year to visit but we still had fun.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL TO EXPLORE PARIS”
Reviews.Author: AfGeorge
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the above hotel with my wife and son for 8 nights in a triple room and we are very satisfied with our selection based on reviews from Trip Advisor. The room was just adequate for 3 but clean, recently renovated,nicely decorated.The greatest advantage of the hotel is the quality of service of the staff who were always kind and helpful and the location which is really great ,very near to metro stations,supermarkets,restaurants and big stores. Highly recommended to anybody visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: MeiMoo
Reviews.Content: Nice room, great location, great value for money. I have stayed there twice this month and have been happy with the service and the room. I will go back there again. Just don't bother taking the shuttle bus, it's a pain if you can afford 50 euro for a cab fare. Too many stops to get to the hotel if you're arriving at night. The daytime staff is very helpful, some night time staff are not.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory hotel at a good location, with a good offer price.”
Reviews.Author: wdinasn
Reviews.Content: Small cozy hotel (approx 24 rooms) with room offers that go as low as 120 Euros at 3rd party accommodation-booking websites. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Sting in the tail”
Reviews.Author: bigbri9
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gramont is well located for a visit to Paris, being within walking distance of many attractions. Our room was adequate without being luxurious (at 200 euros per night I would have expected better). The staff were very pleasant until it came to checking out, when the manager made his first appearance. Unlike his excellent staff, he spoke no english. We were advised that he was adding 200 euros to our bill because we had broken their faulty toilet door in order to get a memeber of our party out of the loo at 2 am! Our protests were to no avail as he had already put the (unauthorised) payment through. Be warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mountven2
Reviews.Content: Really helpful friendly staff, nice clean modern room with A/C. Frig, TV, internet! wine and drinks available downstairs, cafe and bakery around the corner. A bit awkward for metro connections, the Opera station is huge. Be prepared to walk a lot, which is fun in Paris anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: UncleGeno
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself had a very comfortable 3 night stay at the Gramont Opera. The room was a little small but I guess it is typical for a Paris hotel. I would like to mention that the hotel is in a great location, spotless and the staff was very accommodating. At one point while attempting to park my rental car on the street the young man behind the desk walked out to help me navigate the payment kiosk its a bizarre method of payment but that's another story. I noticed in some of the reviews there was problems with noise from adjacent rooms but in our stay we were not disturbed at all. Maybe it was all the wine we enjoyed at lunch and dinner Anyway kudos to whomever trained the staff, they couldn't do enough for us. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This charming hotel was all we could have wished for, and more!”
Reviews.Author: ttethomas
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we experienced great service. We arrived well before check-in, but since the other party had checked out, they told us to relax in their lobby and they quickly prepared the room for us. The room was very clean and the decor charming. Our quad room had 2 bathrooms, both clean and modern, with nice showers. The air conditioning was nice and cold,,,it was very hot the 10 days we were there. Nice quiet street in the opera district, close to food , ATM machine, the metro, McDonalds, Starbucks, and a Monoprix grocery / dept. store. My only request would have been a coffee pot in the room. Small, charming hotel, super helpful staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: brill95
Reviews.Content: There are two things that would make me come back to this hotel - the staff and the great location. Everyone on the front desk was simply excellent - both the day and night staff, they could not have been more helpful and pleasant. It's precisely this kind of service that makes people want to come back to a hotel. The location is also terrific, right next to the Opera and Saint Germain, smack in the middle of the shopping area with some great little cafes around. I had a double room which was spacious and spotlessly clean with a bed that was wonderfully comfortable. The only down point - and I say this with a degree of reservation because this is a three star hotel in Paris - is that the walls are thin and you can hear people in the adjoining rooms - I was lucky to have someone really quiet one night and then TV addicts the next night ! But that shouldn't put you off - this hotel is still good value and free wireless !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bobby99
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice stay of 8 nights at this great hotel. We had a quadruple room (aka family room), which had a double bed (2 singles next to each other), a convertible sofa, two flat-screen TVs, and two full bathrooms. There was also a safe in the room. Everything was perfectly clean and the beds were very comfortable. The staff members spoke perfect English. The hotel lobby had a PC for guests to use for free and a supply of complimentary croissants. The location was great, with a zillion restaurants and cafes a block away on Boul des Italiens. Be aware that restaurant and cafe checks include the tip, despite any waiters' claims to the contrary. The closest Metro station was two short blocks away at Richelieu-Drouot, but if you want to buy tickets with a US credit card, you'll need to go to the Quatre-Septembre station. There are 1, 2, 3, and 5-day unlimited ride tickets available. We were able to go everywhere we wanted with at most one change of trains. Breakfast at the hotel was OK, but I would recommend going out to one of the cafes unless you're on a tight schedule and need to save time. There were a couple problems. One of the TVs lost its signal on our second night and the hotel was unable to get anyone to fix it during the remainder of our stay. The WiFi reception in our room was intermittent, which I suspect was due to a weak signal (WiFi in the lobby worked fine). The room was also a bit noisy, and we could hear kids running around the room above us. There was some noise from the street, but not enough to interfere with sleeping (the hotel is located on a quiet side street, so that helped a lot). Our taxi ride to Charles de Gaulle Airport cost 44 Euros. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to my friends. Sandra, Aurélie, and the rest of the staff were great and did everything possible to make our stay an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel - loved it”
Reviews.Author: margles51
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews on Tripadvisor, I was looking forward to staying here very much with my granddaughter. We were not disappointed. The hotel was lovely - only 24 rooms, with a cosy friendly atmosphere. The staff were always very friendly and helpful. Our room on the 6th floor was the duplex - it was fantastic with our own terrace. The bathroom was very clean, the air conditioning welcome. We both slept like logs. I never heard a sound from other guests once in our room. Breakfast was OK - things did tend to run out and not be replaced though. The only real quibble I have is the strange hairdrier - but so what, when I next return I'll bring my own! I can recommend this hotel very highly indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: d.dowse
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel, and was told immediately by the reception staff, that they had mistaken my reservation, and had to move me to a different hotel. I explained that I did not want this, as I chose this hotel from the reviews on Trip advisor, and I did not want to go anywhere else. The receptionist, then made room for me, and gave me a single room on the 5th floor, which was quite simply the cleanest room I have ever stayed in, it was immaculate. It was also one of the smallest, but adequate, with bed, very comfortable, flat screen TV and minifridge, everything you could possibly want, and the cleanest shower room I have ever seen. It was just lovely. The staff were fab, and very helpful. Thankyou for a very good night. It was also very well placed for restaurants, cafe's the shops and the Opera, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: STSeah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located near a metro, and is also only a 10 to 15 mins walk to Galaries Lafayette and Printemps. It has just been newly renovated and the room was very clean and cosy, and bed was extremely comfortable. Most impressive of all was the wonderful service staff there - Sandra and Aurelie. They were always cheerful and ever obliging, and never failed to brighten our day. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at Hotel Gramont”
Reviews.Author: luvfrance27
Reviews.Content: I would be so happy at the end of the day to get to my room at Hotel Gramont. The room was very quaint, clean and the bed was very comfortable. I would lay down on the bed and immediately fall asleep. (The air conditioning was wonderful too!) The staff were incredibly nice and it felt safe to have 24 hour front desk employees. I have already told friends that when I go back to Paris, I'm staying at Hotel Gramont again. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy....a great choice”
Reviews.Author: Prufreck
Reviews.Content: I selected this as a result of Tripadvisor reviews. I was only there for one night and wanted to be near the Louvre and an RER station. The location is pretty good. It's a 10-minute walk to the Louvre and there are various metro stations in the vicinity. Just near the Opera House (5 mins walk) is the Roissybus stop which will take you to the airport for under 10 Euros. And Galleries Lafayette/Printemps (shops) are also close at hand. Having just come from London (notorious for tiny rooms) I was pleasantly surprised to find my single room comparatively quite spacious. The walls were a bit thin, though, and I could hear the TV and talking in the room next door, which was a bit annoying but not a train smash. I don't know how many rooms they have but it feels like a small, boutique hotel and the staff were very accommodating. Parisiens seem to have a reputation for being unhelpful (although I have never found this) and these guys certainly give the lie to that idea. They speak excellent English and have all the answers. If a one night stay is enough to go on I would definitely stay here again. The optional breakfast (12 Euros) is worth every cent. You'll pay at least 6 Euros elsewhere for a coffee and pastry so I recommend you fill up here.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful Staff, Great Location, Great Rooms and a Great Vacation at the Gramont Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMcLaughlin
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are nothing less than amazing. They are extremely helpful. They are fluent in both english and french. They will assist you with any detail you need help with and provide excellent addition information so that your stay in Paris is nothing less than perfect. We stayed in a triple room which was great for our family of three. Would have worked for a family of four. The beds provided a great sleep. It was very hot in Paris during our vacation but our rooms were air conditioned (better than the Hilton we stayed at in London). You actually felt very comfortable and cool in the room. The bathrooms (as we had two) were great. Showers had good pressure and were actually tall enough for my 6 foot 3 husband. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It was very close to the underground stations, to the Hop on Hop off Bus locations, and many other locations. Just perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Not long enough!”
Reviews.Author: Pana67
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying in this boutique for, unfortunately, only one night. The room was adequate for our needs - especially the two bathrooms that were included in the familyroom - and the handy location to a variety of take-away restaurants which we were in need of as my husband wished to stay in to to watch the World Cup final! We spent the next day exploring the city whilst our luggage was safely secured in the hotel's care. Many thanks to Aurelie for her assistance with our tickets to Disneyland Resort and for the last minute change to our transport to get there! Like many hotels in Paris, there wasn't much room to "swing a cat", but if you aren't staying for many days I would recommend this hotel as it is a good base. Only wish we had more days to experience the service and hospitality of Hotle Gramont and Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for anything more?!?”
Reviews.Author: Stephenjulius
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days at Hotel Gramont, in the duplex room. NEVER have we had such helpful, charming, warm service before and during our stay. Sandra (mgr.) and Aurelie (reception) could not have been more gracious and even though this is hardly an "expensive" hotel (by Paris standards), we were treated as though we were at the Georges V . . . the location is superb, just 5 min. walk to Palais Garnier, 2 min. to multiple Metro stops, and a lovely 20 min. walk to the Louvre. We will ALWAYS come back to the Gramont - just make sure you don't take our room! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel. A very special place.”
Reviews.Author: fishbone96
Reviews.Content: The staff were among the friendliest and most helpful of any I've encountered. They went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. The rooms were spotless and the beds very comfortable. The room was tiny, but we were out for most of the day and evening. Breakfast is a bit pricey given the selection. The hotel is located near many, many restaurants and is within walking distance of big department stores. The Louvre is about a 10-15 minute walk. This hotel is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every aspect!”
Reviews.Author: Julie50208
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Gramont Opera on two different occasions in June, 2010 and experienced excellence across the board. In early June we arrived in Paris with our two small children after 24 hours of missed flights, rerouting, sitting in airports and lost luggage. The manager, Sandra, and her staff were extremely gracious and welcoming, took great care of us and helped us track down our luggage. The room was lovely and very comfortable. We then returned 2 weeks later and were thrilled with the service and comfort once again. This is truly an old-fashioned hotel in it's attention to personal details and needs, with modern amenities such as air conditioning and renovated bathrooms. We will absolutely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ardsguymarty
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to sandra who made our trip very special. We had a duplex room 2 floors with balcony, finished very well and spotless throughout. Never seen a cleaner bathroom in a hotel ! Sandra organised us a new hotel as we could not stay another night, Again she excelled herself, another beautiful place. A credit to herself. Merci beaucoup!! We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value for price”
Reviews.Author: Expat-de-Lux
Reviews.Content: As I didn't plan to visit Paris, but spontaneously decided to go there, all rooms for decent price were beyond 300 Euro, which was out of my price range. I got a non refundable rate at 145Euro. The room was small (which is normal for Paris) but nicely renovated. Bathroom was very clean. This Hotel is a perfect getaway, but not recommendable for stays longer then a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yeehawjunction
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Gramont with my husband and two adult sons. The hotel was very nice and the staff was outstanding. Sandra and Aurelie were friendly and helpful at all times. The location was somewhat out of the way for major attractions, but close to the metro. The neighborhood had nice restaurants that were not as crowded as those in the more "touristic" areas. One of our double rooms was smaller than the other, but clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel, clean, great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: neil_mch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Gramont de l'Opera in May '10. Its location is great, just a 10-15 minute walk to the Louvre, with restaurants and shopping all around. The hotel is small, but the rooms are very comfortable, with wonderful beds, and we didn't notice any street noise at night. Above all, the staff were just incredible. Sandra and Aurelie could not have been more helpful and pleasant. We really felt part of a family. We would definitely stay here again, and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Clackman
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The staff are extremely gracious, welcoming, and helpful. The rooms are not luxurious, but they are ample. Very clean bathrooms. Excellent location near Opera Garnier. I have stayed at the Ritz in Paris, and generally stay in upscale hotels like Covent Garden in London, the Waldorf in New York, and Oriental Mandarin in Hong Kong. I have never had a more pleasant experience in any of those hotels than I had at Hotel Gramont. I doesn't match those other hotels for luxury, of course, and it lacks the amenities of a luxury hotel, but I will definitely stay at Hotel Gramont on my next trip to Paris. For the money, this hotel can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Small is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Rita46
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at Gramont Opera and it is very good value for money. A 3-star hotel with a 5-star service. A nondescript facade does not prepare you for the service and cleanliness inside. Ideally located ( a few minutes walk from LaFayette and Monoprix) it is easily reached by Metro. The hotel also offers airport pick-up. Breakfast is also an option, but there are several bistros/restaruants nearby. The staff at Reception were particularly helpful - be it assistance with the computer, or obtaining a reservation at the famous Bofinger restaurant. Gramont will be my first choice in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Never had service (or sleep) like it”
Reviews.Author: MIGHTY_TIGER
Reviews.Content: We spent a fantastic long weekend with our two boys (11 & 8) at this quaint 'family-run' hotel, located near the Opera. Quad room was spacious, spotless and the beds were extremely comfortable. The staff were great. Nothing was too much trouble (even when their national team had just been dumped out of the World Cup!). It really blew away the stereotypical view that French hotelliers are rude and unhelpful. Cannot praise it enough. The only downer to the weekend was watching England crash out!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: QANYC
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a Quadruple room (there were three of us) and it was actually large given Paris standards. We had three twin beds and they were very comfortable. Prior to arriving, I had emailed with the staff a few times asking some questions and they were very responsive and friendly. And that didn't change when we arrived, they were always willing to help and give advice/information. I wish I could remember the one lady's name, but she was SOOO friendly. Breakfast didn't come with our room (but you can reserve that package if you want) but they often had fresh croissants in the lobby for you to grab on your way out. The hotel was very conveniently located, within walking distance of the Louvre, Gallerie Lafayette and the Metro station. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly little oasis of calm”
Reviews.Author: kerrydoll
Reviews.Content: This is a small (25 bedded) but perfectly formed hotel. Its in the 2nd arondissement, just a 5 minute walk from the Roissybus drop off/pick up point at L'opera. A huge thank you to the lovely Sandra, who was one of the friendliest receptionists I have ever met....always polite, courteous and very cheerful! Its staff are friendly, and seem to genuinely enjoy their work. The place is spotless, and our bed and pillows were so comfortable. Rooms are not huge, but decent sized by Parisian standards. Breakfast was displayed beautifully... choices of meats, cheeses, fresh fruits, cereals, yoghurts, croissants, bread, pain au chocolate etc. Round the corner on Boulevard des Italians is the Gramont Cafe (who have the best french onion soup), and there's a Mono Prix convenience store on the Italians just round the corner too. Best tip....let yourself get lost...the shopsand bistros/cafes are great....and you'll always come across a metro station to get you home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in good location. excellent service”
Reviews.Author: suzyqAustralia
Reviews.Content: good location within walking distance of train station. (although i would not recommend catching train from airport to city. it was a nightmare with luggage!!!) Friendly staff who were very helpful with directions & bookings. Breakfast was good. although this was an extra cost. Had the usual continental buffet plus hot scrambled eggs & sausages. at 180 euro per night, it was the most expensive accommodation we paid for. But this appears to be norm for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Pablo878
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to France and would say that Gramont Opera was a great choice for a hotel. The best part of the hotel was the staff which would help no matter what request you had. The room was excellent especially by European standards. This hotel is rated three stars but is much better than any other three stars I have stayed at that were in a major city. The room was not overly large but by Euorpean standars it was great. The bed was comfortable which is generally not the case in our experience at Europen hotels. It is about a 2 or 3 minute walk to one subway station, and about 5-10 minutes from another subway station. We generally took the subway everywhere as it was less stressfull and we did plenty of walking anyway. The major tourist attractions are not a long walk away but also are not around the corner. We always find that we have to adjust a Europeans idea of walking time to an Americans. We feel that for the money we payed this is a great value. It is not a "value" hotel as it is very classy in my opinion but I feel we got more than we payed for.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, glamorous and trouble-free stay in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: gocjanka
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel at tripadvisor.com and it was a great choice. The location is very good, the staff was ready to help us whatever we needed (and also patient enough to cope with my French:)). We were just delighted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically friendly French hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheChins
Reviews.Content: My mum, sisters and I stayed here for the last May Bank Holiday weekend and we honestly could not fault it. The staff could not have been more welcoming or helpful (or patient with our terrible attempts at speaking their language). We took the quadruple room and although compact, it was perfect for us - clean, fashionable and it had two bathrooms! Though no tea making facilities. OK, the views were not great but it was a good location both for the main sights and the airport bus from CDG. All in all, brilliant value for money. We did not have the breakfast but we're sure it would be have delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Absoloute Perfect Hotel - made our paris trip very memorable”
Reviews.Author: Brighters2009
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to absoloutly anyone. Not only is the hotel absoloutly beautiful and comfortable but the staff are truly wonderful. Our holiday in Paris has been made so memorable, not only because of this beautiful city but because of the wonderful staff who helped in anyway possible. From the very beginning of planning our trip to Paris when we first contacted Hotel Gramont - the staff and in particular Sandra helped me in more ways then one in answering all our questions etc. about this city etc. The rooms are beautiful and spacious and as I was travelling with my mother and partner - the size of the rooms etc. made our stay comfortable for everyone. I hope to return to Paris and stay at this wonderful hotel again. Thank you Sandra & Staff for everything. We will always remember and be thankfor for your advice and help. :) Amy , Lance & Robynne

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes this a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tripaholicstl
Reviews.Content: Sandra and the rest of the staff make Hotel Gramont a great place to stay in Paris. They were so pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Roselind
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Gramont for two days in May and was very impressed by the staff. During my previous visit to Paris, I stayed at the Hotel du Louvre, which rates 4 stars and was very nice, but the hospitality of the staff at Hotel Gramont far exceeded that at Hotel du Louvre. When I arrived by Metro, I wasn't sure which way to go because I had forgotten to bring a map, so I called the hotel and not only did they explain the way, the driver happened to have some time and came to pick me up! I was only a few blocks away and it was so nice of them to go out of their way. The location is very central and after that incident I had no problems with the metro, it is so easy to navigate. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great accomodation, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Leila12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this gorgeous boutique hotel in May 2010 booking out multiple rooms, we did lots of research and this hotel is fantastic and lives up to its reputation. The rooms were a good size, very newly renovated and so beautiful. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in an awesome location - great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: bela492005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently during our first trip to Paris. This was the second hotel we stayed at in Paris. We were definitely happier with this choice! We arrived early and were given a room immediately that was ready - that was really nice. My husband had some urgent work-related documents that he had to scan and email and the staff was extremely helpful in assisting us with that. The room was amazing compared to the room we stayed in previously at a different hotel on the Left Bank. It was a really good size. The bathroom was a good size as well. The room was tastefully decorated and was extremely comfortable. The room was extremely clean - which is so important to me. The bed was comfortable as well. There was a bit of noise from the street from time to time but we still slept extremely well. The front desk staff were extremely helpful, friendly and professional. Everyone spoke English and were helpful in making suggestions of where to go and giving good directions. I would definitely consider staying here again if I return to Paris and would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL - Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bam02010
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 teenage boys and I stayed here for 4 nights in April 2010. We had initially cancelled our planned trip because our flight from Rome had been cancelled due to the volcanic ash. Sandra took my call from Rome airport and made no fuss that we had to cancel. Then, when we finally got a flight the next day, I rang Sandra again and she happily booked us back in - Thank goodness she did because this is a hotel we would not have wanted to miss! The hotel staff were amazing, in particular Sandra and Aurelie. They were so friendly and helpful in so many ways. Aurelie helped us with several bookings including restaurants and even a doctor! The hotel itself was lovely. The room clean and comfortable. Breakfast was very good. I have to say that we learnt that excellent customer service can never be taken for granted or underestimated - the staff were just so friendly and helpful - THANK YOU Aurelie and Sandra, you helped make our visit to Paris unforgettable - we can't wait to come back to stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ashgrove3369
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 2 nights at this excellent hotel, the location, in the Opera District, was perfect. Very close to the 'Open Top-Hop on Hop Off' bus tour start point (just behind the Opera building) which we found invaluable for an overview of all the attractions, even though the queues were very long and we decided not to hop on and off we don't feel we missed getting to know Paris and at 32Euros for 2 days (4 routes) good value. The hotel cannot be faulted, excellent welcome at the reception, very clean rooms (and I am fussy!) comfortable beds, the bathroom is a bit small, bit so what? The hotel is located on a side street which was quiet during the night particularly on the weekend nights, Monday morning it started to get noisy around 6am, but you need to be up early to cram everything in on a short trip. We thought breakfast at the hotel was excellent, a very wide selection of continental foods but also scambled egg, lovely coffee and very reasonably priced at 12Euros, local cafes were asking for 16Euros and there didn't appear to be the selection we had in the hotel. One big bonus on the trip was the journey from the airport, I had previously read on Tripadviser about the Roissy Bus, this leaves terminal 2D Gate 11 at the CDG airport and drives straight to the Opera district, no stops, so you don't have to worry about where to get off. The hotel is a short walk, around 5 minutes, from the drop off point. You can also catch the return bus from the same spot back to the airport, although on the way back it will stop at all the terminals. The cost is 19 Euros return and definitely worth it. A couple we met had 2 metro changes and stood for the journey with their cases, not ideal. It was our first visit to Paris together so we had to cram a lot in and there is a fair bit of walking so flat shoes everytime. There are plenty of bars and cafe/eateries close to the hotel, including Italian, Chinese, Japanese, obviously French, and even a McDonalds, which might keep the kids happy. Must say it was on the expensive side, 16Euros for a coffee and a beer, buy bottles of wine, they are much cheaper.All in all a great trip and looking forward to returning there. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sneakers17
Reviews.Content: Staff was so helpful and friendly. No problem with English. Walking distance to alot of restaurants and attractions. Modern, clean rooms & lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, and clean, comfortable and nicely presented rooms!”
Reviews.Author: dolcevitabella
Reviews.Content: The Gramont Hotel is very centrally located...close to most tourist sights, easily accessible via Metro. Staff speaks excellent English which is handy for us, who speaks no French! Aurelie and Sandra were very helpful and friendly. We were very grateful to Sandra for changing us to a better-layout room to accommodate for the extra rollaway bed, and allow us to be more comfortable during our 5 night stay at your hotel. Breakfast is OK, however, we would suggest a simpler breakfast option to be added, which is for those who just want to have a coffee and a croissant. Rooms are very clean, size is adequate, and they are tastefully decorated.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we've ever had in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Coopers-2425
Reviews.Content: We're two adults, and a 12-year old and 10-year old, and stayed in a family room. This has very comfortable twin beds and a sofa bed, two modern and two spotlessly clean ensuites. The hotel is on a little side street near the Opera and is unbelievably quiet - almost hard to believe you're in Paris. It's a very short walk to the metro (we used Quatre Septembre) and, should even a two-minute walk be too exhausting, there are a couple of nice cafes en route. There's also a very good looking Italian restaurant next to the hotel, but we didn't try it. If the Metro isn't your thing, then walking is fun. We walked back from Montmartre one night, and walked down to the Tuileries. Lots of interesting places to see! It's a great location. The tour buses (we used the L'Open Tour, on Sandra's recommendation) go from Rue Auber, a few minutes' walk away and are a very good way to get around. Breakfast is downstairs and is very good, or can be delivered to your room. There's a bar in the reception area and mini-bar in the room. Reception has free WiFi and a laptop for visitors to use, and I think there was ethernet in the room. As well as speaking excellent English for the moments when my high school French proved inadequate, Sandra and the team on reception were always incredibly helpful. In short, next time we visit Paris there will be none of the normal "where shall we stay" business. We will be delighted to return to the Hotel Gramont.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DeltaKilo24
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful gem of a hotel in a nice section of Paris! We will definitely stay at this hotel when we return. The first thing that sets this hotel apart is the staff. They were all extremely helpful and friendly and they went out of their way to help us have a wonderful stay. All the staff speaks good English. Because of the recent disruption in flights to Europe (due to the volcano) our original travel plans were scrapped. When it became clear at the last minute that our flight would actually depart Boston and we would make it to Paris, we hurriedly booked a one night stay at a hotel and we chose Hotel Gramont Opera. We were afraid to commit to additional nights just in case our flight got canceled again. Upon arrival in Paris, we checked in and found it to be a wonderful hotel. We explained the situation and they worked with us so that we could stay for our entire trip. The hotel is delightful. The rooms are quite spacious by European standards and they are very clean. The bathrooms appear to have been recently renovated. The hotel is located in the Opera area which has many restaurants and cafes and some good shopping. Be sure to visit nearby Gallery Lafayette! There are several nearby Metro stops including Opera which is a larger station with good access to several lines. As an example, the trip on the Metro from Opera to the Louvre is only a couple of stops. We stayed in two rooms, one was a triple, one was a quad. Both rooms were clean and spacious and the beds were comfortable. If you do stay here, I highly recommend you take the Roissy Bus to and from the airport (Charles De Gaulle). The Roissy Bus stops at Opera and you will have a short walk to the hotel. Although you can make the same trip on the Metro, you will have to change at many stations and you will have to carry your luggage up and down many flights of stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Meticulously clean and incredibly gracious staff”
Reviews.Author: tomlarue
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the wee hours of the morn, and were so pleased upon arrival - more like a boutique hotel at a budget price. The room was not large, but extremely clean and the bed was oversized and very comfortable. The front desk staff was exceptionally accommodating and patient with helping us onward in our attempts to return to the UK, making calls and searching the web for connections. I would have like the breakfast to be a part of the room price, but the staff set our croissants and rolls in the lobby every morning for guests to partake anyway. Also out the front door to the left, and left at the next 2 corners we found a mom & pop cafe bar with scrumptious goodies and great coffee (3 minutes walk from hotel).

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i have stayed in for a long time and a team of superstars that will come to your rescue!”
Reviews.Author: SimonMSwansea
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful small hotel in Paris, spotlessly clean and very comfortable with a team that would give the top hotels in the world a run for there money. Sandra and Aurelie to name just two were superb. This was one of the most comfortable beds i have slept in and i have stayed in a lot of hotels for business. The staff made my family very welcome and it made for a perfect visit to Paris. We ate breakfast in the hotel each day because it was nicer than the cafe's. If we thought this hotel was good during our stay then we had no idea until the last day (Thurs 15th April) when we where due to checkout. Like the rest of Europe we got caught in the disruption caused by the volcano and our flight was cancelled. Sandra, Aurelie and another lady came to our rescue. Between them they cancelled the airport transfer and reserved us a room. They then set about phoning the airlines and eurostar for options. When it became clear these options were logged jammed and we could be stuck for days they helped me and my family (3 kids) book ferries and hire cars and overcome many hurdles. As a direct result we got home on Friday (only 1 day late) and everything that was booked worked seamlessly. As the days have gone by and we have watched the news we have looked at each other and thanked our lucky stars that we booked the Hotel Gramont. To Sandra, Aurelie and everyone else at the Hotel Gramont we owe you a big thank you, your are Superstars!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, close to everything and very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: cartwright21
Reviews.Content: We made our first trip to Paris and it is a beautiful city, the most beautiful in the world. Staying at Hotel Gramont Opera was a great decision. My husband checked its previous reviews and decided on this hotel due to its proximity to everything there is to enjoy while in Paris and to the hotel reviews in general, especially friendly staff and cleanliness. The staff is so wonderful, helpful, nice and generous it's amazing! The rooms were small but very clean and cute. The beds are very comfortable especially after a day of sightseeing. The hotel is walking distance to everything and also very close to the metro. Thank you to all the staff at the Hotel Gramont for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “My reference hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Fabi0_fr0m_Italy
Reviews.Content: I have spent four nights at hotel Gramont and I'm very satisfied of my stay. I was alone in a single room. The hotel is small but has been recently renowed and furnished with taste. Also the room furnished with taste and with all the comfort anyone need. The service is very good and the room clean. I had breakfast too who offers a lot to begin at the best the day. In reception room a computer is available for free: I daily checked my email and I have aldo printed the online check-in of return flight. The location is great, two minutes walking from underground station (Quatre Septembre) and five minutes walking from Opera. The area is full of restaurants and shops. You can reach Printemps and La Fayette with a little stroll. Also Place Vendome is within a walking distance. Last but not least the cordial and friendly staff. Sandra and Aurelie was very very nice, helpful, full of suggestions and smiling, they feel like at home, like a friend. I have been in Paris for Whitney Houston concert who has been cancelled at the last moment. Aurelie has been very very nice, sweetly attentive to help me to have the refund of the ticket. Last day there has been also a strike of train worker and she was ready to inform me about alternative transports to airport. Together with the wonderful beauties and monuments in Paris, they are part of my happy memories of the holiday. I will comeback in Paris because I love this city, I have a lot to vist again and I will comeback to Hotel Gramont to call in on Sandra and Aurelie and have another pleasant stay. I suggest this best value hotel to everybody. Fabio - Italy

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: hufs
Reviews.Content: I spent a few days in Paris just before Easter with my family and some friends. I found the Gramont Opera Hotel browsing through Tripadvisor; the hotel is situated in a live and central area, close to metro and RER. The first contact was very good and I received quickly every information that I need. At the arrival we felt immediately at home! The personnel is extremely kind and helpful on all occasions. The room we've got is large and well furnished, in particular with huge and comfortable beds; the bathroom is clean and fully equipped. Since the hotel is located in a secondary street the place is also very quiet. The breakfast is served in a nice room and the buffet is remarkably appetizing and generous. To conclude, Paris is an extraordinary city, but coming back to Gramont Opera Hotel in the evening has always been a pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Budget gem in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: JsKorp
Reviews.Content: Our daughter is living in Paris so we wanted a place nearby. We selected Hotel Gramont mainly based on tripadvisor since it was not in the 2009 Michelin. The hotel is walking distance from the Roissy airport bus. We arrived at about 8:30 AM to a warm greeting and an apology that our room was not yet ready! The room was small by US but average size by Parisian standards. The hotel has been recently refurbished with good soundproofing, really suberb heating (silent, responsive) better than even expensive hotels, clean, and quiet. Although some cars and motorbikes go down Rue Gramont, this is rare at night; it is usually so quiet that the main noise is the footsteps of pedestrians. Less than 100m from the 8 and 9 metro lines and 150m from the Opera station so there are about 5 metro lines close by. Breakfast is generous in a barrel vaulted cellar. The main feature, however, is Sandra, ever helpful, kind, polite, knowledgable, and truly interested in the welfare of her guests. She is actually German so she speaks excellent English and German in additon to French. PLEASE IGNORE THE REVIEWS MADE PRIOR TO DECEMBER 2009! The hotel has, as noted, been completely refurbished and seems to be under new management.

Reviews.Title: “The best 3 star hotel in Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rhebon
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend in the middle of March for 3 nights at the hotel. We choosed it because of the good reviews. Well, if you want to have a charming little hotel in a perfect location with a very friendly and helpful staff...this is the place you should stay!!! You should not expect a 5 star hotel, because that is not what you will find...it is still a 3 star hotel, but probably the best 3 star hotel in Paris and way better then most 4 star hotels in Paris. I f you think the price is too high...well Paris is just an expensive city and maybe there are other cheaper hotels but probably not so clean and nice...But let me describe it a little bit more detailed :-) Location: The hotel is in a quiet small street...a lot of cafes, brasseries and restaurants are just around he corner and they are all not too expensive with good food....and for those who don't like French food...a Pizza Hut and a Mc Donlds is just 3 minutes away :-) You walk about 10 minutes to the Louvre and metro stations are also really close!!! The area is very safe and you should not have a problem walking during the night around there. Rooms: The rooms are not very big, but everyone who was in Paris before knows that this is normal in Paris...you can't expect a big room with chairs and a sofa like in the United States for example, but the room is very clean and knew...the beds are good to sleep in and when you really want a bigger room...just get a triple room then you have a sofa and more space :-) You also should to try to get a room in an upper floor because even when the street is really small and the windows are sound proofed you still can hear a little bit of the streets, but not too much so don't be worried about it :-) But on an upper floor you would probably here nothing at all...also try to get a room number with a 01 or 02 ending...just like 401, 402 oder 501, 502 because they are at the end of the hallway where you won't here anyone. Hotel: It is small with just 25 rooms but that makes it charming...you have a laptop at the lobby with free internet access and also free wifi in the hotel. There is no pool or fitness center or anything else to do in the hotel but in city like Paris you don't need things like that. Food: The breakfast is wonderful. You should not forget that it is a really small hotel and normally French people don't eat that much breakfast but what you get in this hotel is really great...juice, milk, tea, coffee, hot chocolate...fruits, scrambled eggs, bread and a lot more!!! We really like this place and when you want something special...get the Duplex room...it has a nice balcony to sit on...we had the chance to take a look at it and it is really, really nice....perfect for couples!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and stylish in a quiet , convenient street.”
Reviews.Author: sevenstiles
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend staying at the Gramont. Paid a little more than we usually do but we expected to for Paris. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The room was small but attractive and well planned with a large shower and a very comfortable bed. Everywhere was spotless. Ate breakfast at a cheap cafe down the road which was a useful economy. The location is in a quiet street and there was no disturbance of any sort. All in all we were delighted with the hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and amazingly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wevorys
Reviews.Content: My daughter, 21, and I stayed here for three days, 2 nights. When we arrived an hour before official check in, our room was not ready, so we were offered croissants and a beverage while we planned our itinerary for the day. The lovely Sandra was so helpful, and friendly and we felt that we would have spent that time anyway getting ready to head out for the day. Because the room was not ready, we were upgraded to a superior room (vs the standard we had booked.) I don't know what the standard would have been like, but the upgrade was quite spacious, very comfortable beds,and the bath was on the larger side with a larger shower, spacious sink area and toilet. The flat screen TV was nice, but we didn't watch much TV. The hotel is recently remodeled and was very clean We also had a spacious walk in closet that was more than adequate for our luggage and belongings. Over the next several days all of the staff were welcoming and friendly, but Sandra stood out (especially b/c she was generally on the day desk) . She always had a cheery disposition, was very helpful with restaurant recs, booked our show at Moulin Rouge, and generally offered to be of help whenever she could. We truly felt like we had made a friend. If we were to return to Paris, I would not hesitate to stay here again. Also, the hotel w as very convenient to 3 metro stations and within walking distance of a lively shopping and restaurant area. It is also close to the Opera House, one of the significant sightseeing sights in the city. We felt that that value (119 E/night) was excellent. My daughter had brought her laptop with her and loved the free wi fi in all the rooms and the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: soluckyme
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gramont in February with my daughter. The staff, particularly Sandra and Aurelie were so helpful, pleasant and able to give great advice on attractions and help with directions. The room was lovely, newly refurbished, and very clean.The bed was very comfortable and had nice quality linen. There is a very good wi- fi connection which is free. The hotel is very well located, within minutes of the opera, and main boulevardes, and walking distance of the Louvre, Notre Dame and many of the landmarks. Metros are also close by. I would recommend eating breakfast at one of the many patisseries that are nearby, so that you can sample as many of the local pastries as possible during your stay, although there were complimentary croissants on offer every day at the hotel. Perfect place to begin your Paris adventure every day. Hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: daka9901
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. All the hotel staff were so friendly - really made us feel welcome (and made a big deal of my husband's birthday!) Room was lovely - bigger than I was expecting for central Paris - newly decorated, and was spotlessly clean. Location is great, really close to two metro stops. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Our new home when visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ingermany
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gramont is what we would call in the US a boutique hotel. Is is newly renovated and charming. The breakfast area is an old wine cellar and the breakfast is just wonderful. The rooms are well appointed and small which you would expect in the heart of Paris. Comfortable beds, internet and TV after a hard day walking the streets of Paris. The staff was great, all spoke perfect English and treated us as family. Who ever said Parisians were rude never visited the Hotel Gramont. I thin the best thing about the hotel is where it is located. You could not ask for a more centrally located place in Paris for the price. Walk to the Louvre, Orsay, Notre Dame, you name it, or take the Metro which is easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: KLF75
Reviews.Content: We really love the Hotel Gramont Opera. It has become our go-to hotel when in Paris. Sandra is so helpful and friendly and really makes us feel welcome. The hotel is charming and comfortable with updated bathrooms. It is in an excellent location with metro stops close by. I would recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Touch and Central”
Reviews.Author: colmflo
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in paris in the Gramont Hotel. The hotel is ideal for a leisurely weekend in Paris. Its position beside the Opera House (5-10 mins) is perfect for the Airport Bus and the Open Top bus Tours around the city. ( Get the Airposlight and our bags were minded for us back in Gramont. We had a triple room which was big enough for 2 but would probably be a tight fit for 3. The 3rd bed is a fold-out and the WC quite small. The surrounding streets are safe and have plenty of coffee/food/beer options but its location means that prices are steep. Beers at 9euro and 6euro coffees in normal enough places were a bit much but you learn to shop around. There is a nice little local bar around the corner from the Gramont (Left and first left outside the front door, for an early drink coming back form a day trip or before leaving in the evening.) The 2 girls Sandra and Aurélie that we met were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The breakfast looked good and at 12euro pp is actually value for money compared to bistros in the area. Overall, I would definitely recommend the Hotel for a similar short weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a Perfect City”
Reviews.Author: Leoneva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one weekend in Feb and had an excellent time. The room was spacious with a lovely balcony, and after spending the day exploring the city, we had a wonderful sleep at night. The hotel is within walking distance to most sights but with a metro station close by, it is easy to travel if you want to venture further out. I have to mention that the staff at the hotel are exceptionally friendly and go out their way to make you feel at home. The only thing we regret is that the weekend was over so quick and we didnt get to see everything we wanted so we are already planning another stay in Paris and at the Hotel Gramont.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for families with babies”
Reviews.Author: LondonHiro
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly and kind staff, good location and now fitted with mini bar!! Good value. I'm sure that I would revisit the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Distinctly average, noisy and cramped”
Reviews.Author: TonyBasil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Gramont Opera for a short winter break. Chose it because of the central location and positive reviews on TripAdviser. Have stayed in many central Paris hotels over the years, this one is distinctly average, noisy and cramped. Good points, the décor is fresh, rooms are clean, staff efficient, breakfast at €12 is better than average and served until 11:00 am if you want a lie-in. However all rooms face onto Rue Gramont. Traffic purrs along the street during the day but at night is less frequent and therefore much more noticeable, buzzing scooters noisily echo all night in the canyon between the tall buildings, dust-carts clatter at 5:00 am and tour buses congregate for pre-breakfast pick-ups. The rooms are roughly double-glazed but windows are old and ill-fitting so ear-plugs are recommended if you want a night’s sleep. The rooms themselves are adequately equipped, clean and well serviced with comfortable beds and decent linen. Provided you like living in a very confined space! Submariners and the little people will love it. There was hardly any room around our bed, opening the door to the bathroom completely blocked off access from one side of the room to the other. The bathroom was the smallest I have ever experienced in a hotel, the lavatory was tucked under the wash-basin and unless you have the agility of a gymnast you will find bathroom activity something of a challenge. Entrance to the wardrobe space and safe was via a narrow gap in the bedroom wall, it contained some shelves and a hanging rail. However it was unlit so we groped in the semi-dark for clothing or use of the safe. How anybody of above medium girth could access the wardrobe I do not know. We were told that all rooms are fitted only with showers so if you want a bath forget it! Check the photographs of the hotel internals on the various websites and marvel at the effect of the wide-angle lens!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value for money”
Reviews.Author: shazlou
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Gramont.Sandra and Aurelie were very friendly and helpful. The hotel has been beautifully refurbished and is tastefully decorated-warm and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in a modern yet stylish establishment. It was also well placed for all major sight seeing attractions. Hope to return one day !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just a Paris Special”
Reviews.Author: lillas007
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 8 wonderful days at the Gramont. I will make any excuse to visit Paris just to return here! It is simply perfect and Sandra and Aurelie were such a help. My single room was well equipped and quiet and the location superb. See you soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: garretlcy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. Friendly staff really helped us out alot with reservations, language, directions, even photos on my camera and using the computer. They also came to fix a clogged sink in about five minutes. Very good! The location was pretty good and was very close to most main attractions and also pretty close to a subway line for getting around other parts of the city. The rooms were very clean. Rooms were fairly roomy and nicely decorated. Very elegant and pretty. Only real downer was the price was a little more than we wanted to spend, but worth it in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: travelbug56Miami
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days w/ a friend visiting paris. The staff is extremelly friendly and helpful (all speak very good English). Sandra and Aurelie are great. The rooms are spotless and charming. Yes, it is small, but it is Paris. We had enough room for 2 girls cloths. The breakfast was really good and we tought was worth to pay 12 euros for it. The street is very quiet and has everything that you need a walking distance. The italian restaurant next door is also great. I definetelly recommend this hotel if you don't want to spend a lot for a great stay in Paris. Oh, BTW the internet works great and there is a computer in the lobby for free use. The internet is free too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RugbyFanHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gramont first for two nights and then two days later, returned for two more nights. we had to change our plans after we checked in the first time, and the hotel management was extremely accomodating to allow us to change, even though we had already booked the full 6 nights there. The hotel also was very helpful with our change of plans, printing out boarding passes, etc. The location was excellent in terms of proximity to restaurants, the Opera House and the bus to CDG. It was also ideally situated for access to the Metro, The room isa little small but very comfortable, free wireless that worked with no problem, and in February, suitably heated. It is definitely some place that we would recommend to others (and already have) and we would stay again. It made our trip one of most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Cabamaru
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night during a weekend break in Paris. Sandra at reception was very nice and friendly. We arrived earlier than the check-time with the intention to leave our luggage there but instead she arranged for a room to be prepared quickly for us! Good location, very near the Opera and 10min walk from the Louvre. The room was clean and very nice. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ALD.forest
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well located near metro, shops, restaurants, attractions. Lady on reception was very friendly. They were very obliging when we requested to swap to a quieter room (higher floor). Rooms are quite compact but nicely decorated and very clean and comfortable. Hotel surprised me on my birthday by leaving a birthday message and cake in our room. Lovely touch. Good breakfast spread.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: IM_sl
Reviews.Content: We decided on the hotel after reading the reviews on this site. I knew we were on to a good start when our Paris Shuttle driver said that the area we were staying at was a great one. We managed to get a slightly earlier check-in and were (thankfully) given a room on the top floor. The room was clean and since it was recently renovated, everything was in tip top condition. The only gripe was that the room was on the small side and we had some difficulty with placing 2 huge luggages plus 2 other roll ons in the room but this is not unusual in Paris/Europe. The hotel is located on a quiet street so you did not get the noise from much traffic or pedestrians. Other than a few drunken youngsters screaming as they walked down the street on the weekend, overall peace was much desired. The hotel was within walkiing distance to most major areas: Lourve (abt 15 mins), Opera and the major dept stores (10-12 mins), We even walked to The Sacred Heart which took us a bit longer but was a leisurely walk through quaint and quiet streets. Another great thing about the location was that there is a supermarket 3 mins away and also a whole street of Japanese/Korean/Chinese restaurants a block away. Although there is a Metro station near the hotel, it's an unmanned station; meaning if you needed to buy carnet of tickets or to buy a ticket to Versailles, you need to walk to the Opera station about 10 mins away to buy it from the counter. The staff were helpful and friendly, Sandra was of course as warm and efficient as everyone here said she was. The other female staff (sorry didn't get her name) helped us call for a doctor and to translate when my partner fell ill on one of the days. Reception staff was always warm and we always felt safe when we returned. However, the housekeeping staff could do with more smiles since they were a direct contrast to their colleagues at the reception. All in all, it's a nice hotel in a lively and safe area. We would stay here again if we were in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, clean, well-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinOwl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It is elegant, freshly refurbished, clean and cosily comfortable. All the staff we met were most obliging and helpful. Well located close to the famous Opera, it is within reasonable walking distance of the Seine and most Paris attractions. One suggestion for improvement - they could have some current films on-demand and more English language TV channels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vakbroeder
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nightd with our two children to explore Paris. The Gramont was great and the staff was friendly and more than helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: travely13
Reviews.Content: We only stayed there for one Night but everything was perfect. The Staff was so very helpful with every single detail from giving advice how to explore the City the best way to where the best Restaurants are and a lot more. The Hotel is at a very good location maiing it easy to expolre everything by walking if you have the time and effort to do so. The Rooms had a normal size for Paris and were very clean. The Breakfast Buffet was huge and there was a large selection of various Breads, Cereals, Cheese, Jogurts and a lot more. I will definitely return to this Hotel and can only recommend this Hotel! Thank you so very much for making this stay unforgettable, Sandra!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staffs, great location”
Reviews.Author: ArvinLee
Reviews.Content: the hotel is perfectly located, 10-15 minutes walk from the Opera, Printempts, Galleries Lafayette and 5 minutes frm the Metro. when i checked in, Sandra was very friendly and helpful, ang got my room ready, room as what as expected in a 3 stars hotel in Paris sizewise, small yet very comfy for 1 person. Good bed, comfortable pillows. room was tastefully decorated. Croissant and Chocolat au pain in the lobby in the evening was a nice touch. the only trivial inputs perhaps about noise level as was mentioned by previous reviewer, on both saturday and sunday morning i was awaken by loud noises, either from people moving stuffs around or from the cleaning service. breakfast was good value. 12 euro for croissant, bread, cold cuts, scrambled eggs, sausage, cheese, coffee, juice, cereal, yoghurt and fruits, that's good value!! free wifi!! so in short, i enjoyed my trip and looking forward in staying in this hotel once again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in the perfect Paris location”
Reviews.Author: froglett83
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Gramont Opera! The location was perfect, being so close to the tourist attractions like the Louvre was great, as we could walk everywhere. The staff were really lovely, all actually interested in talking to us, which was nice, as sometimes in bigger hotels you can feel a bit anonymous. We loved the rooms, they were beautifully decorated and clean (and the beds were very comfortable). The only thing I would say is that we would have preferred a double bed (we got two singles pushed together - but we did get this at other hotels in France - so maybe just a cultural thing?!?) All in all would highly recommend for someone looking to stay in the centre of Paris and wander the streets looking for great food/sight seeing. Thanks again to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Total Class,comfort and convenience...A Home Run all they way!!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaArtlover
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Paris and from the moment we arrived, the staff was welcoming and efficienty helping us to get comfortable in their lovely hotel. We were there to explore Paris, and this proved to be a tremendous location. The Opera House is magnificent to behold and it's neighborhood is filled with restaurants, cafes, movie theaters, shopping and it is very connected to all forms of transportation. The Hotel Gramont Opera is very attracive,recently renovated and they have attended to all of the details that make travellers feel at home. The rooms are very attractive, clean, quiet and comfortable. They have free wi-fi, flat screen TV, and hair dryers. Housekeeping keep they rooms very clean. The Front Desk could not have been more accomodating, from directions, information, stamps.. were even able to purchase museum passes right there! We would most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “very good choise”
Reviews.Author: Tester101
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel the perfect choise for my trip: the position is a great value, because it is in downtown Paris, near to metro and bus station and very close to the shopping area. The Hotel is very charm with a very pleasent style . The staff is unique: very gentle and kindly, they try to solve all your visit problems. My average opinion is very good. I go in Paris for my work, and I think I will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Jewels_Gva
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, nice rooms, quite bigger than the usual standard in Paris, with tasteful decoration. The staff is very friendly and helpful and they really get out of their way to help you and make sure your stay is comfortable. Both our room and the room of our friends were of very good standard, with modern utilities (flat screen tv, new bathroom amenities) while being affordable. Location is very convenient with 2 subway stations nearby. Do not hesitate to choose this hotel for your next trip in Paris! The Gramont will become our home away from home when in Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Gramont Opera Paris
HotelInfo.Address: 22, Rue Gramont, 75002 Paris, France
